Reviews.Title: “AC and Heating”
Reviews.Author: guv249
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location close to the lake and parks. Also easy to get to the Red and Orange line. The rooms are comfortable but the cooling and heating system is not regulated by the guest. It is one unit and the hotel decides if AC should be on. I checked in at 2:30pm and the room was 76 degrees. It was like that most days out of my 10 day stay. At night with the window open (and all the street noise coming in) the room would get down to 72 maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: SC79_10
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on here, I didn't have hugh expectations, however the hotel was comfortable, clean and in a good location which is all we really wanted given that we weren't expecting to spend much time there. I think it is a good base from which to explore Chicago - we could walk most places easily and although a fair distance from the Magnificent Mile we did walk there from the hotel. We also walked to the Field Museum area and the view of the skyline from the museum area is fantastic(I would recommend). Our room and bathroom weren't huge but were perfectly manageable and most importantly clean. The bed was large and very comfortable. Our only slight problem was the noise from the fridge which did keep us awake (although jet lag probably didn't help either) but we got used to it after the first night. Having said that, it was still useful to have a fridge in the room so we could store drinks. We were fortunate to have a view of Grant Park from the room which was great. The staff in the hotel were friendly and efficient. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location, Particularly for Museum Campus and Loop Attractions”
Reviews.Author: pwallace67
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient overall. Granted, it's not in the Mag Mile area, but I actually think that is a plus rather than a negative. We did not use the hotel shuttle, as we found the Chicago transit system to be quite handy. The nearest L station (Roosevelt) is a little bit of a walk, but there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, and it takes you to the streets where you can catch the train. I strongly suggest buying a transit pass to be able to hop on and hop of the trains and buses. The Museum Campus is not really within easy walking distance, but it's a very easy bus ride. The hotel shuttle did not really fit our schedule, but no complaints, because Chicago public transit is great. The hotel staff was helpful. Given that the hotel does not currently have dining, we were especially grateful about the detailed directions concerning the options that were within walking distance. Our one and only issue that was not quite perfect was that, the first day we were there, the heat was on even though it was a rather warm day, but I think that was just a function of how unseasonably warm things were. It's an older property, and the heating and cooling system is probably not as sophisticated as a fancy new place, but we still did okay, and we did need the heat when things cooled down some. So much of the discussion of Chicago tourism focuses on the Mag Mile, but honestly, I think that the Loop and South Loop have plenty going for them, and somehow, it does not seem quite as cookie-cutter touristy as the things further north on Michigan Ave. seem to be. This place is perfectly fine for folks who are used to mid-level accomodations. Don't expect to be pampered, but they were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 14 year old daughter here for her spring break 2012. We didn't like the hotel at all. Room to small, much smaller than pic's on website, shower was very small and glass door on shower would not close tight so water was all over floor each time. Air didn't work, we reported it, man at 2 in the morning was mad at front desk and gave us another room but that air was even warmer. Our daughter's nose bled from how warm the room was. There was no microwave as we were told over phone. Basically it was just an awful experience. What was really scary is they told us to just open the window. We were up 11 floors, our daughter is older so we were able to do that but what if other's with small children were told that and while they were sleeping the kid fell from the window? Just fix the air people. And while doing that fix the pool so people can get their money's worth because it was working when we booked there or we wouldn't have. Oh one last thing the sheets had not been changed because after daughters nose bleed I took sheets off that morning and say a huge stain on the end of sheet-the part that was tucked under and before that we noticed curly hair on sheet as we were inspecting bed. The hair was middle of bed and we had never been in bed yet, nasty, just plain nasty

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneCWebsterNY
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday 3/16/12 for St. Patrick's Day weekend. Although we had a reservation and had arrived close to 2pm, our room was not ready until 4pm. However, the concierge directed us to places to go for a drink or for lunch. His recommendations were helpful and we ate at a pizzaria while we waited, which was awesome. The room was larger than I had thought if would be, based on past reviews I had read of this hotel. It was clean and had everything we had wanted, a king size bed, refridgerator and a smoking room. Througout our stay we were assisted with transportation, dinner recommendations, etc. I had asked for a sewing kit and it arrived at our room in under 5 minutes. We were constantly asking for various things and were directed appropriately to stores, attractions and restaurants. We used the taxi service to get around and were assisted by hotel staff in obtaining a taxi throughout our visit. The hotel shuttle was also available. The pool and rooftop area were incredible. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeterManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: I guess the danger here is not going over the top - it was rubbish/it was great. In truth there might some valid criticisms but generally Essex Inn is a very good base for Chicago at an affordable price. The rooms are spacious & clean & well appointed. The bathroom houses the oddest shower arrangement but it is perfectly workable. The comments about heating/air con might be valid in some rooms but I had no problems. The location is ideal for access to the courtesy buses running to the Homewares Show but great too for exploring the windy city on foot. Chicago is a great city too by the way. So on balance I think this offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money. Would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: GabrielsMom7
Reviews.Content: Did not enjoy our stay at all. The hotel has a VERY old AC/heat system. During the winter season all that you get in your room is heat and during the summer season all that you get is an AC option. There is no way to control the temperature in the room. Our room was SO hot that we had to sleep with the window all the way open, otherwise it was impossible to do anything. Thank god that it was possible to open the window otherwise I don't think we would be able to stay at the hotel! The rooms are also VERY small. Not to mention the small sink and toilet that even my child had trouble using because of the VERY small size. The staff at the hotel was no not nice at all. Hardly anyone had a smile on their face and when they communicated with us they were rather rude. I think that the hotel is way over priced especially considering who their next door neighbor is. I would not recommend or stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed majorly”
Reviews.Author: Jena W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there this past weekend to attend the Chicago Hair show... I booked the hotel though hotels.com.... When I arrived I found out that you can't even park at the hotel unless you use their valet parking which is $41 a day... You can park other places a few blocks away but then you lug your luggage all that way with you. The hotel also does not allow coolers either - which was not cool because we brought snacks and sodas to have in the room with us. Upon leaving the hotel I went down to the front desk and asked for a luggage cart so I could load my car and I was promptly told that "That was the reason the bell hop was there for and that if I wanted to use a cart I would have to go back up to my room and call down to have him come and load my belongings. The staff for the most part is very friendly and very helpful with telling you about good places to eat and where the best shopping is. As many of the reviews have mentioned yes the rooms are very small. The bathroom and sink are very small as well. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff-small room-warm shower-great pool!”
Reviews.Author: SMALLTOWN2BIGCITY
Reviews.Content: Got this room on Priceline.com for $88 total cost. Great deal on Name Your Own Price option.This hotel was located at South end of Michigan Ave across from Grant Park. We went on March 4-5 so it was pretty cold/windy to walk anywhere. We found the staff to be very helpful, it was our anniversary so I requested a king bed with good views. We got it! Room 1401. Hotel has wonderful indoor pool area on 4th floor, we didn't swim. CTA bus and "L" train is the best value for getting around (only $5.75 for day pass), taxi's are $10 each trip to North end of Michigan ave where shops and sights are. I would stay here again, eventhough the shower was warm at best, not hot....bed was ok...not super comfy...but overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic "event" location”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: I recently held four alumni events at the Essex Inn, and I am pleased and gratified by how well they all went. I worked closely with Sales and Catering Manager Brad Owens and found him to have incredibly high standards -- same as mine. Better yet, he was always prompt and responsive to all my questions, adjustments, and requests. I couldn't have asked for a better partner to pair with; the success of my events really mattered to him. To be sure, there are higher end venues to hold gatherings in the area. And you will pay significantly more in those venues. As far as I'm concerned, I received Hilton-level service for half the price. I'd use the Essex Inn all over again...in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay with Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: MyValentine2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex Inn for a week while in Chicago for business and enjoyed my stay. The hotel is well located on South Michigan within a few blocks of an El stop and the subway. The hotel is within walking distance of Millennium Park and the Art Institute. There is a park across the street where many people jog and walk their dogs- it seems to be a very nice neighborhood and I always felt safe walking back from the train or museum, even later at night. The rooms are small but nicely updated. There is a mini-fridge in a cabinet under the TV. However, there was no microwave in the room or available to guests in the lobby area. There were plenty of TV channel selections. The heating system did not have thermostat control- it was either heat is on or off- but I learned to turn off the heat at night since I like it cooler to sleep. The windows open if only a tiny bit- that is a little perk that I always look for because it is nice to hear the street noise and get some fresh air. The bathroom was small but fine for just me- it would be hard for a couple to get ready in the same small space, though. There was not a full-length mirror in the room or the bath. The hotel had one of the nicest pool, sauna and fitness areas Iâ€™ve ever seen! There was always a friendly lifeguard on duty. The pool area has a bin full of pool toys like kick boards, balls and rings to toss as well as games like checkers and chess on the tables that surround the pool. The gym has plenty of cardio and strength equipment. Parking on site was slightly more expensive than surrounding public lots but included in/out privileges and was much more secure. For the difference of about $15/day it was worth it to me to know my car was in a supervised area. By far the best thing about the hotel was the service- from the front desk to the valet staff to the lifeguards to maintenance. I checked with the front desk every time I took the train to be sure I was picking the best stop to get to my destination. They made great restaurant recommendations and had plenty of menus on hand. When a channel on my TV didnâ€™t work, they sent maintenance up within two minutes of my call (around 9:pm) to take a look. The lifeguards treated me like a friend. Good service goes a long way in my book and everyone on staff at the Essex met and exceeded to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: davenlinda
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the staff were very helpful and friendly. But we should have been advised by our agents that the kitchen was out of action meaning that any food had to be obtained elsewhere. Our room was of a reasonable size with two king size beds, and the bathroom was OK. If you want to see small try Paris or London! What a pleasure to be able to get a smoking room with a window that opened. We would stay again hopefully when their restaurant is working.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gigi_Glez
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews about this hotel and decided to give it a chance still. Unfortunately i was disappointed. Their staff wasnt very helpful any bit and at times seemed a little rude. This hotel definitely has a motel feel instead of a hotel feel. The rooms are very small as are their bathrooms. The bathroom sinks literally are the size of a large bowl. They rooms arent lighted very well either. They do have great clean up service thought. They women who clean our room each day was very detailed about everything, even organizing our little mess =) The resturant is still closed... looked nice from what we saw...but closed lol... The location was great thats my biggest Pro to this hotel. You are across the street from Grant Park. Short walking distance to the museums which is a plus. Apparently they have shuttles that take you there. But they failed to inform us that they are only at certain times of the day. They dont have complimentary water!!! I was really shocked by this!!! NOt even bottled water that you can purchase in the room. They also dont have ice machines on every floor. They do have vending machines though....but i got robbed four buckets because they didnt dispense anything.... They do offer free wifi...but its extremely slow (like your page with take a long time to load slow thats if it loads) but you can always upgrade for a fee hahaha I guess in this case you really get what you pay for. I probably will not stay here again unless its a last resort. I really recommend that they clean up a bit. Their location is amazing and im sure their hotel would really benefit from a little face lift

Reviews.Title: “good location..pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: pipersmum
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at the Essex for 3 nights. the location is good...south end of michigan avenue across from the park. our room had clear views of the lake and the city. we had a king room. bed was great...confortable..nice linens. the room was small and the bathroom even smaller but even still we were very comfortable and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Suite”
Reviews.Author: Sarah V
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before booking three nights at the Essex. We were traveling with two small children so I opted for the family suite and we were pleasantly surprised. The room was small and the hotel is older, but we liked the classic feel. The suite consisted of two rooms, three queen/full beds in total. Both rooms had a tv, which was nice. Yes the bathroom (and bathroom sink!) were very small but served our purposes (two adults, a 3 and 5 year old) just fine. Valet parking was a bit expensive but we did enjoy the security of the parking garage. We used the shuttle service a few times with great success but it was inconvenient to find a taxi back from a few places. Like other reviewers we were disappointed because the hotel restaurant was closed, but found a convenience store with donuts and a Caribou coffee within walking distance. We also ordered Giordano's Pizza for delivery one night (yum!) and ate out the other times. Overall, a nice older hotel just down the street from the heart of the Mag Mile. Good if you are looking for a budget stay downtown. Positives: Price, location, shuttle (one-way), nice pool, sauna and fitness area Neutrals: Smaller room but nice family suite, older but classy hotel Negatives: No hot tub, expensive valet, shuttle (one-way), restaurant closed

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the lake”
Reviews.Author: westcork2
Reviews.Content: Last year my wife and i stayed at the Essex Inn in Chicago for a few days.The location is superb as your are right on lake Michigan. The room was clean and bright but don't expect a large room. The food wasn't good there but around the corner (200 yards) we found a breakfast place called Yoke. This was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to just stay one night”
Reviews.Author: Aguard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located is in a good area and it actually has a decent shuttle service. I don't know if it was only the floor where I stayed but my room was small and ugly. There is no way to control the heater other than to turn I off when hot and on when cold. I do not recommend if staying for longer than a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Value in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Carmollin
Reviews.Content: If you have a car to get around, or are comfortable with public transport, I still think this is one of the best places to stay in downtown Chicago. The prices are terrific and the rooms, while small, are just lovely. They are tastefully decorated, clean, and well maintained. We had a "family suite" which is a small king room, with a tiny cute bathroom, adjoining a room with two double beds. It shares the bath and door to the hall. It was perfect for giving our kids (and us) some privacy, but feeling they were safe and secure. The only reason I did not rate it was excellent was the pool and areas around it seemed dirty...I was surprised since I know it was completely updated just a couple of years ago. I will say though, they had an attendant at the pool, which was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “CHICAGO, LOVE THAT CITY”
Reviews.Author: cwcmd
Reviews.Content: I love that city, Its a great place to get lost in...The hotel Essex was great, the help was friendly,helpful, The pool was great. Your right in the middle of things, the hustle and bustle. I would of stayed longer, but oh well you have to go home sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great location”
Reviews.Author: honeycomb2525
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here cause we got a really good deal on price. Now I know why. There is a pool on the rooftop, which is super nice, but it would have been even better to have a hot tub. They offer a shuttle to take you to certain tourist areas including the Magnificent mile from 10am to 4pm. What they don't tell you is that you have to find your own transportation back. The Essex Inn is on the 800 block and the Magnificent Mile is on the 900 block. Super far walk. The rooms were small and dingy. The bathrooms had absolutely no room to turn around in. We had stopped at the front desk to see if they had complimentary aspirin like every other hotel we've stayed in in Chicago, and they directed us to a hotel's convience store across the street. Their restuarant was closed due to some flooding that happened, so we couldn't even go there for a drink or appetizer. And our view was overlooking an alley. I was very disappointed. We were definitely spoiled at the The James and the Helix. Never again will we stay here or recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Touringmuso8
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. First impressions were that it was a bit dated, but the friendly helpful staff, great location near lake, the loop, museums, spotless rooms, massive and extremely comfortable bed all helped to make it a brilliant stay! It was lovely and quiet, only 2 blocks away from the nearest subway. Great value for money - i'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience...”
Reviews.Author: Bzuefishx
Reviews.Content: Checked in late, so must have been given the poorest of their rooms. Pretty bad - a floor fan was going full blast to dry out a very wet carpet. Smelled horrible. To the staff's credit, they put me in another room. However, new room smelled smokey and had a thread bare, rode hard feel to it. Really the whole property feels that way. Great location and low price, but not my cup of tea - I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a little too small for me”
Reviews.Author: cancun32
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed there December 31 for 1 nite. For the price we paid I would have thought the rooms would had been much bigger. We have stayed in several motels and I believe this one was the smallest. Two people can barely fit into the bathroom unless one is in the shower. It was very clean and as several other reviews noted, you could not adjust the thermostat. We did check out the pool on the 4th floor it looked very clean and there was an attendant there with towels. But do to the size of the room and the bathroom and the price we were charged (I know they do raise the rates for New Years) we will probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: KerryTravelBug87
Reviews.Content: We started our trip here, and found it a very good hotel! Very helpful staff and perfect for what we needed. In a quiet area, with Grant Park across the road. A few minutes walk from a fantastic breakfast place called Yolk! Highly recommended. If you are sightseeing, definitely take the hop on and off bus tour, you can buy tickets in the Hilton just up the street and get on and off there too, very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: tnknitter
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week before Christmas for $69 a night with AAA discount. King bed, desk, wifi, coffee maker, etc with a view of the museum campus. Everything was nice, clean, in good repair. Quiet except for occasional noise from other guests (didn't seem to come through the walls, but we couldn't figure out where - maybe the heat system? Not partying, just voices, not a big deal.) The bathroom had a shower stall, no tub, hot water and good pressure. Every time we asked the desk staff for information or assistance, they were knowlegable, pleasant, efficient, and very helpful, even at 5AM Christmas morning. The #3 bus stops at the door, and runs the length of Michigan Ave every few minutes. Caribou Coffee, Minati's Pizza, and other eateries were within a block or two. We used the valet parking one night and that was the only snafu; there was a problem about the correct fee but, again, the desk staff (not the valet) was extremely helpful in straightening it out. We were there for six nights and are VERY glad we found this place!

Reviews.Title: “Economical comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcworth
Reviews.Content: Chicago's Essex Inn is very economical and comfortable. Rooms are small, but I don't need a lot of space. Bar was nice, bartender was a little pretentious. Drinks were awesome. The loop is my favorite neighborhood in Chicago, so it was very convenient. Lowest cost lodging I've ever had in Chicago and just as good as all of the others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: jeharre
Reviews.Content: We chose the Essex for its price and we were so thrilled with our experience. The hotel was all renovated, the rooms were clean, the beds were amazing, the staff were very pleasant and respectful, and the best part of all was that there was a shuttle that was invaluable. The weather was bitter cold and if we had stayed closer to the Magnificent Mile we would have been walking and freezing. The shuttle, which was free, dropped us off right where we needed to go. We used it 5 times in the course of the weekend and all it cost us were the tips. What a great asset! We had adults and small children and the hotel was a great fit for everyone. The staff worked hard to please us and were very helpful with anything we brought to their attention. It was actually nice to get away from the craziness of the North Loop and Mag Mile. The fitness room was truly amazing as well. I am used to hotels having 2 pieces of equipment, both of which are broken and the Essex had a complete training facility - and they all worked! I would definitely stay here again. 14 of us stayed at the hotel and it was a unanimous decision that we would definitely stay here on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: borntofly66
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine, clean and comfortable. A few things about it were a little inconvenient, though. The heat/air wasn't the normal hotel setup. Heat only in the winter, air only in the summer. No fan only option, and no thermostatically-controlled option. For those who like to sleep with the whitenoise of a fan, better bring your own. The internet is free; for 256 mbs, which is a joke. Or you can pay for high-speed, which I didn't, so I don't know how well that works. The cable tv set-up is unusual, also. Unless I was just unable to figure it out, you had to punch in the number of each station you wanted to view, no channel surfing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stacy7201
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The hotel is a little dated and the rooms are smaller. But the price is great and the staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: anderjim
Reviews.Content: One night in Chicago at the end of a greuling trip was rewarded by a very good stay at The Essex. We were a little worried by previous reviews, a feeling that was worsesned by poor phone call handling and unreturned email. As it turned out we had nothing to worry about. Our booking was in perfect order and we were checked in to our room early (11am). The fabulous Mad Men lobby adjoins a bar that looks out upon Michigan Ave. through giant plate-glass windows. (Beware the 20% automatic tip at the bar, however, which not only is contrary to bar tipping practice but also takes the fun out of what is otherwise a nice, well-stocked place to drink.) If there is smoking in this hotel, we couldn't tell. Our room was small but cheerful, with a nice Bonnard reproduction on the wall, in keeping with the theme of a different artist for each floor of the hotel. There is a large swimming pool on site, with a sauna and excellent fitness room, all big plusses. Having stayed at the Hard Rock earlier in the week (see review), we'd say that for the price, the Essex is very nearly as good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: phreakmamapink
Reviews.Content: To start, it was veryeasy to make reservations. I just called the 800 number and got to talk to a lovely woman who was very helpful. Then I decided to add an extra night to our stay and that was easy too. We showed up early(1 pm), and they let us go ahead and check in. I was with my daughter, and she wanted a vew, and the man at the desk was very accomadating. He put us on the 12th floor not facing the Hilton. The rooms were lovely. The decor was tasteful. Each floor has a theme, the 12th is The Art Institute. There is free wifi access from your room and a minifridge and coffee pot.. The pool is very large, but not as warm as I'd hoped for it to be called a heated pool. The kids enjoyed it nonetheless. The sauna is nice, but I think it needs a hot tub. There are pool towels available also, which is nice. They are larger ones too, not the usual small ones like at most hotels. The location is great, right across from Grant Park, and within walking distance to most other stuff. There is also a shuttle that will drop you off lots of places. The in-hotel resturant is very pricy, but she let me order off the kids menu, and that was enough food for me. I will definetly be staying here again when I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lostpassport
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by the shockingly dated reception area, this is a really good hotel and in a lovely location. The rooms are a good size and pleasantly furnished for a 3 star hotel, the restaurant is decent and a good palce to start your day. The location is perfect for getting down to the Aquarium or walking through the park. Its probably a 10 min walk into the loop area but there is no doubt you pay a premium for being in that area and from what I saw you get little for that money. The free wifi at the hotel is a bonus and makes it an ideal place to stay on business. I would recommend this hotel and woudl return

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Renee1967
Reviews.Content: The hotel was older, rooms on the smallish side, however the staff made the experience so incredible. The restaurant was amazing. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Dad, can we go back...?"”
Reviews.Author: dekanus
Reviews.Content: Our personal experience of this ambivalent rated hotel was a positive surprise. A little bit cautious and not expecting too much because of the reviews we arrived for a conference as it was one of the official venue hotels. The staff (especially Tatiana) was very helpful and reliable. The room was big enough, clean and had a nice view. The quality of the beds was above standard. The bathroom and toilet were standard and hygienic. The heating system functioned well. The housekeeping service was excellent! There is a spacious and well equipped fitness area. And this swimming pool...! One you really can call SWIMMING pool with a constant guard on duty. Everything for a good price and in an excellent location of Chicago. And..., my little boy keeps asking me for going back to Chicago, because we had such special swimming sessions there together!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, not bad”
Reviews.Author: chris w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in November 2011. The location is great and the value is pretty good. Just don't expect anything out of the ordinary. The room was a bit on the smallish side, and the bathroom was tiny. It was relatively clean, but the bottom of the tub was filthy. The parking was expensive ($39 for overnight), but that's not surprising because of the location. The walls were also paper thin as we could hear people in the next room talking and even their cell phone going off! This is one of those hotels I wouldn't recommend as a nice place but more of a decent value if you want to stay right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago location for Lakeshore museum area”
Reviews.Author: elpasokib
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Essex Inn, November 2011. Very easy to get from Midway Airport on the Orange line to the hotel. It is about a 15 minute walk from the train station. The hotel is old but the room that we had was in good condition. The room was very clean but small. We were glad to see that it had a refrigerator and everything we needed to make coffee in the morning. The bathroom sink is very small but it was not a problem. The only thing that is sort of difficult is controlling the temperature in the room. It was a bit too warm but since the heat was on for the building we could not get cool air into the room. We were able to turn off the fan for the heat which helped some. The hotel is located directly across from Grant Park which is a great location to get to the Field Musuem, Aquarium, and Adler Planatarium. We did get a very good rate on the room and I would book at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good location - some issues”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: liked this hotel as it is close to my office, and not so close to the mag mile tourist traffic area. the staff in the hotel is very friendly - when i checked in they were going thru an upgrade on their system, and doing things the manual way took a bit longer than normal, but not too bad. upon entering the hotel there was a man that "appeared vagrant" sleeping on the couch in the lobby - he didnt bother me per se, but he was bothersome looking... the room itself was nice - this is an older hotel and the tv, carpet, etc were actually quite fresh looking so that was a treat. the only other room issue was the bathroom - the tub had some black crust that washed away upon turning the water on so not sure where that came from... the shower did not work very well and there was a lot of water that came from the spout and shower, so you had to take a shower/ankle bath at the same time, not enjoyable. but again, overall with these minor hiccups a moderately priced hotel and pretty decent deal for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: racheljxx
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, in a great location, we had a room over looking the park. The hotel also has a shuttle bus which takes you up the magnificent mile all the way the the Hancock building. Our room was very spacious & the bed was HUGE, it was also very very comfy. Staff were friendly & helpful. Would definatley recommend...just need to make the exterior more welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lambchopski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the start of our US trip,and were very pleased with it.While not very central it wasn't too far to walk for sightseeing and shopping.We had 2 breakfasts and one evening meal at the hotel,and the food was most acceptable.Our room was clean and comfortable,and the staff were more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a walk to downtown or major shopping.”
Reviews.Author: HandsomeDoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weekends' ago as a get-away from a busy work schedule. The rooms were great and the view was beautiful (partial view of the lake/park). Just a bit of a walk to the major shopping areas and it's much much south of the Water Tower and other shopping areas. If your willing to walk, then a great exercise/trek, otherwise, take a cab to the various locations. Various places are within walking distance such as a Target, parks and beautiful gardens. I had some issues with the Internet while I was there and moved to another room after my 1st night. The staff were courteous and helpful as well as friendly. (Derrick and the other gentleman). I'd stay here again but not for the price I initially paid...I'd pay the same price for something more near the core of the shopping district (as I've stayed at the Doubletree and Sheraton on my previous visits). Overall, I had a great time and plenty of walking exercise. I ended up eating at a nearby Einstein's Bagel's and a few other places that were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: lovesucks1029
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel very recently and my experience was average. I booked this hotel through Priceline.com's "Name Your Own Price" feature. Won't be doing that again...LOL The property is dated but you can tell that updates have been made in recent years. The staff is very friendly. No problems there. The bed was decent and comfortable. The bathroom is cramped. The drain in the tub and sink in the bathroom drained very slowly. However, in fairness, I didn't alert the front desk of this issue. The elevator is slow as well but I wasn't in a hurry so it was no big deal. Although I have no plans to stay here again, I would recommend this hotel to budget friendly travelers who are seeking a no-frills hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerrie0093
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago and stayed in the Essex's Inn for 5 days in March 2011. I found this hotel exellent and truely enjoyed my stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was ever too much trouble. Breakfast was good and we ate at the Hotel for 3 out of 5 mornings. One morning we ventured to Lou Mitchell's which was absolutly fantastic. A typicall American Diner and well worth a visit, free donut holes for all and free sweets for children. Also the coffee there is the best i've ever tasted and my one regret is not buying a bag to bring home. in fact if any body lives in the UK and whilst in Chicago ventures to Lou Mitchells during their stay I would love some Lou Mitchells coffee brought home and posted to me. I can pay you back via Paypal. my email address is kerrie0093@hotmail.com please email if you are going!!

Reviews.Title: “A+ for customer service”
Reviews.Author: TessM
Reviews.Content: I chose the Essex as it's close to the Field Museum where I had a meeting. I got in with just enough time to grab lunch - the woman at the bar made sure my sandwich came out quick and noticed it was overcast. Of course I forgot my umbrella.... The woman at the bar suggested that there might be one in lost and found so I went to the front desk to ask. There wasn't one in there but the LOVELY Nicoleta at the front desk lent me hers!!!! WOW, just wow!! On a more practical note, the room was nice and the bed was comfortable. The TV channels confused me a bit, but that's such a small detail. I highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay on Michigan Ave near the Field Museum

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBoy1955
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference during the third week of October for 5 days. Room was very comfortable just keep in mind it is an older hotel. We had unusually warm weather the week I was there and once the hotel switches to the the heating season that's it until next Spring. You can regulate the heat so no heat comes in to the room but the window only opens about six inches. It wasn't really a significant problem as I wasn't overly hot and the weather was an anomaly for this time of year but perhaps something to keep in mind if you are traveling during a transitional weather period. I had a minor issue with my reservation, Doug one of the desk managers was great and rectified the situation. All front desk staff were helpful but Doug was outstanding. Pillows were a bit hard but I asked for a softer one and housekeeping delivered one in short order. The best quality, in my mind, of this hotel was the gym facility. There is a pool and gym adjacent to each other that opens promptly at 6:00 A.M., the pool is long enough (17m) so that you don't get dizzy swimming laps and the water temperature was perfect, lifeguards were very nice and engaged in conversation even so early in the morning. The gym facility was very good, has an array of aerobic and weight training equipment. Since I was there early there was a never an issue on getting on to a piece of equipment although I noticed there is only one treadmill (3 ellipticals, 2 recumbent bikes) and it looked like there was a space for another for another treadmill but perhaps was removed for whatever reason. Several televisions in gym area to keep yourself amused while exercising. The location was very good, around a ten - fifteen walk to the center of the downtown area and Buddy Guy's Blues Club is only a block and a half away (didn't get to go there but went to the House of Blues and saw a great band). All in all, I would highly recommend the Essex Inn of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated.”
Reviews.Author: jinty00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband 3rd October. Ideally situated for the shops and attractions. Grant Park is directly across the road. A trolley stop (hop on/off) is a few steps away. The hotel does have a complementary shuttle, but is drop off only, you need to make your own way back. The hotel is dwarfed by other hotels which we preferred. Means staff knew who we were. No safe in the room but were available to use at the reception desk. Room has a fridge. Staff were friendly and helpful. Found drinks at bar quite dear. The breakfast is ok but better to eat out. The hotel gives you a list of different local places to eat. We found this very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Blazing fast internet, funky HVAC, good location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: investroll
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel located right next to the Hilton on Michigan Ave., not far from the Harrison stop on the Red Line. This makes it easy to take public transit from O'Hare airport. (Take the Blue Line and then transfer to the Red.) I stayed here because I was attending a convention at the Hilton, but it was full. The room is nice, clean, and quiet. It is well designed with good lighting, useful desk, and a comfortable bed. I would happily stay here again. The sign in the room says that low-speed wireless internet is free, and high speed costs extra. But when I connected, it automatically gave me blazing fast internet (20+MB/second) and I don't see anything about an extra charge. The HVAC is funky. The sign on the room says that it is a "two pipe" system that is set for the season. I worked in an office building like that, and that means that if you have an unseasonably warm day in the heating season you will roast, or else you will freeze during an unseasonably cool day in the cooling season. But I was comfortable during my stay. The restaurant automatically adds a 20% gratuity to the bill. The bathtub is somewhat small, but at least it has a bath. I do my best to avoid staying in places that have no bathtubs because I like to soak my road-warrior bones.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a Bears game!”
Reviews.Author: Spot76
Reviews.Content: The Essex offers a great Bears package, so we've stayed here each of the past 5 years when our group does our annual guys weekend. You can't get a much better location for a game than here. Located right on Michigan Ave., you can see the stadium from your room if you are facing south. The package includes a 2 night stay, a ticket to the game in the endzone, dinner at the new restaurant, a free drink voucher and even complimentary parking all for a reasonable price. To get to the stadium is a 15-20 minute walk thru Grant Park and around the Field Museum. The hotel has been partly renovated in the past couple of years, so it has improved. It's not the fanciest place to stay in Chicago but it is nice enough for what you need. The rooms aren't that big but the beds are comfortable. Only bad thing this year is that our shower didn't drain very well. The bellhops take good care of us and staff is always friendly. As for the new hotel restaurant, Tribute, the service was VERY slow. The food was good and it was included with our package so I guess we can't complain too much! Overall, we really enjoy our stays at the Essex and will continue to stay there each year for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL ON EARTH”
Reviews.Author: Jay J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the 'Taste of Chicago' (July 2011). The room was too small. The INDOOR pool/gym area was 120 degrees. And to top it off, I was charged the wrong amount by the hotel staff and wasn't able to receive my deposit back. If you have a little extra cash, PLEASE stay at the Hilton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Jill-Jack
Reviews.Content: A welcoming staff after a long delay on an Amtrak journey (16 hours + delay....) allowed us entry into our spacious room early in the morning (even though we hadn't contacted them after our 'no show' the previous evening). We enjoyed a 'longed-for' bath and coffee before a quick nap in the very comfortable bed. Although close to the El, there was no noise; the hotel is very well situated for the aquarium and several museums; the park opposite has a feature fountain which is a sight to behold after dark when it lights up and dances to amplified music on the hour; the open-top bus stops right outside the hotel too! The restaurant serves up a wonderful breakfast by attentive, knowledgeable staff who gave us the 'low-down' on what best to see and do - ( the architecture cruise was a must! Our guide, Dave, was wonderful and a great ambassador for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, sticky stuffy room”
Reviews.Author: LoveJon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location of this hotel very much. It was close to a lot of different tourist attractions and restaurants. We booked this hotel through priceline.com name your own price. The restaurant in the hotel served only Chicago made drinks and we thought that was pretty cool, since we are from Baltimore and can't try them at home. The room was very sticky the 1st night and I requested a dehumidifier. They said they did not have one, but they moved our room. The 2nd room was bit less sticky but it still had a chlorine smell. It felt like we were sleeping near a pool. The staff at the desk were nice and pointed us in the direction of anything we wanted to see or go to. Also, in the bar in the morning the sell a good cup of coffee for around $3.25.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: MBatz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Essex Inn for 5 days and got a bargain trade-show related low price. Hotel is recently renovated; room interior has pleasant modern colors; rooms look boutique-style decorated and I immediately felt comfortable. I had two queen beds and a nice sized room with plenty of space for luggage and to move around. Downstairs a modern lobby, nice restaurant / bar for breakfast lunch dinner ... or just one block away CARIBOU Coffee shop to pick up a quick breakfast. Walking distance to the Buckingham Fountain, Millenium Park, downtown. Personnel very friendly, helpful. There is also a pool + fitness area but I did not use that. I loved my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: nghri
Reviews.Content: On 8/21/11 we were passing thru Chicago while going across country and wanted to stay only one night and one full day. We were not sure exactly when we would be getting there so did not make reservations ahead of time. We were very hesitant about the Essex because of recent postings. We were unable to find any other rooms so ended up there. I wish I knew the name of the young man at the desk that night because he was very helpful and friendly. The room we had was clean, the bed comfortable and the view of the Navy Yard at night was wonderful. We used the valet parking which was reasonable. The valet staff very nice. We were within walking distance to Buddy Guys Blues Legends that night as well as the River Tour the next morning. Beautiful city! Would love to go back and will stay at the Essex.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel on the south end of the Loop”
Reviews.Author: WestToronto78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex Inn for 2 non-consecutive nights in early August while I was in Chicago to catch some White Sox games. The hotel was conveniently located to subway stations and within easy walking distance of Grant Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, and other downtown amenities. I was given early access to my room on one occasion and was impressed with the quality of the furniture and cleanliness of the room on both occasions. The staff were exceptionally friendly and I would definitely return to this hotel on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Frank A
Reviews.Content: Having seen some good reviews for the Essex I decided to stay here with my wife and children for three nights from London as part of a us holiday . Sadly I was not impressed,The so called "family" room was far too small for two adults /two children in their early teens .while the bathroom /wash basin etc were also pathetically small dark and old fashioned. When we politely approached the reception staff they offered no help whatsoever stating that was all they had ,basically go away to the point of rudeness . Yes the hotel well placed for the excellent tour buses etc ,a fair swimming pool area , but not a hotel i would recommend and am sure there are better budget hotels in the great city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great times”
Reviews.Author: donnaelrick
Reviews.Content: PLUS: location, shuttle, staff very helpful, within walking distance to many attractions, trolley stop at corner, pool, outdoor deck MINUS: rooms were small (but we new that before going), restaurant very pricey, poor lighting in room (my kids got sick of me complaining about this).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: greenthum
Reviews.Content: We won this on Priceline for $110 Bid. We were there during Labor Day and a Jazz Festival so hotels were full. I was a little worried after reading the reviews. We checked in and were quite happy that my phone request had been remembered. We asked for 2 beds and a quiet room - away from the train tracks. We got a room that semi-faced the lake. The room was quiet. The construction of the hotel must be very soundproof. There were a group of noisy people in the hall and we could not hear them in our room. The toiletries are above average- shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, lotion. The bedding is a little scratchy- which is what a previous poster had written. Not the high quality sheets I was hoping for. I was very impressed with the staff- very friendly and helpful. Also very knowledgeable about the train and bus schedules. Parking- $37 at the hotel. BUT- a block away are parking lots that are $20 and $25 for 24 hr. The whole place seemed clean. Bathrooms- the sink is about the size of a 10" dinner plate- works fine, just small. The tub is shorter than average. The pool area is very nice and has an outdoor patio (4th floor) with a great view of the park across the st.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AMJones13
Reviews.Content: We were meant to arrive at the Essex Inn on a Tuesday evening, but travel complications meant we arrived early on Wednesday instead. We phoned the hotel to let them know we would be there the following morning, so they checked us in on the Tuesday so that we could go straight into our room when we arrived. The hotel provided great information about the city and even had a free shuttle bus to take guests to the main attractions e.g. the mag mile, navy pier and museums! The room was clean, spacious and had everything we needed. As it was so hot when we visited we took advantage of the rooftop terrace and inside pool! The sun loungers were lovely! We had breakfast in the new Tribute restaurant which was very nice too! All in all this hotel is fantastic if you're working with a smaller budget!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: vasudhachara
Reviews.Content: The place is walking distance from several attractions and affords easy access to public transport. The room was comfortable and ample for two nights for our family of four ( two little children) since we spent most of our time outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phaze1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Essex Inn for 2 nights. The hotel is clean and has good facilities. The reception staff are very helpful and give out some information of local restaurants bars shops etc. The gym is quite good and the pool a reasonable size. The rooms are large and ours had a bath and shower. There is an iron, coffee making machine and a fridge in the room. Would recommed Tamarind for a meal (Asian,Thai, Chinese) and the Chicago Firehouse for an amazing steak. Would recommend this hotel and would use it again if I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good *** performance, great value”
Reviews.Author: everthecritic
Reviews.Content: I spent three night here. It is in an excellent location and is clean and comfortable. Unforunately there were a couple of minor things wrong with my room but these were speedily put right upon request. All the staff are very pleasant to meet and are most helpful. I only ate in on one occasion but it was good. All in all, I rate this highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagomommasita
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, at 4pm check-in, our suite was not ready. We decided to eat at the hotel's restuarant. We were pleasantly surprised that the food was very good. After an hour, we checked into the hotel. The suite was quite large, king size bed, a common area/living room, an under the shelf refrigerator and a very small coffee maker on the countertop. The bathroom was a big let down as I had to squeeze through the door opening and stood between the tiny space between the toilet and the sink to close the door. Too bad that the designers skimped on space in the bathroom because the rest of the suite was very nice. Also, the pool is not as large as pictured, but nice; and the gym space is pretty small, but nice. We got to use the pool and gym at random times during the day and it was not crowded. The hotel location was absolutely perfrect, in The Loop and in walking distance to most attractions. We decided on The Loop/Essex Inn because we wanted to be away from the touristsy areas of the northern most side of Michigan Avenue, which I compare to walking around crowded NYC. We certainly were not disappointed. We caught the subway and bus to get to attractions more than three miles from the hotel. The buses run regularly, and right across the street from the hotel; the subway was right around the corner of the hotel. Oh, the hotel staff was unbelievably friendly and courteous. When I called the front desk, my needs were met within moments. We will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ellie-dee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Trailfinders (not one they usually recommend, but we wanted to save some money). I was concerned when I read the reviews during April and May. After lots of deliberation, we decided to give it a go. Our experience was positive from the very start. The reception staff were very friendly and tried to be helpful (although they did not always agree with each other!) We booked a free tour at the Convention Centre, and we were treated to four hours of local information including a free cycle tour of the area. The hotel is not exactly aesthetically pleasing, but it is a great base for seeing the sights of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, can be noisy!”
Reviews.Author: PrivateEyes
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Chicago Essex Inn and it was a lovely hotel in a great location, opposite Grant Park with good restaurants nearby. The staff were very helpful and have printed maps of interest and transport links. Our room was on the 12th floor and and was a bright spacious corner room, very tastefully decorated. This hotel boasts a swimming pool and a rooftop garden which is a great ammenity. There is a restaurant on the ground floor named Tribute that does good breakfasts at affordable prices. The only drawback we found was that the Loop train runs next to it at an elevated level so it was noisy at night. We could probably have moved rooms and the staff, I am sure, would have facilitated this but we had unpacked and got comfortable and so decided not to and soon enough got used to the sounds of trains in the night. I would recommend this hotel but ensure you ask for a room away from the train tracks.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a little updating but perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: ktee1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked with our airline as a package for 2 nights as we landed in Chicago. The entrance is a little wierd, wth the reception desk tucked out of sight! Plenty of waiting areas and chairs in the lobby. The rooms were ok, the overall feel of the hotel was that it was in need of an update in terms of decoration, it was all a little brown! although there were signs that this was starting to happen. The hotel is well placed for grants park and the lake side walk, many other attractions were a 30 minute walk away. The pool and roof terrace were pleasant after a long hot day enjoying the sights! We tried breakfast in the adjoining 'restaurant' which was spacious and airy and with reasonable prices for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Our family of 5 had a great 4 days at the Essex”
Reviews.Author: Docaluci
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nicely redecorated. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Very stylish even! And didn't smell like a hotel/motel. Most seem to smell like cleaners and soap. This hotel smelt like home. Clean! Service was excellent. The pool was large and clean. Huge surrounding deck with an outdoor patio. Not a cramped room with an undersized pool and a few tables squeezed in. The fitness room was well stocked with all the major tools and ran the full length of the pool room. Yes, the sink was small but cute and plenty functional. Bathroom, not huge but average and also very well kept. Located right across from Grant park with a Starbucks one block away. Beautiful morning walk for coffee every morning! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Krismom
Reviews.Content: It was nice to sit on the sundeck in the morning and watch the city come to life!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not for me”
Reviews.Author: lookin4fun71
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, but I was very disappointed in the overall package. The location is not as centrally located as you would think. It is at the south end of Grant Park. This is perfect for those that are wanting to visit the museum campus, art museum, etc. If you are wanting to see Navy Pier, the Mag Mile or Gold Coast area, look elsewhere. They do have a free shuttle that will take you to select attractions, however, it only runs 1x an hour and only seats 14 people. Totally not worth fighting over a seat. Most hotels in the downtown area will hold your luggage before and after checkout for free. This hotel charges you per bag. The A/C in the room was not noticeable, there was only warm/cold. It was 95 each day we stayed and unfortunately the hallway was cooler than our room. The bathroom sink was VERY small, the shower did not drain particularly well and the faucets were super noisy. As I mentioned, the room was clean and the staff was friendly enough, but we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better...”
Reviews.Author: qwerty85
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel is worth considering is the location. Other than that, be prepared to experience confused/unhelpful staff, long waits for an elevator, and less than perfect standards of cleanliness. In other words, you can do better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: madnotcrazy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel may 2010. I got it for an excellent price and it was at a great location.The hotel seems somewhat outdated, starting with the lobby. I wasn't too impressed with the room either. The bathroom was small and the air conditioner barely worked in our room. It mainly just cooled the area where the air conditioner was, didn't really get the whole room. I saw some pictures on expedia and it wasn't exactly what was portrayed. The bar had a really great staff, but was also outdated and I got served a skunky beer. It is located right across from Grant Park which was great and is in walking distance of the CIA and Millennium park. They do offer a free shuttle to the Navy Pier, but we had issues with it picking us up since it didn't pick you up back at the Navy Pier. The parking garage worked out well, it was around 37 a night. My goal was to find a cheap hotel in Chicago and that is exactly what I got. I personally would not stay there again and would search for a hostel that would probably be the same quality.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: txkelligirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location of the Essex in for our long weekend in Chicago. It was centrally located near the parks and had a daily free shuttle service to the Shed aquarium, Field museum and planetarium. Nice hotel with indoor pool. They were working on the restaurant when we were there so no food to review. Overall a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a family or friends trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: amanda_9187
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here during the 4th of July weekend. It was our first trip to Chicago and had such a convenient and lovely stay at the Essex Inn, that I will definitely be back. We booked this hotel through our travel agent in Australia and were very impressed with the price, convenient location to tourist attractions and the cleanliness and service was fantastic! We stayed in a standard room with 2 double beds, which comfortably fit 3 people. The hotel was very convenient and easily accessible to a lot of the tourist attractions such as Millennium and Grant parks which was just a few blocks away! Lake Michigan mile was very close and it was lovely to wake up early and take a stroll down there or a jog along the water. We did a hop on/off bus tour with Chicago's Trolleys, a very popular tourist attraction in Chicago, which was a great way to experience the sites and was easily accessible with the frequent stop off/ pick up points along South Michigan Ave. The Essex Inn pool and gym looked amazing. We had a view of it from our room and it was always very busy. The gym was large and very equipped which was good to work off those few extra calories eaten whilst traveling! It was very convenient the hotel laundry and dryer service and the front desk was more than happy to exchange money for quarters. The free wifi was a bonus! The hotel restaurant was not finished and opened when we were there but from the other reviews read, it sounds lovely. We ended up just walking to nearby cafes to get food etc. The hotel was also very convenient to a nearby blues club which was great to experience some of the local nightlife! There is really no faults during our stay at this hotel and will definitely be back for our next trip to Chicago :)

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit Lived Up To Expectations”
Reviews.Author: DaveMechanicsburg_PA
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago to atttend a business meeting at the Hilton that I attended last summer without my wife. I brought her this year and rented a suite for a week because my stay a at The Essex Inn last year was postive. The Essex Inn is conveniently located, clean (enough), the front room (suites) along N. Michigan have a great view and large rooms, good service, and the hotel is adjacent to the services of the Hilton. The suites have OK refrigerators, no utensils, and need microwaves. I'd stay here again under similar circumstances. Restaurant is new. Though food quality is OK, I found it to be intolerably slow. There are too many great restaurants in Chicago to be average and successful.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovedMaui
Reviews.Content: The Essex has a great location right on Michigan Avenue. The partial view of Lake Michigan was a welcome surprise. The room was comfortable and the new restaurant has a limited offering for lunch, but the food is delicious. We walked everywhere. A bonus is the Gray Line Hop On Hop Off trolley stop is right across the street. The room was clean and quiet except for the street noise. The staff is extremely helpful. (A couple more tips - Panera is a short walk and we found a great lunch deal at Einstein Brothers Bagels: free pastry with the purchase of a beverage after 2 p.m. And here's a plug for the Go Chicago card: worth the money this time of year.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: bizandtour
Reviews.Content: Went for a long weekend family trip over 4th of July 2011. Location is great. park your car or leave it at home becasue you won't need it. hotel is directly across the street from Grant Park and easy walk to the bean and crown fountain, a 10 minute walk from the museum area (Shedd, Field, Adler) and a short walk to the Harrison Red Line station. Soldier Field is a reasonable walk too. The room was tidy and small but typical of a downtown hotel. staff and service were great. everything was in good order and repair. Room appeared to be recently renovated. A variety of restaurants are within a short walk. 4th floor rooftop patio view is amazing. Pool was great for kids especially since there is a lifeguard. Pretty good fitness center for a hotel. Can't think of anything bad to say and certainly will be back. Did not try the restarount becasue it is new and opened after out departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Afa-Annie
Reviews.Content: I, like many people, had read all the reviews for this hotel before my trip, and was sliI ghtly concerned as to what was waiting for me. What I got was excellent front desk service from the start.There was no recollection of my reservation (nothing to do with the hotel, but my travel companies fault). This was dealt with in a fantastic manner by Ryan, who did not question us for ages ,but realizing we had travelled for simply hours from England, found us a corner room on the 14th floor with a fantastic view of The Willis Tower.The room was bright, airy,and because of its position on a corner had floor to ceiling windows on 2 sides..(fantastic).It had a queen size bed which by the way was extremeley comfortable,It wasn,t a large room but then we weren,t there to have a party in the room, it was quite adequate for our needs. The bathroom was very clean with a nice bath and shower and plenty of hot water.The towels were always brilliantly white and fluffy..The sink was a little on the small side,but hey,it was fine. The rooftop terrace was stunning,plenty of chairbeds to relax on, and tables and chairs also.And to be able to sit there and look at Grant Park accross the road was fantastic. The Swimming pool was of a good size and we swam everyday just after it opened at 6am and again after we got back from our daily outings.A lifeguard was on duty at all times.And the changing rooms were kept spottlessly clean.It could get quite warm in the pool area as it was a huge glass room..The gym was just off the swimming pool and had some really good equipment in it.. For the first 4 days of our holiday we had the pleasure of a free continental breakfast on the 2nd floor .I have no idea why people critisized this at all as there was plenty of choice and a variety of coffees to choose from.. If I were to be critical it would be about the new Tribute restaraunt, which opened while we were there, We very much looked forward to breakfasting on their first day,but all didn,t seem to go to plan.There were too many staff ,all falling over themselves,the coffee cups were far too small for English appetites let alone American ones.and it was also only lukewarm.The breakfast took an age to get to us, my order was wrong and had to be re-done and the toast tasted like fried bread.Also there were no condiments on the tables and we had no stirrers for our coffee. I am sure that all this was due to teething troubles and that when we return next year, all will be in order. On our last evening we had trouble printing our boarding cards, and once again Ryan came to our rescue.This man is a credit to The Hotel, nothing is too much trouble for him and I cannot praise him enough. All in all we had the perfect stay in a beautiful hotel situated right opposite Grant Park and we had no trouble getting around by foot..If you stay here I hope your experience will be as good as ours,and say hello to Ryan for us.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for price line price. Older hotel. Decent location”
Reviews.Author: Drmuzk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel room on Priceline for $120 per night, parking was $37 per night. It is an older hotel right next to Grant Park on S. Michigan Ave. The room has very limited climate controls, heat during the winter and air during the summer. The LED reading lights did not work over our bed. Tony, our bellman, was very helpful. Buses, trains and subways were very close to the hotel. The remodeled restaurant opened the day after we checked in but we did not have a chance to try. There's also a pool and fitness center on the fourth floor. This should be a 2 1/2 star hotel in my opinion. If you don't mind paying more and want to be in the middle of everything stay around State and South Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in a large city.”
Reviews.Author: travlrgrl01
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Essex Inn for a conference and shared a suite with two other people. Their suite is by no means excecssively large, but for a large city like Chicago, it was one of the larger rooms in the area. It is a good location to get a taxi or catch the bus. If you are traveling with children, I suggest you get a suite because a regular room will not be big enough for a family. Also, realize that there is A LOT of traffic up and down the street so if you get a room with a view, don't expect it to be quiet. I would also suggest that you bring snacks and items for breakfast. Their restaurant is not open yet and the breakfast consists of packaged pasteries. Also, you will pay for parking, but I suggest you just park your automobile and either walk, take a cab or a shuttle. It is not worth trying to find a parking spot somewhere and you'll have to pay for that parking spot anyways along with the hotel parking! And keep an eye on the bellhops, we did not want to use one to take our luggage, but they would not let us do it ourselves. The person that took our luggage to the car dropped a bag on the concrete and damaged a gift we were taking back. So, in comparison to the other hotel rooms I was able to see in the same area, the Essex Inn was more updated, the suite had much more room, and the rates were much lower. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “It met the basic requirements”
Reviews.Author: Rasberrynlimes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a vacation in Chicago. The main purpose of our trip was to experience the Taste of Chicago. Prior to us leaving, I had read the reviews on here about the hotel, however; I wanted to experience the hotel for myself. We had an early flight and arrived at the hotel hours before check-in. Luckily we were able to check into our room and didn't have to wait. Our hotel room was like an icebox! We could not turn on the heat because the thermostat was controlled by whatever season it was. Needless to say, we had to turn the air conditioner completely off, and the hotel staff brought up blankets to the room. The hallway was also extremely cold, and will definately wake you up! The room and bathroom were clean, and that staff was very helpful with directions. The day we were scheduled to leave my boyfriend had asked for an extension for our check out time. We did a gospel brunch at the House of Blues, and our flight did not leave until later in the afternoon. He was told that the hotel did not provide extensions for check out, and that if we wanted to keep our luggage in storage rather than hauling it all across the city, it would cost $.50 per bag. I have stayed in plenty of hotels, and have never had to pay a hotel just to store luggage! If you are looking for a hotel that just provides the basics such as a clean room, somewhere to sleep and a decent location this is the hotel for you. However, don't expect more. But then again, who goes on vacation just to stay in a hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “A Little Old, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Chicago Essex Inn for a Convention. The best part of the hotel it's the location close to Millenium Park. Because of the location you can walk, take a bus or a cab (being close makes them not so expensive) to major tourist attractions They have a shuttle that will take you to major tourist attractions. They could improve how frequently it leaves the hotel and how they announce departures. But it was very helpful. They were renovating the restaurant but we had plenty of options to eat walking distance. Free Breakfast is included but not good. Rooms are in fact old, but contrary to other reviews everything was clean and in order. They have a nice pool that we did not use but saw many people that did.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: vunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex for a week on business. I had a room with a king-size bed. It was small (15x12 maybe) but ok, desk chair only, no lounge chair. I could see the Navy Pier fireworks from the window. The room seemed updated and so was the bathroom. Everything was clean. However, the bathroom was absolutely tiny. Not that I wanted to take a bath, but the tub was smaller than standard size. The sink was the circumfrence of a smallish dinner plate. You couldn't wash your face without splashing everywhere. I wouldn't stay here again as I like a nice big lobby, gift shop, room service, and restaurant. Essex had none of these. I think the restaurant will be open soon. Thank goodness for the Hilton next door. I went there for food. This will sound petty but there also is no online channel gude for the tv. You have no tv guide and have to use the plastic card in the room to find what channel you want to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Shezza0108
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Essex Inn for 3 nights following Las Vegas. Appreciate that any hotel would be hard to compare with Vegas spacious rooms etc. Firstly concerned when pulling up to the hotel as it seemed to be closed (paper all up at the windows - this is the restaurant being renovated) but not a good first sign. reception basic but functional. We were 2 adults and one child and was put on the 8th floor. Our room was very very small, two small double beds, hardly any space in the room to accomodate our luggage let alone walking round. Shower basin very dirty, room itself was clean enough but the whole hotel needs renovation. Typical city size hotel room but looking tired and shabby. Swimming pool had bugs floating, spent most of my time in it, fishing the wildlife out. Did not go in the gym. Hotel is in a prime location for Grant Park and the Field Museum etc, but if you want to go to the loop, you must have your walking boots with you as it is at least 30 minute walk (pleasant enough). Taxis are plentiful and not expensive. Hotel has a complimentary continental breakfast consisting of juice, granola bars, muffins or danish. As this is complimentary to us it was an added bonus. In summary economy hotel which needs a total refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alana33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Essex Inn because I was attending a conference taking place at the Hilton next door. I was only attending the conference for one day but I must say when I arrived at this hotel, I almost turned right back around. The only reason that I did not was because it was pre-paid. The pictures on their website make this place look much better than it was. The front of the hotel is no frills at all and the rooms are the same. My room was so small and cramped that I could barely put the ironing board up in it. The restaurant was closed and the continental breakfast they offered was awful! If you want a very basic place to stay, this could be acceptable but I was very disappointed after seeing the pictures and the description online. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: lottie252
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this my mum and dad who are both in there 50s and my younger brother who is 17 and, we all loved it. me and my brother shared a room and were supprised that we each had a double bed and not two singles. the beds were very comfy except for the pillows that were a bit hard. the room was quite large and had a huge flat screen tv with all the channels you could ask for. it also came with a mini fridge and coffie and tea making facilities. the bathroom was small but had a seperate room where the sink and mirror were so you could get ready without having to worry about someone needing to use the bathroom. the rooms were cleaned daily and towels also replaced daily. the view from our room was of the hilton opposite and you could see some of the lake. however my pearents room a few doors down had an amazing view of the scears tower. the hotel did have a swimming pool and gym however we didnt use them as there was so much to see and do in chicago and its all just a short walk from the hotel or a 5 min taxi. The hotel however could do with somemore lifts as we often found ourselves waiting quite a while or that the lift was too full for us to fit. a continental brakfast was also included but it wasn't to our taste, just some muffins and fruit. the hotel staff were the most helpful i have found in any hotel i have stayed. any question you had they were more than happy to help. I would recomend this hotel to anyone on a budget and staying for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel, should not be classified as a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: angelic046
Reviews.Content: Amazing, amazing, amazing... super helpful staff, there was free shuttles available which would take you to all the top sightseeing, sights! The room was spacious, clean neat and the view we were given was wonderful. This hotel surprised us considering it is classified as a budget hotel. A must stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: xXDominiquePXx
Reviews.Content: We had to move rooms on morning one and request a full refund on day three. We had massive bed bugs and received over 50 bites from the critters. Staff responded fantastically gave us a full refund n paid for the antiseptic stuff we needed to buy. We found four bed bugs,(one squashed) varying from big to little in our bed....disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Okay on all levels, just not great.”
Reviews.Author: Montybroom
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Essex Inn. The location is classed as "the loop", it is at the very bottom of the loop and it is a good 30 minute walk into the city centre proper. The hotel is starting to look it's age, rooms are a decent standard but the bathrooms could do with a major overhaul. There is no in room safe but there are safe deposit boxes at reception, they are free and are a little more hassle though. There is a large fridge in the room which was good. Reception staff were fine if a little uninterested at times. Maids and bell hop were all good and very helpful. The restaurant was shut for refurbishment but the hotel supplied a complementary American breakfast during this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location, close to lots.”
Reviews.Author: 5moores
Reviews.Content: We traveled over spring break. The hotel per night average was $129 and we received great service. The pool is a little cold and the free breakfast isn't much but we took advantage of the free shuttles to attractions. The room was clean, it was quiet, we had a good view, but most of all EVERYONE was helpful, polite and generally interested in making sure we had a positive stay. I would recommend this property to others interested in having a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great if u wanna be roasted like a turkey!”
Reviews.Author: bitty33
