Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a 2 night stay for part of my 9 year old daughters spring break. I had researched several hotels on the internet before we decided on Essex. Honestly I knew it wasn't gonna be the best hotel but there are a few things that people should know before staying here. When we walked in the front desk had us reserved for 2 rooms.. We originally were going to have my teeneage son with us. I'm not sure if they were being nice and thought maybe we would want an extra room or maybe they know that their rooms are pretty small and thought after seeing it we would want another room. We also asked for a smoking room not knowing if there were any smoking areas in or outside the hotel. We were reserved a non-smoking room.. They also fixed that. The front desk staff were very pleasant although besides checking in and checking out we didn't need them too much.. The biggest issue I had was the temp of the hotel. There isn't a way to control the room temp so u get whatever it's set at.. We had to have the window open beacause it was unbearable and it was quite noisey from the traffic and people outside yelling all night long.. I even heard a staff member yelling good night to coworkers at 4 a.m.. We weren't the only ones complaining about the heat. I talked to several people in the elevator and they all had the same problem. As for the pool we did use that as well as the sauna both evenings. It may have been a little chilly but nothing that the body doesn't get used to after a couple of minutes. It was a great way to relax after a day of a lot of walking and kept my girl busy for awhile. We did use the ice machine.. no problems..We didn't use any of the vending machines because we brought our own snacks..Just know that u cannot take coolers in the hotel but they have small fridges in the room. So we brought a small cooler in the truck and just transported the food. Free internet was great as well to look for food places since you are kind of far away from most eating and shopping. We tried Yolk and it was fast, friendly and yummy.. about 30 dollars for the three of us and its 2 blocks south right on Michigan.. Oh and the last thing the hotel has a shuttle to the museum but they do not bring you back. buses are cheap it cost about 5 dollars for us to get back.. Overall I may or may not stay here again. Depends on what i plan on doing while in Chicago..

Reviews.Title: “Beware! If you plan on pay more than $100 spend your money elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: jean2121
Reviews.Content: I am not into complaining, however future guests at this hotel deserve to know what to expect in this case. After looking at the description and pictures on the website, we were left very dissaponted with the reality of the hotel. A pretty shabby lobby, and the restaurant under construction was what we walked into. They also refused to let us use a rolling luggage cart to take our bags to our room. That's what they are for, right? We had reserved a King size room and were given a Queen when we arrived. When I asked about the king we reserved and was on the confirmation email, I was told it was only looked at as a suggestion, not a reservation. However, NOWHERE in the reservation process does it mention this, so BEWARE. The pool looked nice, but there are no other ammenities like room service,etc... and no other perks you find at other hotels in this price range. When we got to our room, the people in the room next to us were extremely loud, yelling, fighting, and cussing so loud there might as well not have been a wall between us, because we couldn't tell. The bathtub filled with water while you showered, and the sink is TINY and didn't drain well at all either. The ice machines didn't work and the vending machine ate $4. So, in my opinion stay somewhere else unless you are getting a really good deal. I won't be returning though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Shudie
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. It did everything it said on the box. The service was friendly. The room was clean. The bed was comfy. Had a view from my room of Lake Michigan. Great location just out of the busyness but close enough to walk to everything (I met someone who was staying right in centre and said the noise was unbearable). This place was quiet and functional. Certainly no the Ritz but for the $, well worth it! Re breakfast - yep, not the best - everything had too much sugar in it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Pennden
Reviews.Content: Not over-the-top amazing, but met expectations. Aside from negative "rush hour" elevator wait times and an overloaded sunday checkout, the bed was comfortable and the room clean. It's an older building, so no A/C in the winter - just a heads up for folks that like a cold hotel room for sleeping. A few things seemed on the verge of breaking (shower stall door and window), and didn't try the pool, breakfast, or gym. But that's because there is so much to do and see right within walking distance. For breakfast, try "Yolk" just 2 blocks south. Yum.

Reviews.Title: “NO customer satisfaction - you can do better!!!”
Reviews.Author: skaluzny
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel I will ever stay at, and would recommend the same to anyone coming to Chicago. There are many other hotel values available in the area around the same area. You just have to read the reviews. Reputable and customer driven hotels (quality hotels) are clear to see. This hotel is not one of them. My wife planned an overnight stay just to get away for a special evening downtown. She was duped by the hotel website into planning a stay. Everything was planned and we were excited to go. I work out of town and when she told me where she made reservations I searched the hotel on the internet . I was not pleased initially, but figured we would give it a try as I was anxious to go and reservations were made. As luck would have it, I found out late Friday that I would have to leave Sunday morning to a new job site. The Saturday overnight stay would not allow me time to prepare for Sunday. It turned out because of my job, we would have to cancel our reservation. I called the hotel in the morning and the man in reservations said he would cancel our reservation, but the hotel would still charge me for the night. I was not aware that there was a 24-hour cancellation policy, but it is in the fine print on the website, it is stated. I asked him if there was anything he could do to help me out. He said no. I asked about a voucher possibly. There was nothing. I asked to speak to the manager.and got the same results. I work for a company where one of my responsibilities is customer satisfaction. I understand well the value of customer satisfaction. Although, by rule, the hotel is right charging me a nights stay, but I guess what bothers me more is the smug attitude and careless response I got from reservations as well as the hotel manager. From what I've read in the reviews, this is normal. What great diplomats for people visiting our Great City of Chicago! I wish this operation would go away. Hopefully I can do my small part in making that happen. Take my advice. Spend a few more dollars and stay at a hotel that you will enjoy. I'd hate to see you throw your hard-earned money away staying at a place where they could care less about their guests. It pays to check the hotel reviews on this or similar websites. Too many bad reviews about customer service, cleanliness, and comfort. You can probably bet that this is not a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, good rooms, lousy breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: KiwiBjork
Reviews.Content: Got off to a slow start when I called to ask for the main cross street north of the hotel and I was given the immediate (and small) cross street. When we did get to the hotel we were fortunate enough to check in early and drop our bags. This trip was strictly to pay a visit to a friend and the hotel was perfectly fine for that task. Our suite was not large, but roomy enough. Slightly noisy being near the elevator, but the view of the park across Michigan Ave was so pretty at night I won't remember that noise for much longer. The pool is very unique and I would love to see it in the summer with the garden in bloom. Breakfast the main downfall - prepackaged everything: muffins, sweetrolls, even juice cups and oatmeal cups. Not what I would have liked, but the fresh fruit was nice to have. I would stay here again, but I would plan for an early lunch after the ho-hum breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kmfitz55
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Chicago on a cold and blustery morning after a miserable Greyhound bus trip. I called the Essex to see if I could leave my luggage with them as it was only 9a.m. and check-in time wasn't until 4p.m. The concierge said my room was ready and I could check-in early. She was wonderful! I was not charged for checking in early. The hotel is undergoing renovations and its restaurant is closed. She gave me coupons for substantial discounts and free desserts at local restaurants, as well as a map of Chicago. I had a room with a single king-size bed, which was very comfortable. The room was large and comfortable. An iron and hair dryer were provided. There was also a small refrigerator in the room where I stashed some of my food items. There was a self-serve laundry room on my floor. The hotel provides a breakfast of pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and tea. The location is terrific. It's not far from Union Station. Had the weather been warmer I would have walked from there to the Essex. I'll never stay anyplace else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: ExplosionsInTheTy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex with some of friends as we attended the Chicago Advertising Federation's Career Day. We booked this hotel because it was one of the cheapest in the Loop and it was well worth the price. The rooms weren't too big, but it was fine for the four of us in it. I liked how each floor was themed after an artist or art genre. It added to the hotel's personality. The refrigerator was a nice bonus as it held all of our drinks - we are college students after all. It was hard to find the right temperature in the room with the two-pipe air conditioner. It was way too hot most of the time and we had to resort to opening a window to cool off the room. The continental breakfast wasn't the greatest, but it was enough to fill us up as we left for the day. The pool was disappointing compared to the photos the hotel provides, but we didn't have time to swim anyway. The location is great if you want to spend your days at the museums. The free shuttle to the Magnificent Mile was nice and convenient, and the Harrison Red Line stop was just a couple blocks away. It was a little further South than I would have liked and not really that great for nightlife. The Loop is pretty much a ghost town after the work day ends and we found ourselves taking long L rides or $20 cabs to Wrigleyville and Lincoln Park to go to the bars and clubs. If you're in Chicago for a family vacation, then this really shouldn't be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location made the trip go smoothly”
Reviews.Author: k166a
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms with awesome views of Lake Michigan and downtown (Sears Tower, etc). The staff was more than friendly and helpful. The bellhop even arranged a taxi for us to get to the airport that was cheaper and faster than the one we had found on our own. The only negative I can think of for this hotel was the angsty girl serving us the less-than-tasty continental breakfast. After we had cleaned up most of our own mess, she finally came over to the table and told us it's her job to do that. There was no one else eating. She was standing there doing nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, service a little lacking”
Reviews.Author: TeacherLadyToledo_OH
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention at the Lakeside Center. The website had indicated that there would be a shuttle there, but upon arrival I was told this was not the case. I wound up needing to grab cabs each day, which was an expense I was not counting on. No one available to help bring luggage up to my room. Location is great, right across the street from Grant park, walking distance to Museum campus, and Tast of Chicago was going on during my visit, just a couple blocks away. Good restaurants within a short walk. Great views of the lake and city in my King Deluxe room, with floor to ceiling windows on 2 sides as it was on the corner of the building. Great pool and rooftop garden area. Would definately stay again for a visit to downtown and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: pnally2006
Reviews.Content: Just got home from Chicago. Stayed 2 nights at the Essex. The reason we ended up there was their Buddy Guy Package. Got 1 night stay, valet service and 2 tickets to the SOLD OUT Buddy Guy show at his place Legends which is a short walk from the hotel.Had a great time!!! Hotel was nice and clean and the staff, especially Chris and Rico, were very helpful to us. Moved us to a smoking room after we got there because i forgot to request one. Gave us directions and coupons to close restaurants and bars. Couldn't have been happier. If we get back to Chicago, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room in good location”
Reviews.Author: Loriis
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews of the Essex Inn so I was pretty nervous when we booked this hotel. I did not set my expectations too high, and I was pleased with the room. This is a great hotel if you want a basic, clean room, but not the choice for you if you want a lot of extras. We stayed in a two room family suite. Not sure suite is the accurate description as it was very small for four people. We were not in the room much so size was only an issue when we were getting around to go out. We happened to be on the 4th floor near the pool area so took advantage of the huge shower and counter space in the changing room. The rooms were clean and bed was cozy. Perfect for those using the hotel to change and sleep, but probably not wonderful for groups hoping to relax at the hotel. The restaurant was not open during the three days we were there, but they do offer a limited breakfast and there are several places within a short walk. CTA routes run right outside the front door, so we parked our car, paid the hotel parking rate, and bought a city pass at the Osco 3 blocks away. For the price, we plan to return to the Essex.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at the Essex”
Reviews.Author: Traceyann
Reviews.Content: Arrived late evening at the hotel. Warm welcome by the desk staff and bell boy (man) Room was cosy and very clean. As mentioned in other reviews the lobby could do with a makeover . Yolk for breakfast very tasty and the Miller Pub 6 blocks away good food and not too expensive. For the shopper Target, Whole foods, Michaels and Marshalls all within walking distance. The area felt safe during the day and night. Grant park across the street from the hotel was an added bonus. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK. Great location. Good value. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: FishLoverDave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the weekend after Thanksgiving and for the following week to attend a giant medical convention in Chicago. The location is great: right in the loop not far from museums and the shopping district. There were lots of nearby restaurants within a few block walk, and a restaurant right in the hotel too but I never ate there. I found a place called "Thai Spoon" at the corner of Wabash and 6th street that was a cheap eat, and was maybe a 5 minute walk, most of which could be through the Chicago Hilton right next door to this hotel. The room they originally gave me was directly across from the elevator, and I asked for a different room so I wouldn't be bothered by the noise, and they very cheerfully gave me a room on a higher floor, and upgraded me from a single to a double in the process and didn't charge me any more than the original smaller room. The room was perfectly adequate. They have an antiquated heating/cooling system here that's either heat or cold not both. You adjust the temperature essentially by adjusting the fan speed. The room must have been 100'F when I walked in, but you can open the window, and after turning the fan off, it took about 2 hours on a cold November day to cool the room off. I left the heat off the rest of my stay and it was about right. temperature-wise. For those who watch TV, they have a wide-screen TV and a greater number of cable TV channels than any hotel I ever stayed at. The bathroom was small and crowded but adequate. The shower/commode is in a separate room from the sink. It was hard to go into the john and close the door, so I just left it open, which might pose a problem if you're not alone. There wasn't any really good place for the coffee maker in the room, so they keep it in the piece of furniture the TV sits on, and you have to move it over to the miniature bathroom and plug it in there, crowding out your toothbrush and dental floss in the already crowded area. No big deal. The gave me extra coffee 'filters' since I'm a caffeine nut, and remembered to do that every day after I asked the first day. The stopper in the sink was permanently closed when I got into the room, and I propped it open with a shoehorn, but by the third day they had fixed it automatically. I think the tub drain was very, very slow, almost stopped up, and it was that way the whole time. I never complained about it to the management. There was a report of bedbugs here, as for most of the Chicago hotels, and I purposely brought one of those little LED high-intensity flashlights to do a thorough room inspection before unpacking. I really tore the bed apart, and saw that they had (correctly) enclosed the mattress inside of a case that was sealed with a cable tie that couldn't be opened. The box spring was also free of any evidence of bugs, and I got down on my hands and knees and carefully looked in places they never vacuum and saw absolutely no evidence whatsoever of any varmints. I was also pleased that the bed coverings were white, which would be make any evidence of bedbugs easier to spot since their excrement causes brown streaks which I saw none of. At all. I felt safe. Kudos to the management here! I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have free in-room wireless internet that's unfortunately pretty slow. I clocked it at ~30 kB. Better than dial-up but the slowest download speed I ever saw in a hotel. (My low-end broadband at home is ~170 kB.) You can pay a daily fee (~$6-10? depending on the speed) and get faster service, which is obviously the idea, but for just checking e-mail and such it was perfectly adequate. They do have a business center which might have faster (?plug-in) internet but I never sought it out. Sound proofing was not great but adequate. I heard doors opening and closing in neighboring rooms. No big deal. The elevators were a little slow. The people at the desk and the bellmen were most helpful and it was speedy checking in and out. There's a nice waiting area in the lobby where you can wait for friends or transportation. I originally chose this place because of the exercise facility and pool but was so busy I never got to use, much less even see the facility. It's there if you want a workout. They have a free shuttle bus that goes up and down Michigan Ave. The driver was kind enough to go out of his way for me, and take me to a place that's not normally on his route. All-in-all, an excellent choice. Reasonably priced on Chicago standards, convenient, and mostly well maintained. The personnel were friendly and helpful. I'd recommend this hotel and stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Chicago? STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmgwin
Reviews.Content: I spend several days this past October at Chicago's Essex Inn and can't say enough GOOD about this place. I have 3 small children and from the time I met the General Manager, Andy, in the lobby of the hotel to the time we checked out, we were treated to service far above the price of the room! The location was perfect, the room clean and the entire experience more than I was expecting. Stay here on your next trip, and tell Andy I sent you!!! Kevin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: jsjkgoodell
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We went for a convention at the Hilton, the Essex is right next door. Rooms are small, but clean. Fridge in every room. On the weekends, they offer a free shuttle to downtown locations. Very friendly, accomodating staff. We had adjoining rooms which was nice for our group. They did charge to store bags when we checked out, but only $1.00 pp. It was worth it, because bellman had a cab when we needed it to get to the airport, and our luggage was loaded and ready to go. All in all, the hotel was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel close to Millenium Park and Field Museum”
Reviews.Author: charlooza
Reviews.Content: Our family went up to Chicago to see a Chicago Fire game. There were 6 adults and 4 young kids in our group. It must have been a busy weekend because we had a hard time finding a reasonably priced hotel in the downtown area and ended up at the Essex Inn. Overall it was a good hotel stay - the location was across the street from the Field Museum and Millennium Park, which the kids loved - and it was close to a very good breakfast place called Yolk, which is a couple of blocks south of the hotel. If we had to, we would stay here again, although it wouldn't be our first choice. Pros: + Decent location + Reasonable price + Heated indoor pool (kids loved it!) + Clean rooms Cons - Smaller room size (tiny bathrooms) - Inability to control the heat/cooling - it's central unit that you really can't change - Charges for wireless Other notes: We had requested, upon booking, that our rooms be adjoining, but when we got there they could not accommodate our request. Unfortunately we ended up on 3 different floors, although all at the same end of the hotel, so the back-and-forth wasn't too bad. Our room had a decent view and the windows went all the way to the floor, so our kids thought that was super cool. My brother and sister-in-law's room seemed to have issues regulating the temperature so they were constantly battling with being too hot or cold. They eventually asked for a different room and the hotel did accommodate their request fairly quickly. The room they moved into was ok, temperature-wise. The valet parking is pretty expensive at the hotel itself ($34+ per day), but if you don't mind public parking lots there is one right behind the hotel (1 block directly west) where the daily rates were like $18 a day. We didn't require much from the hotel in terms of service, so I can't really speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but uncomfortable and grungy”
Reviews.Author: wsujen
Reviews.Content: Pros: quiet, friendly staff, convenient location Cons: terrible room temperature, uncomfortable beds, not clean, grungy This hotel is not nearly as nice as the photos on the website make it look. The room is dark and dingy; sheets have small holes in them, furniture is worn, sink was clogged. On the second day, I came back to my room to find a huge fan on the floor. The next-door room had flooded and our floor was wet. The front desk people were polite but didn't offer to do anything about it. I don't think they were planning to clean the carpet either, which made me feel that the entire hotel was extremely dirty. In addition, the heating/cooling system was awful and out-of-date. It was a "2-pipe system" so the hotel determined the temperature and the room only controlled whether the fan was on or off. The beds were hard and between that and the hot room I didn't sleep well at all. Oh, and I paid for Internet ($5.95 for 24 hours) but it didn't work well at all; I lost the wireless connection every 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to visit again.”
Reviews.Author: queen409
Reviews.Content: This was my birthday vacation, I take one every year. I arrived in Chicago at 10 am, Saturday morning, March 20, 2010. It was really cold and rainy with light snow, my check in time at the hotel was in the afternoon, but I came straight from Union station to the Essex. I had no problem getting my room as soon as I got there, I was so thankful for that, I was wet and cold and the hotel made it all better with my nice warm room waiting for me regardless of the time. The staff was very helpful and very polite, I had everything I needed, The food was excellent, I have nothing but fond memories of my birthday stay in Chicago. My room was neat and clean, The hotel was close to where I wanted to go for the weekend. The weather improved a bit, but it was March in Chicago, no doubt, The Essex was everything I had hoped for, I had no problems, check in was amazing as well as check out, very smooth on all counts, Yes I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly helpful staff good location”
Reviews.Author: maroDublin
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel are the staff they were always polite and helpful. the hop on hop off tour bus stops right outside which was very handy for sightseeing. the only bad thing i would say about the hotel is ,the first night we arrived we ate in the restaurant in the hotel and i wouldnt recommend it , the food was just about average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't mind walking a little bit”
Reviews.Author: kamswim85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location in my opinion. Others may not feel that way because we were on the South Side of Michigan Ave across from Grant Park (so not in the center of things). It was about a half hour walk in one direction to the Magnificent Mile and about a 15 minute walk in the other direction to Soldier Field, the Aquarium and Field Museum. You could take the metro to some of these destinations, but I enjoy walking. The hotel itself was older but the rooms were remodeled and were newer. The windows was what made me nervous after reading reviews. There were full windows on two sides of our rooms and other reviews said that you it was very loud. While the windows weren't soundproof it didn't keep us from sleeping. The beds were also very comfortable. The hotel staff was great and always willing to help us with whatever we needed. However it is Chicago and it is an expensive city so be prepared for them to charge you for everything, including plastic silverware! One block behind the hotel started to get a little sketchy at night, but I think that was just because it was less traveled and other than Michigan Ave they didn't make much effort to remodel and spruce up those streets (that is out of the center of town -the center of town was all very detail oriented and beautiful). We booked this hotel through priceline - we did the "name your own price option" we ended up getting this hotel for about $100 a night. So for the money we paid it was well worth it. All and all we had a great experience and we would recommend this hotel to people that don't mind walking to see and explore the beautiful city of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “An enigma”
Reviews.Author: JibbaSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and the following sets out the good, bad and indifferent. Good The fitness room was roomy and had a good range of equipment for a hotel. The only thing missing were a couple of floor mats. Some may say the the framing looked tired but I wouldn't see it as an issue. My wife thought the pool was fine and had no issues with it. The room was a decent size with flat sreen TV and seemed clean. The noise from the train was not an issue. Poor The sink had no plug and the cover for the drain hole in the shower kept coming loose. We only had a shower which was small for the size of room. Also on our first day it was very difficult to get warm water in the shower but after that it settled down. The colour scheme in the hallways was dark and gloomy, a lighter scheme could have made such a difference. There was no booklet in the room about the hotel or the area. The reception was one of the smallest I have seen. There was little interaction with staff Indifferent The location ok and you could walk into the centre or use the bus stop across the way. If coming by train from O'Hare select your station carefully to minimise the walk and look at the loop. Can someone please tell me why in this day and age we have to pay a charge of $5.99 for wi fi. This is not the only hotel to do this. I believe the Hard Rock at their rates still make a charge. Look I don't expect something for nothing. Bearing in mind most people will want to access wi fi why not just raise the nightly rate slightly and all customers share the cost. Summary This hotel which is smaller than the giant Hilton next door should be able to offer a more personalised service and fel more welcoming. It needs to look at the colour schemes to give a lighter feel and keep an eye on the small things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful roof deck and pool”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid929
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a "cheapie" weekend trip to Chicago and the Essex Inn fit the bill very nicely. We usually stay north of the river but we liked being so close to the beautiful Grant Park and the Museum Campus. We had a room on the 14th floor that gave us a great view of the lake and the park, even though it didn't overlook Michigan Avenue directly. (The downside of this room was that it was too close to the elevators and the walls are thin. We were woken up by a rowdy wedding party way past midnight. I would not recommend any rooms close to the elevator for this reason!) The room was on the small side but immaculate. The hotel is updating its decor. The lamps and mirrors and bathroom appointments are all new and modern; only the carpet and wall poster are out-of-date. There was a mini-fridge, which is always a nice touch in a hotel room. The bed was comfortable. I like reading in bed so I appreciated the individual reading lamps over the pillows. The bathtub did not drain but that problem was quickly fixed. What we liked best--and the reason we'd stay again at the Essex Inn--was the fabulous roof deck and pool. The deck had a lovely garden and comfortable lounge chairs. Great place to enjoy a drink after a long day of sightseeing! The pool was large and a life guard was present. The water, unlike many hotel pools, was NOT freezing cold. Another nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the South Loop”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: First off, the Essex Inn merits a 3.5, but that rating option is not available. It's a good value, comfortable place to stay, minus some of the extras of more expensive downtown Chicago hotels. The hotel has a small, functional lobby flanked by bright, airy seating areas with a somewhat dated look to them. The front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient. My room, a king single, was compact but not claustrophobic. The bathroom was small, but not oppressively so. Some reviews described the bathrooms as the smallest ever - clearly they've never stayed in a moderate-price London hotel. The bed was very comfortable, the room furnishings were very modern, and the mini-fridge was a big plus. The flat-screen TV was nice, but lacked pay movie options. Shower water pressure was very good. If you're a traveler who likes to wake to the silver coffee pots and trays of a room-service breakfast, don't stay here - you won't find it. But if you don't care about those amenities and want a good price ($57 per night on Priceline), comfy room and a location across from Grant Park, you'll love it. The hotel is on S. Michigan Ave & 8th, right across from Grant Park and close to museums and Soldier Field. For transit purposes, the CTA Harrison red line station is two short blocks away if you use the Polk St. entrance (unstaffed, you've got to have your CTA card already). Also, the bus routes that go down S. Michigan (King Drive, Cottage Grove) all stop next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Family Friendly, Awesome Weekend.”
Reviews.Author: redgirl1
Reviews.Content: Making reservations on line through a new web site always makes me nervous. My family needed 3 rooms, so after I made reservations, I called to the Essex for confirmation. I also asked for the 3 rooms to be together and it was no problem. We had a small problem checking in when the online site, somehow grouped our 2 9-year olds as the names on one of the rooms. The front desk staff was great in getting it all worked out. Our rooms were together, as requested. 2 rooms were adjoining and it worked great. The rooms have been updated since my last visit and were clean and bright, Small, well, yeah, a little, but it is an older hotel, nothing we did not expect. The kids, 13, 12, 9, 9 and 7 loved the pool. The outside sitting area gives a great view of the chicago skyline. We walked, we used the shuttle and taxis to get around. Learned a lot about what we should have done and will plan our transportation better next time. The shuttle runs on the hour, but does not start early on the weekends. Would have been nice to have a few more timing options. Pick ups would also be nice, instead of just drop-offs. The staff was always very helpful. The valet, the bell captain, our luggage guy, the front desk staff, everyone who answered the phone (and our many questions) was fabulous. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for some but not all”
Reviews.Author: Farmerzilla
Reviews.Content: The Essex Inn is well located for many of the main attractions and is on a main bus route that makes it easy to get downtown. It is however not particularly well located in terms of a variety of restaurants and we always had to plan our day around getting to other areas for meals. The on-site restaurant is passable but not particularly recommended given the vast choice of excellent eateries in Chicago. The hotel as a whole is good, the pool and fitness area are large and well maintained. The staff is friendly and helpful. The cost of parking sucks but thats the case with every downtown hotel in Chicago. Unrelated to the hotel, my wife and I hadn't been in Chicago since 1993 and didn't remember the city being quite so a la carte. Particularly some of the attractions. We used the City Pass but some items were additional costs like the U-505 at the M of S and I and 3D movies at the Field Museum. I still love Chicago and hope to return in the future but make sure you're not expecting a cheap trip.$$$$$$

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Bears Pkg.--excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: suechucky
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Chicago Bears package and saved hundreds of dollars. It included free valet parking, Bears game tickets with excellent seats, and the room for the night. The room was extremely clean and extremely quiet. The beds were a little soft and I do think they were doubles. The room is small and the bathroom is very small, but for just a night or two, it was just fine. Sometimes we had to wait a bit for the elevators. The pool is on the 4th floor and has a great outdoor deck with nice chairs and tables for relaxing. There is even a lifeguard for the pool. We ate Chicago style pizza at Lou Malnatti's which was just 2 blocks away. Get there early--it was crowded with Bears fans before gametime. We had great weather and were able to walk the mile+ to Soldier's Field for the game. The next day we checked out but stowed our bags with the bellman and took the Double Decker Bus Tour for $27 a person. The bellman can give you the information. He was very helpful. The bus took us all over the place and you could get on and off all day and see the many sights. I highly recommend the double decker bus tour. My family and I hope to do the Essex Hotel Bears package again sometime. It was very worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for me”
Reviews.Author: maegeegee
Reviews.Content: Hotel met all of my needs for a 2 night stay with 3 Grandchildren. We walked to the Field Museum, Aquarium and to Millenium Park, hotel also provides a free shuttle one way to several major attractions. Great pool and very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveMechanicsburg_PA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in relation to a meeting held across the street at the Hilton, where rooms were more expensive. The service at the Essex was marginally OK, and the facility was not 4 Star. But it was convenient, clean, quiet and everything I bargained for. I will stay here and walk across the street to save $30-50/night the next time I have a meeting at the Hilton. It has an OK fitness center and a very nice pool with a nice, park-front, outdoor seating area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable for the most part, but if I had to do it again, we'd pick a different hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BoxerMom07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double queen room and living room with a pull out for our party of 6. Our rate was $250 per night, with tax. After we dropped off our car, we went to check in and was informed our room was not ready yet. No matter, we hung out in the lobby for 30 minutes. When we were finally able to check in, we went up to our level and made our way through the dark hallway. Our room was tucked into the corner wing, the door was adjacent to another room, the layout was very strange and unexpected, it felt a little bit seedy. Once in our room, everyone made a joke about how small the bathrooms were, if two adults were to walk past each other, it would cause a traffic jam. The picture from another traveler with his hands over the sink was not digitally remastered. The sink was very small, not that it mattered. The amenities were very bleak. Some soap, shampoo and lotion in the bathroom. The room did not have any channel directories for the TVs (we had 2) and there were no booklet giving hours of the pool and sauna. The Positives: - the concierge was very friendly and responsive, we needed a wine bottle opener, and they somehow came up with one and delivered it to our room. - the queen beds were very comfortable. - we had a nice view, extending out to the Planetarium and the lake. - the pool was nice, they had floating pads and noodles for the kids. I've read some people complaining that it gets overtaken by children, but I can't really complain since our party had two kids under the age of 12. The Negatives: - check in is at 4:00 pm and checkout at 11:00 am, which I didn't feel it was long enough for a traveler who pays a nightly rate during peak season. - we heard the train at night. It wasn't enough to keep us up, but the noise wasn't faint either. - we found a hair and stain in the pull-out bed, but again, the employees were gracious enough to bring a whole set of sheets and pillows once we called the front desk. - the AC stopped working in our room. It wasn't an issue with us since we're more warm-blooded anyways, but I can see how it may annoy other travelers. The info-you-need-to-know: - check in is at 4:00 pm and checkout at 11:00 am. - Pool closes at 10:00pm - the hotel does not allow you to bring a cooler, not even as a storage to transport drinks to the rooms and back to the vehicle. - they have wi-fi, at $6. - no complimentary breakfast. - there is a free shuttle, which we didn't take advantage of. Couple of the destinations are; John Hancock Tower and N. Michigan Ave. You'd have to call and check what the times were. - the bellhop can store your baggage if you wanted to do more sight-seeing after checkout, but they charge $0.50/bag. For a party of 6, we had to pass. I didn't appreciate how they nickel-and-dime you. - there is a in-room fridge and coffee maker. In conclusion, the rooms were clean and comfortable for the most part, but if we had booked earlier, and if it wasn't during peak season, I could get a lot more for the money and we'd stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TV didn't work and never fixed!”
Reviews.Author: wisc_teacher
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I spent the night in Chicago at the Essex. We arrived at 4:30 and of course my son immedicately tried to turn on the TV when we got to our room. Although plugged in, it didn't turn on. I immediately called the front desk and they said 'The engineer will be right up'. Fast forward... pool (no hot tub), nice dinner with family, back to room at 8:00. TV still didn't turn on. I call the front desk again and let him know that no engineer has been to our room. No problem... engineer will be right there. We went down the hall to my sister's room and watched TV and hung out. Back to the room at 10:00... you guessed it, TV still not working and no comment from staff. The next morning I went to the front desk and told them how disappointed I was with the lack of working TV and they just said 'sorry... are you checking out now?'. Not very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't park in their parking garage!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestArtist
Reviews.Content: This review is more about the parking garage than the hotel experience itself. Our stay at the Essex was actually very good for the price. Except for our vehicle damage from the parking garage, our whole Chicago experience up until that point had been nearly flawless. What a disappointment after checking out. It was noon on Sunday just after walking back from a church service just a few blocks away. We were feeling great about Chicago, and great about the day before heading home. The damage is on the bottom and side... looks like the valet driver had a smaller, lower red car and turned too close to my van when parking. Gave my van a nice scratch and dent with the other vehicle's front bumper. We were so busy filling the back of the van with suitcases that we missed the damage until we stopped for food about 20 minutes out of town. We called immediately... had to wait about 10 days for the claim to go through. They didn't ask for photos nor did they ask for much information at all; so we suspected we were going to be left high and dry. Basically, since we can't prove they did it... we're on our own to flip the bill. And since, technically, the connected parking garage is a separate business from the hotel, the hotel wonâ€™t accept responsibility either. With valet parking, this should have NEVER happened. If driving into Chicago...DO NOT use their parking garage!! You'll end up paying for a lot more than the hotel room. Not the way to end an otherwise great trip. Puts a sour note on the whole Chicago experience.

Reviews.Title: “great place for families”
Reviews.Author: turnbuckle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex for a 2-day tourist stop in Chicago. It was well situated for visit to field museum. The Hotel shuttle took us there. Also bus to museum of science & industry stops close by on Michigan Ave. We found the hotel quiet. Kids loved the pool and I loved sitting on the deck overlooking the park with my early morning coffee. 2 blocks to a Lou Malnati's Chicago pizza place. The staff at the Essex was tremendously helpful in finding buses, cabs, directions, etc. Rooms are small. There are few extras, no free internet access except to get boarding passes, no lobby coffee, etc. But the price was so good that I didn't mind. We wish we had planned to stay longer and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “On Chicago's front lawn”
Reviews.Author: jimsellshomes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been our choice on a couple of occasions when we have done bicycling events that started and ended at Grant Park. The most recent for the annual LATE Ride. The location is better suited for those looking to visit Millenium Park, Museum Campus or Soldier Field however it still has easy access to the loop and Mag Mile shopping. If you're looking for nightlife stick to river north and gold coast hotels. We have chosen to park our car at the Grant Park South lot a short walk north on Michigan Ave since it's cheaper than hotel parking and the in and out privilege offered by the Essex didn't concern us. Don't expect a great city view at this hotel but you can get a great lake view if you choose a east facing room. Another note is that the Chicago double decker bus tour has a stop right across the street to the north along Michigan Ave and you can purchase the hop on/off tour ticket and make a loop right back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Service, Wonderful Nostalgia”
Reviews.Author: cherokeechick
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Essex three times, all as an overnighter before catching the train. On this particular trip we wanted a room that faced Navy Pier so we could watch the fireworks from our room. The desk clerk worked with us until we found just the 'right' room. We were given an amazing room with the perfect view. The clerk was so helpful and friendly, we felt quite pampered. The location is fantastic. We have had queen, king and suite type rooms and all have been clean and comfortable. Folks who don't like the Essex most likely don't like old nostalgic hotels. This one evokes an Old Chicago feel with modern day comfort. Perfect for the middle-aged who appreciate good service, good value and don't need a lot of modern-day frills.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great location for our trip but...”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelle85
Reviews.Content: Here's the pros...good location across from Grant Park which was walking distance for us to go to Taste of Chicago. It was also close to the Red Line train that we took to Wrigley Field. The Hotel has a free shuttle to N. Michigan Ave.,a helpful bellman and good beds. Here's the cons - front desk staff was a bit surly(especially April) our request for a late check out was denied (they could have been booked and needed rooms), it's an older hotel and the bathrooms are small with showers There were a lot children and we think maybe the hotel caters to groups. I didn't get to the pool area/patio buy I heard it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for location”
Reviews.Author: my66olds
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a weekend trip. Small lobby area small bar, No FREE wireless internet. But overall it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk service was horrible”
Reviews.Author: Debi57SaintLouisMO
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel overall if you can overlook the people at the front desk. It is a great location, close to museums, the lobby is open and clean. The restaurant bar has the best service people who were great to us even with 3 kids between 7-9. They were friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The pool is awesome, the kids had a great time and unlike most hotel pools, this one had a lifeguard. The rooftop garden is really nice but it would have been fun to be able to sit out there and order a glass of wine to watch the city go by. The rooms were comfortable and the bed was great. The showers were a little small but not unlike any older hotel. The key card had an ad on it which says purchase Shedd VIP tickets at the hotel front desk. When I went to the front desk, no one seemed to know about what the VIP tickets meant and couldn't tell me what the price difference was. The website offers free shuttle services which makes several stops on Michigan Avenue, etc. We took the shuttle to the Shedd Aquarium on the first day we were there. The driver not only dropped us off at the Field House and advised us to walk to the Shedd, when I called to ask what time the shuttles ran to pick people up, I was advised they don't pick up anyone, it's only drop off service. The person I spoke with said we TOLD you we don't have pick up service and NO, he didn't. Otherwise, I would not have expected it. We had to take a cab back to the hotel. When we checked out, we asked if they would hold our bags after we checked out because we wanted to go to one more museum before we took the train. They held them for us at a fee of 50 cents per bag...can you say "nickel and dime your guests"? If the service in the restaurant/bar hadn't been so good and the food reasonably priced and fairly good, or the location was different, I would not recommend this hotel. The price was right but the attitude of the staff was definitely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aguilas
Reviews.Content: Our Room 314 was lovely, recently refurbished, very large, comfortable beds and gallons of hot water but no hairdryer!! The staff are extremely good, nothing was too much trouble, my friend collects country flag badges and they gave her a double USA and stars and bars for her collection. The concierge will recommend various excursions, to suit your taste and will also tell you what you might NOT enjoy which is pretty unusual. The hotel is in a great location close to the Museum Campus which includes the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum of Natural History and the Adler Planetarium and opposite Grant Park and the Millennium Park (adults as well as kids love the Bean and its good to play in the waters of the Crown Fountain on a hot day ) It is also right next to a trolley stop which will take you downtown. In addition the hotel provides a shuttle service to Water Tower Place with all its shops, on N Michigan Ave. This takes 14 people and is on a first come first served basis. It is popular so if you cant get a lift, you can walk to the Magnificent Mile about 10 blocks so not too bad depending on the weather. The hotel restaurant, the Savoy is quite good but very expensive, beer being $6 a pint which is double what you pay in most bars and while we did not have breakfast we were told it was around $15, we paid just $2.85 in diner round the back of the hotel, on Wabash, for a cheese bagel, egg, sausage and a coffee. The hotel also has a heated swimming pool plenty of sun loungers and fitness centre plus laundry facilities (washing machines and dryers) on the 3rd floor. If you are into Blues the famous Buddy GuyÂ´s Legends bar is down the street 1 block on the corner of Wabash and 8th and reception will give you a voucher for 50% off the cover charge reducing it to just $5. IMO well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: kjoyo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near Grant Park, Millenium Park and the Museum Campus. The indoor pool area is nice as is the outdoor seating area right outside the pool. The rooms have been updated but the exterior of the building as well as the interior hallways and lobby area are very dated. There is no information in the room regarding room service or hotel services - including pool hours. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the restaurant. We did park in a nearby public parking lot as suggested by another trip advisor customer-which worked out fine and saved a considerable amount of money over the hotel parking. Would I stay again? Maybe, if I couldn't get a nicer hotel nearby that was cheaper. We paid an average of $139. a night. Wi-fi is not free and the business center charges to use the computers. Overall, the staff was friendly. Maid service is just so-so. In-room refrigerators didn't seem to keep things very cold. Our room faced the pool area so we didn't have any problems with street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFan2010
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package holiday for our first trip to USA, was a little worried after reading very mixed reviews by other travellers. We need not have worried the hotel and rooms were very clean. The housekeeping staff changed bedding and towels upon request and kept our room spotless. Only saw the room we were allocated but it was very modern and the furnishings looked very new. Great view of lake Michigan and Museum Campus from the bedroom window. As other reviewers have mentioned the EL train can be heard in the hotel but it wasn't so loud that it woke us up in the morning or kept us awake at night. Great location within walking distance to Museum Campus so ideal if you have children, in addition the public transport system to other local attractions such as Navy Pier, Wrigley Field, Sears Tower etc is very good. The Hotel has a shuttle bus which will take you to North Michigan Ave, Navy Pier etc Would recommended you book your place in advance as it is very popular. Would definately stay here. Staff especially the Concierge were very helpful. There is an ATM in the hotel lobby which is also a plus point.

Reviews.Title: “great location, theme rooms, and horrendous ventilation”
Reviews.Author: archicityNY
Reviews.Content: this is a great location with updated rooms//they badly need ventilation revamps and bathroom updates//if you have allergies or breathing issues reconsider staying here//but it was cheap and clean, and the staff was friendly and efficient!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Quiet and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: JazzCruiser
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago with a friend for a jazz concert. We each had our own room on different floors. I must say that my room was very comfortable. I loved the decor - it matched my design taste. The bed was heavenly! I slept like a baby. I had one alarming incident while taking a shower the next morning. The steam from the shower set the fire alarm off in the room! I assume that's what it was because the ventilation in the bathroom was nonexistent. I had a similar experience in a San Francisco boutique hotel a few years ago. That hotel posted a sign in the bathroom to warn clients about the steam and what should be done to prevent an alarm going off. Perhaps the Essex could do something like that. Other than that incident, everything was great. From check-in to check-out my experience was flawless. I would definitely stay at the Essex again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: mrsblazer
Reviews.Content: After reading varied reviews about this hotel we arrived for our vacation slightly wary. We were very pleasantly surprised. Prior to our arrival we had booked tickets for Blackhawks games which the supplier could not sent to the U.K., after emailing the Essex they arranged for delivery of our tickets which they kept in their safe until our arrival. We arrived at 1pm and were greeted by Drew, who immediately assured us being early was no problem and that they had a king size room available. He then collected our tickets from the safe and handed them to us with our room keys. We went straight to our room and were delighted with a side view of the lake and the museum campus. The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. The bathroom was clean with plenty of clean towels, replacement toilet paper and face tissues were in a cupboard underneath the sink. The fridge was quite large and there was a good supply of tea, coffee, creamer etc with the coffee machine. Replacements were made daily. Towles and bedding were changed frequently. The pool was really warm and there were plenty of sun loungers around the pool and out on the patio. Towels were supplied at the pool and the showers were hot with an abundant supply of shower gel/shampoo and conditioner. Staff were extremely helpful and pleasant at all times. Taking time to show us places on the map and giving very accurate directions. If it is your first trip to Chicago then go to the Cultural Centre and book a tour with a Chicago Greeter. We did this online before our arrival. The greeters are volunteers and ask for your interests. We took an architectural tour of downtown and a trip to Wrigleyville. We went into buildings that you would walk passed and saw ceilings by Tiffany etc. The tour was 4 hours long. The service also includes a day pass for CTA transport. This amazing service was free and the greeters are not allowed to take a tip. Our greeter contacted us via email prior to the trip and answered queries we had before we arrived. Hackneys provides a good meal at reasonable prices and can be found on Dearborn and Printers Row. Bar Louies is a sports bar and offers a wide range of meals. They run a variety of offers on a daily basis. Can be found on Dearborn. For a trip back in time Ed Debevics is a fifties style diner. Their trademark is rudeness! Found on North Wells and Ontario. If looking for an alternative day a visit to the Science and Industry Museum is well worth it. There is the opportunity to go inside a german submarine, experience a wind tunnel, operate a tornado etc. Plenty to see and very interactive. Chicago is a fantastic city and the trip was made even more memorable by the stay at the Essex.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment, to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: MaryinIndy
Reviews.Content: To our surprise, the family suite was much smaller than we thought. The beds were very comfortable but the pull out couch was old, smelly and according to our teenagers, the springs poked them and was very uncomfortable. No heat/air control whatsoever and we were glad we could crack open the windows because we were dying from being warm! We arrived early and the rooms were not ready until right at 4pm. I work at AAA and called to ask them what rating this hotel had and they stated 4 stars. It most definately did not feel like a 4 star hotel! The restaurant downstairs had the worst customer service we had ever experienced! The manager even yelled at us for closing the door that the waitress had propped open for me because I was a bit warm upon arriving for breakfast with my family after I cooled off and we overheard two elderly patrons complaining of being cold. He was horribly rude and we left! The only upside to staying here was the nice pool they had and the friendliness of the valet team and the bus driver that drove my kids and I to the Hancock Center. Other than that, it was a disappointment, to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: FLinNaples
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was right next door to the Hilton where we were attending a conference. The rate was half of the Hilton and still offered everything we needed. We had a king size bed room but it was a little small but that really wasn't an issue because we were only in the room at night. I do admit that the rooms at the end of the hall along Michigan Avenue are close together so you could hear people going in and out of their doors at night. There were a lot of families at the hotel and it seemed every kid took advantage of the pool facilities. The hotel is 4 blocks away from the train station on Roosevelt which goes to Midway airport so that was a real convenience - the taxi costs $25.00, the train is $2.50 per person. The location is very convenient to walk and see sites, especially the Museums. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Sears tower (Willis tower) and about 30 minutes to Millennium Park. The restaurant in the hotel was an older restaurant and served typical comfort food; the breakfast was fantastic. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TXTerrytexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during an interview. Its opposite Grant Park and walking distance to the red and brown L trains. There is a nice fitness room and a pool, all working good. I found the beds very comfortable and I had an uninterrupted sleep. The room was a tad noisy but thats to be expected in Chicago when off any major street. The bathroom was clean, the doors and locks new. Best of all Drew and two others at the front desk (sorry dont remember names) were courteous and took care of every request I had. The internet was reasonably priced at $5 per day - cheaper than most other Chicago hotels. I would classify this as a smaller hotel with character - worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Underserved stars”
Reviews.Author: murgattore
Reviews.Content: To begin with the check in area is small and poorly located. It makes guests feel like they are petitioners at some obscure government office. Elevators are always at a premium and it would take you no less than 10 minutes to ascend or descend. What makes matters even worse was a pack of children and teenagers running going up and down on the elevators all the time. Fitness room and swimming pool hours are ridiculously inconvenient for guests. The room was small. The sheets looked shabby, one of the pillow cases was raggedy and the bathroom was not very clean (hairs in the sink and the bathtub). The maid did not restock supplies and the staff did not ask whether we like our stay. The restaurant attached to the hotel is pretty much unfriendly. The waitress was rude and retorted to every request with a smirk in her face, and the manager passed judgment on me for ordering a beer for lunch (a guy who looks like a 24-pack a night drinker). The fitness room is not bad but with the limited hours there's hardly a chance to use it. Ah... the charges to use PCs downstairs are highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this cozy, reasonable hotel in South Loop”
Reviews.Author: m3Chicago
Reviews.Content: Our short stay at the Essex Inn was nice. The best amenities were the large pool which is 3 to 8 ft deep, the fitness center and free shuttle to major attractions on Michigan Ave and Navy Pier. All of the staff people were friendly, including the maid and bellmen. The rooms are older but adequate and clean. Our bathroom took a bit getting used to because the sink basin was tiny and the tub was small. I was aware that some reviewers had complained about street noise and loud guests. Fortunately, we didn't notice anything out of the ordinary. For the basics, we got more than what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dub_Claire
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel with a good location facing Millenium Park and was a 20 minute brisk walk from the main shopping district. Staff were helpful & friendly but rooms were shabby and in bad need of a revamp. The bathroom could certainly be described as cosy and a tad old fashioned. Did not use the restaurant for any meals. For the price paid this hotel was adequate

Reviews.Title: “It won't exceed your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Elchie
Reviews.Content: The best 3 star hotels are the ones that make you feel like you're staying in a 4 star. Unfortunately, the Essex Inn does not do this. The lobby is dated and could seriously use new carpet. The rooms are small, but comfortable. Read a couple of reviews about the noise, and should have taken them more seriously. My room had a direct view of the El - I woke up still hearing trains in my head. The bed didn't help either - the pillows were like bricks. Also, be wary if you plan on doing any business during your stay. Booked for a leisure trip but ended up having to do some work - wireless on your own laptop is $6/day, but to use the computers in the business center it's $5 for 15 minutes! They also charge for printing. Bright spots: front desk staff was friendly and hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to Michigan Ave. a few times a day.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: missitty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first trip to Chicago. This hotel is in an awesome location. We stayed in a room that gave us an excellent view. Simply beautiful. Makes me want to go back. The service was excellent and the hotel is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away: BEDBUGS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bmathey69
Reviews.Content: My family & I spent 2 nights at this hotel. The location is great & the staff very helpful, but this is a very old hotel that's been refurbished very poorly & it shows if you know where to look (lots of mildew in the sink, around the tub, etc.) My wife and daugher shared one of the 2 double beds in our room and by the middle of the second day, we noticed that their arms and legs were covered in bedbug bites. I tore the bed apart & found several bedbugs between the mattress and boxspring. Don't stay here - spend a little more money & stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Heather0777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal! I was given this hotel through Priceline for around $65 a night and couldn't have asked for more! The hotel is right on Michigan Ave and 2 blocks from the Red Line. The rooms were very large for downtown Chicago and the staff was great. The rooms were clean and the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: lngoodson
Reviews.Content: If you get a room on a high enough floor, you can see from the museum campus to Navy Pier. It is a beauiful hotel with great rooms and an awesome staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: fisherdvm
Reviews.Content: What other reviewers said here are true. What is great? Price - wow, if you pick it as a 3 star with Priceline, and landed it.... It is a steal. I am not sure how much it would cost without a gamble. Location - 2 blocks from the entrance to the Red Line, 3 to 5 bucks a day with the CTA tourist card and you get unlimitted transfer, unlimitted rides, and able to go anywhere in the city for free. 2 minute walk from Yolk - a great breakfast place (just south on Michigan). 10 minute walk to the Field Museum, 12 minute to the Aquarium, and 15 minutes to the Planetarium. 5 minute ride on the Red line to Chinatown for all the dim-sum and noodles you want to eat. Free shuttle to the Museums and to the Hancock Observatory (and the Miracle Mile shopping district). Probably a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Millineum park, a great way to stroll along the lake shore. The hotel is about 5 minute walk from a CVS drug store and a 7-11. Facility: A huge lap pool with full time lifeguard under a greenhouse! Better come quick before they close it down. I don't know how they pay for the heating bill. Water is very warm (at least this week). I've never seen a lap pool in a hotel. The gym is large, with 3 treadmills, 3 elliptical, and a full complement of weight machines - impressive. No waiting for anything. REAL LIVE flowers - orchids and plants in the lobby. Rooms clean and nicely decorated with relatively new furnitures. Ironingboard, iron, hair dryer in the room. Coffee maker with convenient 1 cup dispensing and not having to rely on the maid to clean the pot with her toilet brush.... Just kidding. Nothing needs to be washed by the maid as the coffee tray and filter is disposable. Down side: A definite read if you are picky..... NOISY.... As opposed to the Hilton next door (an old and decrepit building) with tiny windows..... The Essex made a mistake with a full glass wall. Sure, it gives you plenty of natural light .... But ... It is not sound proof. And all the train and subways -- it sounds like you are sleeping in a train. One goes by almost every 5 minutes until midnight... Then it continues less frequently till the morning. Ambulance siren, etc. at least once in the night. The loop area is frequently by beggars. I saw more here than any other big cities on Michigan ave and the side streets. They are not too aggressive, but annoying. Most don't ask for a buck, just loose change. PARKING: cost $39 at the hotel. A lot just two block east on State St, and several on State are $8 for early birds, and $10 a day. Free parking is available near the Museums up till 11 AM, and on weekends. But check the "free parking" website for changes. There are many segment of street with free parking .... But why risk your life walking? Ten bucks two blocks away is not too much. If you are planning a trip with the kids - it is a perfect place to hit the museum, see the lake, and tour the Hancock observatory. I would buy the tourist CTA card (do not pay cash like we did - and wasted a huge amount of money). The regular CTA card cost $2.25 a trip, 25 cents a transfer (within 2 hours of the first trip) - so you can go to Chinatown for lunch and back for just $2.50). But a tourist CTA card let you go as many places and as many transfer as yo want for just $5 or less a day. I think there is a weekend fee also on the CTA, but you will have to read their website to learn more. Don't worry about taking public transportation from the Union Amtrak station to the hotel - as taxi cost only $7 for 2 people one way. Not worth the headache to use the bus and transfers. I would love to go back to this hotel again. But chances are, it will cost double what I paid this time. Bring ear plugs, and you will sleep like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, updated rooms, good price”
Reviews.Author: TrumanMeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a night in January. We came via the red line which is only a few blocks away and nice to be able to take public transportation to. We booked the King Suite, which meant we were on the top floor (15th). The room is not huge but we did not feel cramped either. The rooms have recently been remolded which is really nice. We had a fantastic view of Grant Park, museums and the lake. I would get this room again for the view! It doesn't happen much in Chicago that you get an unobstructed view and it was nice to have one. The bathrooms, as others have posted are tiny. It is an older hotel and you just work around it but yes, very, very small. The heat is controlled for the building so in the winter it is heat and you can't control it for your room, you can turn the fan on though and we found that this was enough to keep us plenty warm. The walls are not the thickest and we heard other guests getting off the elevator all night. All-in-all, a nicely appointed room with a few quirks, but we would stay here again for the view and location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for great location”
Reviews.Author: Beck73
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel near Millennium Park with fridges in the room for my son's baby food. Essex Inn fit the bill. Granted this was in the off-season which may explain the price. Room was small but adequate and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom again small but adequate. The indoor heated pool was perfect for splashing around with the baby. Lots of deck chairs available (better in summer of course) Gym was fairly spacious for a hotel and was empty both times we went (AM and PM). Best part was being able to walk to the park, Art Institute etc. Can't comment on the food as we got take out from nearby sandwich shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceedingly LOUD”
Reviews.Author: GJOHNS13
Reviews.Content: While the location was great that we could walk to most of the museums and to State Street stores, the el was so loud that it was almost impossible to sleep! They should issue earplugs with the room key. The beds were comfy but for short people like myself, I could have used a stepstool to get on it! Desk staff was not very helpful especially when asked about nearby restaurants or times of church services in the area. We found Yolks about 3 blocks S to be wonderful! Eleven on Wabash was also good. Parking was $39 per night. Cheaper private lots were available S on Mich and on Wabash. The pool supposedly was 80 degrees. It felt much cooler. The hotel bragged about how green it was but the coffee cups were styrofoam which is not recyclable. They said that they had ceramic mugs. Well, not in our room. Heat in the hotel was not adjustable in our room. Maids were very noisy in the hall at 9 am outside of our room. It cost almost $25 per hour to use their computer!! Outrageous!! Overall a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Midwest167
Reviews.Content: I got this room due to the proximity to downtown attractions. I was happy when we checked in to get 2 beds. Normally with priceline I am booked into a 1 queen bed. The rooms were clean but small. The furnishings are new and they have a flat panel screen tv with many channels which was nice. They are basically at the end of mag mile and I suspect if the weather were nicer it would be just fine but in the cold we had to deal with buses. They also have a shuttle which we used which is nice. Overall, my family enjoyed the pool and work out room. This is a nice feature especially downtown. Not many of the hotels have a pool. I am sure there are nicer hotels but when you have small children watching tv is just not enough. I enjoyed our stay here and would book again if I could get the $50 plus tax rate on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value, poor climate control.”
Reviews.Author: cch1
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Essex from Dec 11-13, 2009. Parking was $37/night, however, valet service was quick at retreiving the vehicle. Soldier Field and the Field Museum/Shedd Aquarium are within walking distance and the hotel is right on Michigan Ave. and the #3 bus route. The bathrooms are small and the sink may be the most tiny I've ever seen. They are literally about the diameter of a basketball. The beds were comfortable and the cable TV package includes numerous HBO options. The climate control is steam heat, which you cannot precisely control in the room. We had to have the window open in early December in Chicago to keep the temperatures reasonable or it would've been entirely too hot in the room. That was my main complaint. Staff were friendly and requests to bring extra coffee, etc. to the room were responded to quickly. We got this hotel on Priceline for $50/night plus tax and it was a good value. ...recommended stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, value, and service”
Reviews.Author: belasco99
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary after reading the reviews about small bathrooms, HVAC system, small bathrooms, decor, etc. But I'll tell you.. the service was more than courteous, the room was more than adequate and the decor great. All that for less than half the price of a room at the Hilton across the street. I'll come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected value and great room”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled720
Reviews.Content: This is actually a great little hotel. You can easilly take the blue line, then the red line get off on Harrison and walk two blocks to the Essex House on Michigan Avenue. It's at the end of the Magnificient Mile, across from Grant Park. The rooms are small, similar to a European hotel, but nicely furnished and updated. The carpeting looks dated - it's very clean, but everything else is new. There are LED reading lamps attached to the headboards and recylcle bins along with trash bins in the rooms (nice touch). Room darkening drapes, along with sheers and plenty of plugs everywhere. The beds are super comfy with lots of pillows. They have a spectacular pool area/ sundeck along with a nice fitness area with newer equitment. The bathroom is small, but updated and adequate with nice lighted mirrors. I enjoyed the fact the windows opened so I could listen to traffic and get some air. The staff was attentive and incredibly nice. The Savoy Restaurant was great for breakfast and so inexpensive. I wouldn't normally give this hotel such a high rating, but they were so attentive and I love their green factor and great beds - and the pool. It wasn't luxorious, it was just comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: lukefax
Reviews.Content: Very conveniet to downtow. The Hotel is quite, clean and confortable with a big lcd tv. The hotel park cost a little bit much that other solutions, but very convenient. For breakfast there is a Starbucks very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfactory stay--and for the price, outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: MsMaryMc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex for three nights while attending a conference at the Hilton Chicago. The Hilton couldn't be much closer--right across a small sidestreet . But while I would have paid $182 for a room at the Hilton, even at conference rates, I got my room at the Essex for $89 a night via Hotelicopter.com. I would have been satisfied with the Essex if I'd paid considerably more, but for that price, it was outstanding. The room was smallish but very comfortable. The hotel has clearly been remodeled in the past few years and, and while it was nowhere near as plush and ornate as the Hilton, it was perfectly pleasant and comfortable. The king-size bed was nice and firm with a cozy duvet. Everything was clean and in working order--the one problem (a light that burned out on the second day) was fixed promptly. The wireless Internet was fast and consistent (and while the price wasn't as high as what some business hotels charge, they never charged me for using it!) The staff was attentive, friendly and helpful. The location is great--right on Michigan Avenue, an easy walk to the Art Institute and a short cab ride to the Miracle Mile. As a single women I felt safe walking to and from dinner a few blocks away, even after dark If I had to name one complaint, it would be that you have limited control of the temperature in your room, and it was a little warmer than I would have preferred. But that may have had something to do with it being nearly 60 degrees in mid-November--the hotel may not be able to crank down the heat on a dime when the weather is that unseasonable. I would absolutely stay at the Essex Inn on another visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good thing it's right by Soldier Field...”
Reviews.Author: LovedLondon_0522
Reviews.Content: For a 3-star hotel, this place was about half a click up from a hostel. The decor was atrocious (70s, and not the good kind), the 'front desk' was this random desk hidden in the back of the 'lobby,' the rooms didn't have air conditioning (honestly? What hotel nowadays doesn't have A/C???) and we had to open the windows to get any air-flow, our room was cleaned the first day, etc. Oh, the other thing -- no 'Hi, welcome to the Essex Inn' type of guest book awaited us. No information about room service or eateries around the hotel... I mean, they didn't even have the hotel phone number on the fricking phone! We were going to a Bears game and you really can't get a better location to Soldier Field then the Essex, but that was all it had going for it. We went in November and the room was too warm for us to sleep well -- I cannot imagine what it would be like to stay in in the summer. Their little bar (The Savoy) was ok, food wasn't bad, but overall, this place was not worth the money. I don't expect to have marble and crystal everywhere I go with a 3-star hotel, but goodness, I DO expect A/C fercryingoutloud.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller3
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the Loop and within walking distance to many Chicago sights, including the Museums. Rooms had very large window, which made the room nice and bright. But don't bother going to the in-house restaurant. The service was terrible and so was the food. There are many other eating options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMedschool
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel during an annual science convention. It was a decent stay, there were some ups and downs. Service: First off the staff was very helpful and friendly, I never had a problem getting information, but they could use some training on the surrounding attractions. I asked one of the hotel workers at the front desk if there was someplace within walking distance to play pool. He sent us 3 blocks down to a crowded sports bar with one pool table.
