Rooms: I was pretty impressed with the room when I first walked in, very modern, had a decent size flat screen tv with tons of channels (Though you had to ask for a channel key down in the lobby) can't complain about the cleanliness of the room. My only gripe was that the bathrooms (at least in the double suite) were incredibly small. It was almost as if someone stuck one of the small ice buckets into the marble of the sink, it was almost too small to get your hands under the faucet. The shower and the toilet were extremely close together, I felt a little claustrophobic. Location: Awesome, close to the trains, nice view of the parks. Overall: Good stay, I wouldn't pay the high price ticket if I were staying for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location - tired decor”
Reviews.Author: portia79
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel my husband and I stayed in on our honeymoon (4 week road trip across America). The location of the Essex Inn was great and we were in walking distance of most of the tourist attractions and close enough to the L stations to get elsewhere. The staff at the Essex Inn were very helpful. My husband needed an Ethernet cable for his laptop and we got this from the front desk - no problem. They also allowed us to use the hotel phone to sort out a walking tour booking. They gave a good recommendation for breakfast - Yolk, about 5 minutes stroll away. The only problem with the hotel is that it is tired. It could do with a complete makeover, which would bring it more up to date and in keeping with the city.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in my whole life”
Reviews.Author: victorab
Reviews.Content: Great Location in Chicago. The most inefficient unfriendly service I have ever seen in my whole and intense travelling. Breakfast is charged and very bad quality. Reservation software is a chaos. One friend and me came here to run the marathon. He arrived first and arrived late. My friend warned reception of my late arrival and provided my name. When I arrived the even told me my friend hadnt checked in when it wasn`t true. They charged me 299 dollars for a room and even they make a msitake I was not reimbursed. Iasked for the manager 3 times in vain. A hotel to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: fizzengland
Reviews.Content: just returned from the essex inn, great stay, could not fault hotel in any way, we had a fab room near the top, corner room, so 2 sides of the room were completley glass from top to bottom!!!, overlooked the Sears tower and the L so could not have been more chicago than that!! good staff at check in, took a few mins, nice 3 star hotel, but the best thing is the position, right on Michigan avenue, free shuttle to all the sights, we did'nt use it though, as we got a conbined transport pass, the bus stops directley outside the hotel and the metro is only a few mins walk away, the hotel is exceptionly good value for money as you are right next door to the Hilton and other 4 and 5 star hotels charging 4 times as much, would recommend the essex and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for some awesome sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Jimimck
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as part of a Cosmos Bus Tour across the States. Its location was just perfect for us, as we hadn't been to Chicago before and it was right on the main strip to get to the best sightseeing spots. Plus it was walking distance from Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and Adler Planetarium. Just at the end of the block is a famous blues bar, Buddy Guys. If you ask at reception, they give you a voucher for half price entry to Buddy Guys. We also walked to the Sears (now Willis) Tower, and the bus goes very close by to get to the shopping district. The room was very nice and the staff were friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sheri2826
Reviews.Content: We were pleased. The location was great for walking to Grant Park, Millennium Park and museums. The shuttle service was a pleasant surprise and came in handy. Rooms were small, but comfy with better than average beds. The airy pool area (with a view of the lake) really came in handy for down time, games, reading and even swimming. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “have stayed here 3 times , wouldnt stay anywhere else when we come to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: catherineo62
Reviews.Content: this coming Nov will be our 4th time , we love this hotel, staff so friendly and helpful, we got free upgrade last year suite was gorgeous great view,, shuttle bus the best , drivers very helpful and friendly, restaurant staff same very condiderate to our Irish ways as 2 irish travellers to the essex,, the park grill down the road we ate there thanksgiving last year, it was beautiful,,, def would recomend this hotel. thank you essex inn,

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: laphelps
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 night stay at a PBS auction and paid $250+/night (with tickets to John Hancock observatory) and was really looking forward to our stay. 1. No heat - we are Floridians and it was warmer outside. The hotel is either on a/c or heat and you have no choice. Mid-September they were still on a/c. 2. Not one piece of paper of information in our room about the hotel, restaurants, room service, Chicago area, tv channels. Nothing. 3. Last morning maid knocked on room at 8:05am - ready to clean our room. I guess word got around about the tips I've been leaving .

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again - great location”
Reviews.Author: KittSt_Paul_MN
Reviews.Content: We had a great view of Grant Park. The weekend we were there, there was so much going on. A triathlon, festival....right across the street. Close to the museums, the lake....we were there to move a friend's son into college and the whole area made it a lot of fun. The staff was friendly and helpful too. We will definitely stay there on our next Chicago visit!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic two weeks”
Reviews.Author: ebonrub
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to win flights to Chicago with AA . Had to now find a hotel, Because I was travelling with my 17 yr old daughter I thought it would be good to have a pool. The pool area is good and my husband loved the gym.From start to finish we had an excellent stay I read in other reviews that staff were not very helpful I found every member of staff to be more than helpful. We ate in the restaurant and found something for everyone and the service was excellent. Our waitress even gave me boiling water for my tea. Americans only seem to use luke warm water maybe because they don't drink tea . Our room was pretty small I would have expected more hanging space. but we managed and it was clean . The other bonus was the launderette I got all my washing done for $5 before I left saved all that washing when I got home The hotel is away from Magnifecent mile but hotel offers a free shuttle service every hour. We never used this because we where there for two weeks thought it better to buy a bus pass that can also be used on the trains 7 days $23 3 days $14 great value as it cost $2.25 for each bus journey. Grant park and Millenium park just across the road. I found Chicago more expensive than other places in the USA so didn't do much shopping. We went for a lovely meal in Tavern on the Park total cost for 3 $160 Try Bennigans a few stops away from hotel get of the bus at Madison same meal for 3 plus dessert $90 Also we had a nice meal in Elephant and Castle on State St down towards the river We went to see the Jersey Boys (Frankie Valli and the four seasons life story) was very good Tommy Guns garage was a fun night out . It takes you back to the roaring twenties and includes 3 course meal $60 -$75 pp Wrigleyfield was a good night out we went to see Chicago Cubs.We also had a meal before the game prices are much better around there. The zoo at lincoln park is a great day out and unlike most things in Chicago it's free We booked a Chicago greeter she was great and gave us so much information and like the zoo this is free Navy Pier is a lovely day out especially if you have young children We had a buffet lunch in the signature room in the John Hancock building this is situated on the 96 floor from 11 to 2 midweek and only cost a few dollars more than going to the observatory tower The views are amazing The boat trip on the river are really good and give lots of information All in all an excellent holiday

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful Staff, Clean Hotel, Close to all the attractions.”
Reviews.Author: RUNNER70
Reviews.Content: We would stay at the Essex again. Great pool for the kids and wonderful workout area for active adults. April at the front desk was great. The garage staff was very courteous and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Millenium Park and Museum Campus-good value $”
Reviews.Author: 100DollarBill
Reviews.Content: This is one of the smaller hotels on south Michigan Ave. There are swankier hotels in the area. Renovated rooms (smallish) and furniture are top shelf (very good). Hotel itself is a little tired looking but clean. Great location on the south end of Grant Park. Our south facing room had a nice view of Lake Michigan and the museums. They have a large enclosed pool on the fourth floor deck. Would be great for anyone and especially for kids. An outdoor patio on the pool deck is directly above Michigan Ave. On a nice night you could bring a bottle of wine and enjoy the sounds of the city and park below. Outdoor seating on the street level bar and restaurant too. Be warned though this location is on the far south end of the park and if you were interested in "the magnificent mile" shopping on north Michigan Ave you would be a mile or two away. That said this is a nice, relatively quiet end of Grant Park and the Museums are short stroll away. This is a really good value relative to other hotels in the area. The Essex Inn neon sign is an icon on the Michigan Ave streetscape. I'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TraLonW
Reviews.Content: Good location on southern end of Magnificant Mile. Bus stop right outside of hotel. Rooms and corridors in particular are quite tired looking. Could do with redectoration in a more vibrant colour. Beds were comfortable but must be the smallest bathroom sink ever! Odd policy of charging a US$ 75.00 holding fee incase of any "damage". Unusual in having to pay for left luggage. Didn't eat in the hotel as the bar and restaurant both lacked atmosphere. Internet use is expensive but flight check in is free although when we were there the printer did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-range hotel charging big city prices”
Reviews.Author: Scissorman
Reviews.Content: Great location: the hotel is situated directly opposite the city's impressive Grant Park. Alternatively, head south on foot up Michigan Avenue for 30 minutes and you'll arrive at The Magnificent Mile. Our family room was clean and well-appointed although I was disappointed there was no en suite facility. Excellent, comfortable beds. The bar and restaurant lacked atmosphere and the breakfast service was disappointing (e.g one choice of cereal, strange under-cooked hash browns). I didn't have my laptop so had to pay $6 for just 15 minutes internet access on one of the computer work stations in reception - a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrific service”
Reviews.Author: yellowgeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night with 3 of our grandchildren. Our plans included the aquarium and this is a wonderful hotel for access to the Museum Campus and Grant Park. We took the South Shore train from Michigan City and it was an easy walk from the 11th St./Roosevelt Rd. stop. We arrived early and our room was ready so we got to drop our bags and begin our adventure. When we returned to the hotel, our boys (aged almost 3 to 11) enjoyed the swimming pool and the outdoor deck on the 4th floor. We were close to the bus stop and also the CTA so it was a breeze to get to Navy Pier, Sears (Willis) Tower, the restaurants we wanted to go to and also a short walk to Millenneum Park. We needed more towels for the 5 of us and within minutes of calling the front desk they were delivered. We had a room on the 14th floor with a view of the Museum Campus, Bears Stadium, and Lake Michigan. There was a mini fridge and a coffeemaker in the beautifully decorated room. The beds were super comfy. It was our 3rd time staying at this hotel and we would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is incredible, great location, too!”
Reviews.Author: happy4travel
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the staff at the Essex Inn. They consistently went above and beyond to be helpful and welcoming. The desk staff and bell captain were able to answer any question and give suggestions for all kinds of restaurants and activities. Our maid asked each day if there was anything else we needed for our room, did we need more coffee. Even the lifeguards at the pool made us feel welcomed. The hotel is located in an excellent location for all the Chicago highlights, but without all the commercial chain stores and restaurants as further north on Michigan Ave. Very easy access to the bus and subway. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The 4th floor rooftop pool and patio were an excellent place to view the 4th of July fireworks. Grant Park is a block away and the museums are within walking distance. Overall, the Essex Inn is a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Atrium pool, location and basic amenities were a real plus!”
Reviews.Author: rvtumbleweed
Reviews.Content: Two 10 yr. olds enjoyed the large pool in the atrium, and adults were able to bring favorite beverage in plastic glasses to tables surrounding pool. Location was central to most forms of transportation and attractions. Our 7th floor room was renovated and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: spin1sheffield
Reviews.Content: A very nice modern hotel with good size rooms which were very clean and comfortable. Facilities were very good, with an indoor pool. only there for two nightsbut wished it could have been more. The bar/ restaurant was very friendly, although the food wasn't anything special. Need to go further afield if you want a good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Did NOT honor confirmed reservation!!!”
Reviews.Author: duderest
Reviews.Content: Very POOR customer service!!!! Besides refusing to honor a confired, in writting, reservation front desk told my wife that a Walgreens drug store was just 3 blocks up Michigan Ave. It was 3/4 of a mile!! With 2 small children, it was a great hardship on our whole family. We woudn't stay there again, even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MagicMoments_16
Reviews.Content: The Essex is in a great location overlooking Grant Park and the Lake and within walking distance to Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum etc. Not far away either is city center, magnificent mile etc. Public transport options are quite close as well. The hotel itself is clean and tidy, albeit not overly attractive. The room was quite small overall however the fittings and furniture were new and quite nice. Hotel amenities weren't too bad with onsite pool and restaurant. Service from staff wasn't outstanding but they were polite and willing to help. Overall, good value hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: PompeyGav1
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Handy for all transport. Within walking distance of main locations. Overhead trains on the loop can be a bit noisy at night. Small point: Do they need to charge $1-50 to mind your bags for a few hours after check-out, whiler you kill time, before going to the airport !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: emboy
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed at the Essex Inn last summer. Overall, it was a very nice hotel. The location on Michigan Avenue was great. Right across from Grant Park, and in walking distance from The Field Museum, the Shedd Aquarium, and other museums. The hotel has a shuttle that took us to Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile. The employees there are generally friendly, and were very helpful in suggesting family-friendly restaurants, all which were in walking distance. We stayed in a room that had a queen bed in one room, and then 2 double beds in another room. The room was very cramped for 6 people, but we managed. Each part of the room had a big tv, but the only kids channel we could find was Disney. The bathroom was extremely small, and was very cramped. The shower was nice though. The biggest complaint I have about the room is the air-conditioning. It was extremely hard to control the air-conditioning, and it got many of us sick. The pool was good sized, and nice. However, the water was FREEZING, and it made swimming much less enjoyable. The sauna was nice though. We would spend a little bit of time in the freezing pool, and then would go heat up, and repeat the process. I really wish the pool had been warmer, but after you got used to the water, it was fun. Overall, you get a good deal. The price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: p321rich
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in August and the hotel was very nice, it was in a great location near public transportation which we used every day also the pool was very nice, I thought the hotel restaurant was a little over priced and it would have been nice if they had complementary coffee and donuts in the lobby for hotel guests, but over all we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location , 5 star rooms and excellent internet connection”
Reviews.Author: mehilba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on Michigan Ave. which is the main walking street in Chicago , very close walking distance to the Magnificent Mile . Walking distance from Union station and subway stations to Midawy Airport. Overall my stay was perfect. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wow in the city”
Reviews.Author: RIEL01
Reviews.Content: Essex Inn is a great hotel for a good price. We were in Chicagi mid summer and the temperature was very good. But we were also glad the hotel had a pool (which had flags from all over the world above it!). And to get to Lake Michigan, you only had to cross the park. In this park is also the Buckingham Fountain from the tune of Married with Children. The people at the hotel are helpful and very nice. The Essex Inn is close to a stop of the hop-on-hop-off bus. The subway is a few minutes walk. It's not IN the city centre, but you got the city feeling when you step outside.

Reviews.Title: “great time in chicago”
Reviews.Author: windrift
Reviews.Content: my 9 yr old son and I went to chicago for a fun weekend, one must to my son was a pool, I wanted to be downtown near the sights. We found the pool to be very clean and the temperature good, the room was clean and comfortable, the staff very friendly and helpful to both my son and myself, directing us to good food and fun sights, my son said that he wants to come to Chicago often and he feels the only place to stay is at the essex inn. I feel for the price there is not a better choice of lodging in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst!”
Reviews.Author: poettraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've stayed in in a long time. It's not because of the rooms necessarily, but the service. None of the hotel staff has any idea what customer service means. It's like they are instructed to say no to every customer problem or request. Also, the rooms were not very clean. In my room, for example, they didn't change the shampoo and conditioner after the last person left. I know because it was only 1/4 full. I will never stay here again. I advise you not to either.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Management! Will Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: hamclann4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex Inn Feb 8th and 9th for a Cheer Competition at McCormick Center. We booked through Expedia. After a long afternoon with thirty 10 and 11 year olds we were looking forward to a swim. They girls were so excited to go to the pool only to find out that the pool was inoperable. The temperature of the pool was 57 degrees. You could barely stick your foot in let alone swim and there is no hot tub! The girls were so disappointed. We called the front desk when we got back to our room to complain. At no point did they inform us that there were issues with the pool. We called 3 days prior to check in - no mention of a broken pool. No mention of a broken pool at check in. Management informed us that there was a sign posted at the front desk but at no time could we locate that "so called" note. Managment refused to offer any compensation for their issue!! Continued to say there was nothing they could do. I advised managment there was plenty they could offer......reduction in rate, another night stay another time, discounted parking (which we paid $37). Once again......he stated there was nothing they could do. I got the name of another manager thinking maybe if we called and talked to someone higher up after we returned that SOMEONE would do something. Called first thing Monday morning talked to the superior, Erik, same statement....there is nothing they can do. Continuing complaint he said he would look into it and call back. No return call yet. Tried to call him on Tuesday - he was out of the office for the day. Tried Weds. left a message. It is now Friday and still no return call! BEWARE of the ESSEX INN! They do not take responsibility or offer compensation in any way when the issues are their fault. VERY POOR MANAGEMENt! WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Management NOT flexible”
Reviews.Author: JDComputer
Reviews.Content: 2 PROBLEMS 1) One of our party got sick and we wanted to delay our trip another week or two (we had made reservations 2 weeks in advance). Hotels.com would not let us change. I called the Essex and they would not change. 2) When we got to the Essex, they gave us a one bed room. Our receipt from Hotels.com says "2 Adults, 2 Children Standard Room/2 double". The staff and management would not find a double room for us, did not apologize, did not offer money back and put the entire blame on Hotels.com. Hotel was nice, but we were NOT happy that the 4 of us had to stay in a 1 bed room.

Reviews.Title: “essex inn is great”
Reviews.Author: ripken69
Reviews.Content: We when in oct for the Bears game the package is a most. We had geat seats. It wasn't to far of a walk we had great weather.The rooms were nice. We got a suit with a view of the park very nice.We didn't swim in the pool but it was nice size. The front desk was very helpful when we had question about the area. I would stay here anytime and I plan to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Essex”
Reviews.Author: Nedlands
Reviews.Content: The Essex Inn provided very pleasant accomodation in a good location. We were there at Christmas time and the foyer was very inviting with a most pleasing cinnamon and cloves potpouri in the air. The rooms were very clean with lovely fresh white bed linen and towels. Fridge and coffee maker were available which was good. The bathroom was very clean with neutral tones and a good shower head. Pictures posted on the internet were exact, no hidden nasties. Our initial room was located near the lift which was not ideal but management were more than happy to move us. A little train noise at night from the EL may irritate the traveller who requires complete quiet for sleeping. Pool and gym facilities good and well maintained. All staff very happy to oblige Good bus service down to Magnificent Mile,close to many wonderful galleries and concert venues, Grant Park ,Millenium Park and lots more. Wouldn,t hesitate to stay again. Only negative was the rather slow lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Conferences @ HIlton”
Reviews.Author: NBandaru
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Hilton literally 500 ft away and couldn't be happier to pay a lot less with decent room and service. I'd definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Auntie033
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over Thanksgiving 2008 for 5 nights. Due to a lack of [or incorrect] communication between themselves and the online booking site, the triple room that we booked had only 2 beds [I had specifically asked for 3 and even paid extra to 'upgrade' from twin to triple] so we paid [again!] to upgrate to one of their junior suites. I was going to pay for the wireless internet, but this came free with this room - and the service/connection was excellent. The rooms were lovely, nice views [although disappointingly in our room, to the side of the hotel and not the front] Very clean, although the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel!!!!! I was on the pull out couch and all that was supplied as bedding here was one thin nylon blanket - it was sufficient and I guess they would have given me more if I had asked. Reception was very helpful in recommendations on things to do and also recommended a restaurant to us one night in Chinatown which turned out to be really nice. We ate breakfast in their little diner every morning of our stay. The food was lovely and the menu quite extensive and reasonable. We met about 4/5 of the diner staff. 3 of them were lovely and chatty and the other 2 were really grumpy!! The location is fine, in terms of its proximity to the city centre - the views of the lake and park make up for the fact that were were not bang in the middle of the city. It's very handy for the aquarium, the park and the lakeshore. Also number 6 bus stop on the Tour Bus route is right outside the door. The only negative thing I would say is there are a lot of people hanging around the area that will come up to you looking for money, so as long as you don't loiter around the front of the hotel you will be fine!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl2626
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a package deal. The location was good, but the customer service was horrible. On 11/21/08, our first night there, the people in the room next to us were extremely loud. It was about 11:30 p.m., and I figured it would settle down eventually. It soon turned into a party, with lots of people yelling, swearing (lots of the F word), and being really loud. I called the Front Desk to ask if someone could ask them to please quiet down. When I explained the situation, the employee said to me, "Well, it IS a Friday night" and promptly hung up. I was outraged. Don't all guests have the right to a peaceful night's sleep? Can I act obnoxious and loud if I want to, and if people complain, just say, "Well, it IS the weekend?" Ugh. The room next to us continued to get louder and louder (which I didn't think was possible) so I called again, preparing for the same response. Another person answered, and said he'd send someone up. About 30 minutes later, they did quiet down. I just felt that the situation should have been handled differently. Good luck if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “very clean, nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: xboxmarkster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex Inn for 1 night on November 9th 2008 after leaving my previous Chicago hotel which had became fully booked (which is in another review on here) overnight before I had to go back to the airport for my flight home. I found the Essex Inn to have very friendly staff,The hotel itself wasnt much to look at from the outside but inside it was very clean with lots of facilities,Gym,Pool,vending machines,Wireless internet throughout and a business center. My room was 1216 on the 12th floor and it was very clean,Very spacious and had a huge floor to ceiling window which looked out across Grant/Milenium Park over Lake Michigan which was incredible. I had a huge flat screen tv with too many cable tv channels to count which was great and a bed that could probably have fit 4,as well as a large bathroom with the bath/shower combination,nice handbasin area and all of the usual hotel amenties hairdryer,iron,shampoo,conditioner,tea/coffee facilities etc. The only thing i would say about this hotel is that for a solo traveller like myself its quite a isolated area for the hotel as its not near the main attractions and at night it can become quite a shady area as its near the empty park and the elevated railroad passings which tends to host a lot of shady looking people,lots of homeless waiting around the corners to ask you for money and a few hustlers. Now by no means dont let that put you off of going there as the most of them are harmless and will ignore you if you leave them alone but for maybe a solo female(s) or younger guests it may be something that would make you feel uncomfortable but the solution to this would be if you are going from uptown to the hotel in the evenings maybe to take a cab or stay on Michigan avenue to the south end of it where its more populated before you turn into the hotel rather than taking the backstreets near the railroad. Overall I would recommend this hotel and stay there again as it was a very good hotel with value for money and everything that i could of asked for.I would recommend it to everyone but with the added fact that solo travellers like myself especially for young solo female travellers to plan how you will get to and from the hotel before you actually go out to avoid any unwanted encounters.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: vegasbud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex for 4 nights starting on the 01 Nov, I thought it great value for money. The rooms were very clean and promptly cleaned each day, the decour was modern and bright. The bathroom was on the small side but more than adequate, I appreciate that for all you Americans reading this that you have large bathrooms, coming from England we have very small bathrooms so we tend not to think about these things !!!!! The location was good with shops and restaurants in the near vicinity, Millers Pub ( on wabash street near Macy's ) was an absolute must, just go you won't be disapointed, the ribs were great and the hellavaburger ( 10oz ) was one of the best i have ever had and all reasonably priced. Beer was $4 whereas Kitty O Sheas was around $9 On a food note, don't eat at Kitty O Sheas (situated in the Hilton ) next door to the Essex, the food was very poor and overpriced. Chicago is a wonderful city and great to look around, we felt very safe even late at night. We found everybody to be polite and very friendly, forget New York, go to chicago !! Lastly i have to mention the food tour offered by food planet ( i think ) it was supherb and took us to areas we would never have gone to, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Michigan Ave hotel”
Reviews.Author: canuck_02
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference @ the Hilton, and chose to stay at the Essex next door. The rooms were 1/2 the price of the Hilton, and we only had to step out the door, and cross the road to go into the convention. The rooms were very nice, clean and stylish. The bedding was soft, and each bed had individual reading lights. I'm a reader, and my roommate liked to go to bed early, so this was perfect. The pool area was nice, but the room and water were a little too cool for my taste. The workout room was very large with nice equipment. The staff were all friendly and accomodating. They certainly set the tone for a nice stay. Make sure you try the nachos in the bar!! They were recommended by Irene, and were a surprising treat! The chocolate fudge cake also did not disappoint. Al in all, I was very pleased and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: travelinbuisnessman
Reviews.Content: I wasn't overly impressed. The room wasn't the greatest in size and the view wasn't what I would have expected to pay for. The staff wasn't overly friendly either. I got a good nights sleep, and that may be all that matters. I would go back if the price was right, but won't be seeking it out.

Reviews.Title: “If you get it cheap its a nice bit of luxury.”
Reviews.Author: mcbrumcarr
Reviews.Content: stayed a few nights at this hotel over the period of a week. Very nice rooms bathrooms felt luxurious and rooms were very clean, beds were very comfortable. gym and pool on site was sufficiently equipped for a gentle workout. lobby area a little bit outdated. Valet parking was reasonable for a centre of town location in comparison to other areas of town. Overall very nice hotel and worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: JKNJ01
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Chicago and stayed in this terrible hotel. When I received the booking and looked at the price, I thought that it would be a good hotel. On the contrary, this is one of the worst hotel I have ever stayed with. The bathroom is so small, that you can barely fit in it. I am a small size person and even I had trouble using bathroom, so I can imagine what will happen to the big people. There is no heat or airconditioning in the hotel. They just want to make you fool by turning on fans which blow the outside air. It was quite chilly (upper 40s) and room was freezing. When I called front desk, they said that heating is not ON yet and they can send me blankets, if I want. Obviously the issue was for the time when one is not in the bed. Next morning room cleaning service showed up at 8:30 in the morning. Never happened in any of the other places I have stayed in. Rooms are too noisy and you can hear the voice of television from adjacent room. Please do not waste your money on this creepy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: Teucer2000
Reviews.Content: Large room with very comfortable beds and good quality linen. We found staff very friendly. Food portions in linked 'cafe' were huge and freshly cooked. Great location for the waterside marinas and centre of town. Luggage could be left after check out in locked room for only 50c per item which was helpful. Lovely pool too. Chicago was great...we were passing through to catch the Amtrak to San Francisco...wish we had longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: shiner139
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had a good location opposite Grant Park and 10 mins walk to Millenium Park and the Magnificent Mile (Shopping Area), apart from that we thought the Hotel Staff could have been a bit more Helpful, and the Hotel Barman was a bit too interested in the Sport on TV than serving Customers, however the Room was Clean and Towels Changed Daily.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicoHernadez
Reviews.Content: Essex Inn is a great hotel with a decent room and nice family pool. It is right in front of grant park and downtown chicago (most of the sights are here) is about a one to two mile walk away. it is close to the magnificent mile, john hancock, navy pier and all the sights in this area. there is also a metro nearby for any ou of town trips you may want to make. the hotel is pretty good with a computerised but limited concierge and free internet in the business room only. (through an ethernet cable). the pool area was used alot by families. I would probably stay on the other end on michigan avenue next time but in general the hotel is pretty good and is good location wise, if you are prepared to walk a few miles in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mebohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in August. This is a really nice hotel in a great location. Across the street from Grant Park, next door to the Hilton (which charges twice as much). The room was nice, good size, modern, clean, nice furniture. Attractive lobby. Wi fi in your room for $5.95 a day. Right on the bus line. I would highly recommend this hotel as a reasonably priced hotel option in Chicago. My daughter now lives in Chicago (in a small apartment) and I plan to stay here whenever I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, its a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Claire_MK
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Essex inn was a fantastic hotel to stay in. We had a recently re-decorated room on the surrealist floor 6th. We both could not fault any part of the hotel, from the reservation staff to the waiter we had in the hotel restaurant. The staff made us feel welcome and helped us find our way around Chicago. Thanks must go to Chris on the Front desk who was very helpfull. I will definatley be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal at the Essex”
Reviews.Author: suechucky
Reviews.Content: We did a Chicago Bears Football/hotel package. Preseason game tickets, one night's staty at the hotel and hotel parking were included. This was really a great deal! The room was very clean, nicely updated, but it was very small. The bathroom in particular was teeny tiny. However, if like us, you just planned to sleep in the room, it was perfect for the price we paid for the package. We stayed Aug 21-22 and we didn't see any union picketers. We were able to walk to Soldier Field to the game using the path. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant because we were short on time. The food was delicious. The surroundings were kind of dumpy and out dated. For breakfast we walked a few blocks down Michigan Avenue to Yolk and we had a fantastic breakfast. Yolk is a new trendy restaurant that had great food!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaDawn75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex Inn in Chicago for a baseball series at U.S. Cellular Field. I loved everything about this hotel. We arrived later that evening and check in was smooth. The hotel was recently renovated and our floor was decorated in a contemporary art design. The bed was very comfortable and the down comforter was an added bonus. We had a flat screen TV in the bedroom and the sitting room, which was also nice. The refrigerator was large and we had no problems with it. The pool area was nice and there is an outside deck that is decorated beautifully with live plants and gives an awesome view of Chicago. Grant Park is right across the street and makes for a nice view. We were within 2 blocks of an El connection and within a few blocks of a free trolley stop. My only problem with the Essex Inn was how small the bathroom was. It was tiny and left little room to move in, but it was nice and decorated elegantly. The shower is very loud and the tub drained slowly, but we had no problems with it. We had a really good experience and if I ever return to Chicago, I will definately stay at the Essex Inn. It gives a great room for a great value (especially in Chicago).

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: luciemaurice
Reviews.Content: I booked a package room+sears tower tickets+1parking night. The room was nice, very clean and great view on the lake. However, we had several problems during our stay. First of all, the airline lost our luggage. Eventhough I left a note at the front desk, when they came to the hotel to delivery, the person at the front desk told them that we had checked out. So the luggage was sent back to the airport. We had to check out (for real) the next day, but the luggage shown up at 6pm. Hence, we have lost one entire day of our trip (we were supposed to drive out of the city this day) and we had to get upset to get the extra parking fee waived. Because we had limited clothing, we gave couples of items to the laundry service. I had to go downstairs twice to get my laundry. Each time they told me "it's coming in 5min, I will drop it to your room". Tired of waiting, we went out. No laundry we we get back from diner. I went to the front desk the next morning, they delivery our laundry to another room!!! I must tell that everytime I talked to somebody, I mentionned our room number... Other than that, the bellmen were very helpful and gave us plenty of tips on the city. Also, the hotel has a complimetary shuttle that runs on Michigan avenue. It is very convenient as the hotel is located south of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room! Great Price! Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: zphidiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The room was very clean. The only issue I had was that the maid service starts knocking on doors at about 8AM!! She was my wake-up call, like clock work. So if you planned on sleeping in, make sure you have your do not disturb plackard on the door. I read one review about the sink being small. It was but seriously... how big of a sink do you REALLY need? You aren't bathing in it. It serves its purpose. Should not be a sticking point. The bed was confortable and the comforter was fluffy, and the new flat screen tv was an awesome touch. The elevator was a bit on the slow side, so during the height of the morning rush you may want to keep that in mind. The location was nice. you aren't very far from museums, and attractions. It was a $5-6 cab ride from the hotel to the Sheraton near the river if you need a reference. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: lcoles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex Inn on 20th July for two nights having just arrived from the UK. The hotel is on Michigan Avenue on the opposite corner to the Hilton. Hotel pool was nice but extremely cold. We didn't eat in the hotel but had breakfast at Yolk ... a great place for breakfast and highly recommend it. Hackney's is a restaurant a couple of blocks away and was excellent american/mexican food...family friendly. The hotel has a courtesy bus which will run you down town to the shopping district. You wait for it in the lobby. We were first there waiting with some friends and gradually the lobby filled up. Some people, unbeknown to us, had gone outside the hotel so when the bus arrived... they all filled it up with no space left for others who had waited for about 45 mins! Hotel should be clearer about where the bus picks up from and what the queuing set up is or first come first served basis. We had prepaid for this hotel through Trailfinders in the UK but they still put a $75 7-day hold on our credit card which is now on it's 8th day and it is still on there. Had to email them to remove it. Be sure when you check out of American hotels that you get a hard copy of your bill. Three times now on this trip across America, hotels have overcharged our card and I have had to chase them to re-credit our card. One of the hotels was the Hilton! We walked from the Essex to downtown Chicago having missed the bus and actually it was a delight with beautiful architecture, parks... etc., Millenium Park is great and has a water fountain where the kids can put on their swimming gear and run about in the water jets which come out of animated towers. American Girl Store is a must for any young girl and Hersheys Chocolate was good too.

Reviews.Title: “The Lobby Bar is just like Cheers....Everyone knows your name!”
Reviews.Author: chirocristy
Reviews.Content: First things first....Say hi to Ilene at the bar in the lobby! She will remember your name for years to come. I swear, this is the friendliest place I've ever been to. Lots of repeat guests. That's a good sign, right? My husband and I stayed there in March over St. Patrick's Day. I was there for bussiness and my hubby tagged along. The hotel was decent. We stayed in one of the older rooms but they were in the middle of remodeling and were told that the newer rooms were fantastic. Regardless, the rooms were clean and the beds comfy. The location of the hotel wasn't bad either. We walked everywhere, but we're pretty active and like the walk. When the weather got bad (snow!!!), we took a cab. Make sure to take one night to eat at Geja's, a fondue restaurant. It was a great experience! Later on head over to Kingston Mines. Best blues bar ever! The performers were top notch. We truly had a great first visit to Chicago. Hopefully the first of many.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mulhoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation of Trailfinders. They were right - good value, staff helpful and free shuttles downtown and to museums. Very convenient for Grant Park. Easy to get shuttles to/from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BigHScotland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay. We were here for 4 nights (8th - 12th) and the hotel is in a great location for exploring Chicago. We walked to the museums and Navy Pier. Grant Park was wonderful. The hotel staff were really friendly from the housekeeping staff, the front desk staff and the bellhops - particularly helpful. The view from the pool area across Grant Park to Lake Michigan were fabulous. The rooms were clean, comfortable and serviced every day. The Savoy Grill attached to the hotel was good for breakfast and the bar staff really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel top class”
Reviews.Author: shamtipp
Reviews.Content: having just stayed here it is an excellent hotel for chicago offers shuttle bus to all places on the navy pier and michigan avenue only thing bus starts at 10 am and finishes at 6 pm also you can get the free schuttle from may to sep just near hotel hotel itself very clean with rooms completed each day room size good hotel staff very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: happycheese1
Reviews.Content: This was my first hotel out of six I stayed in during my US holiday tour. I read some of the reviews on this site before I left and was not looking forward to the stay. I stayed in the hotel for two nights. My room was on the 12th floor, overlooking the light terracotta painted building to the left of the hotel (when you are looking at the hotel head on). I loved the flat panel TV and the beds were nice and comfortable without being too firm. The bathroom was of a good size with plenty of room to put your toiletries and to dry yourself in. Plus there was the sink vanity unit outside the bathroom, so one can use the shower whilst the other dries their hair etc. The only downer was the outdated decor in the lobby area. I think getting rid of the mid 1980s carpet and the leather and chrome furniture is a must. From seeing the older photos, I can see the rooms have been refurbished and chances are the lobby will be done at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovation when I was there”
Reviews.Author: rinaceros
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel to stay at if you're working on a budget but want to avoid any of the Comfort Inn et. al. chains. When we stayed there in Mar. 08, the foyer reception area was undergoing renovations. It's quite small hotel (if I remember correctly, there were 12 floors or so). The rooms are much more updated and cozy than the hallways (which are decorated in a dated art deco'ish style) would indicate. The front desk and parking service was slightly incompetent. Upon arriving, the receptionist ask if we wanted two beds or one. When I said, "two beds," she then replied, "Oh sorry, we don't have any rooms with two beds." Then there were a couple of incidents with a parking attendant (who was still being trained I think) who had misplaced our parking stub, and neglected to record which parking space/building our car was in, so that his associate had to comb through both to find it. Other than those unpleasantries, however, I would still by large recommend it to young travellers, looking for a convenient location (great if you didn't bring a car).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: michiganstategogreen
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a Saturday night stay in Chicago, and was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to our room. We were on the ninth floor, and the room was very recently renovated. Nice comfortable bed, large 32" flat panel TV, and granite and tile in the bathroom. I was able to get a very good rate for this room, and this location is convenient to Grant Park, the museums, aquarium, etc. and is only a 15 minute walk from the much more expensive Magnificent Mile area. The only cons on the place were that the elevators were a little slow in coming once you hit the button, and the sink in the bathroom was very small. Parking - I didn't park at the garage behind the hotel, but there are multiple surface lots within a block of the hotel. You can also park on the street if you can find a spot, metered parking until 9 PM on Saturdays, then FREE all day Sunday! Bottom line, if you are looking for a comfortable hotel at a very reasonable price, this hotel fits the bill. I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastPuddleduck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite. Lovely room with a spectacular view! The corner living room was comfortable and again, that fab view! Tinsy, tiny bathroom, but it functioned well. The downside? Foam rubber pillows. We asked about down pillows and were told by the bellboy that he would check, but he didn't check. We also asked for a wake-up call on our last morning for 4:20 a.m. to catch an early morning plane. Fortunately I had set the alarm because the wake-up call never happened.

Reviews.Title: “I'd look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CaFSM
Reviews.Content: Although it was not imposed, the $50 fee to leave early is ridiculous. My plane arrived late and it was only when I arrived at 11pm that they disclosed this. My rate was going to nearly triple (which i did know in advance). It seems like they cater to tour groups. Noise from the hallway was disturbing, and housekeeping knocked at 8:20am. The location is near the Loop but south of most of the city's offerings. Not fatal, but not ideal. There isn't much in the way of restaurants, etc. nearby, though there are some attractions. There is a fee for wireless ($6 or 7). The sink was miniscule -- too small to refill a water bottle. Water pressure was weak. The tub was chipped and had a smudge -- not sure what caused that. The shuttle only runs 1/hour. I fared better at the Hampton Inn -- paid a bit more, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Essex Inn!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyGroup1
Reviews.Content: Our youth group (from Kentucky) drives to Chicago every year work at an area shelter. We look forward to staying at the Essex. It is a little expensive. The weekends are quite a bit extra and since the kids have to raise money for the trip and can't afford the weekend rate, we leave on Friday. We have been staying there for several years. The kids love the pool and the lifeguard is a plus. The rooms are small, but are very clean. The staff has been nothing but GREAT to our group. That's not always easy when there are several kids involved. We had one gentleman go out of his way to help one of our youth. Our group won't forget that. It makes you appreciate the staff so much. I would recommend the Essex to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled!”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned_Traveler123
Reviews.Content: The price of $69 seemed like a steal until wrong charges showed up on charge card after check-out. Front office manager did not return multiple messages and general manager always "unavailable." Room was strictly Motel 6 and not what I was promised, despite 2 calls directly to front desk before check-in. Staff talked down to us and treated us like we couldn't even read (we have PhDs). Frankly, I am surprised they are still in business with such classic intimidation and bait and switch tactics. Not worth the risk with other quality lodging in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Ice Box”
Reviews.Author: timmid
Reviews.Content: We (my family of 4 and three grandparents) booked three rooms at the Essex based on a Sun Times article about places to go with kids. We arrived early, so the front desk said they would block off an adjoining suite for us. We returned later only to learn that there were not any adjoining suites available, so clearly they had given the suite to someone else (though they didn't admit this, and went through many failed excuses as to why there were not any adjoining suites available). We were stuck with a corner suite that wasn't really a suite, because the room we wanted to use for gathering had another full bed; there wasn't a couch or table. The weather was sub-zero, and one room in the suite was unusable because of the cold. Luckily we had the three beds, as there was plenty of bedding to block out the cold draft that was pouring into the other room in the suite. We ran into a couple who stayed in our suite the prior night, and they said they were given a new room after a bottle of water left near the window froze. The pool area we hoped to enjoy with the kids was too cold (not the water, but the room itself). In the morning, there wasn't any hot water. When I left, we complained, and without any apologies or much of an acknowledgment, were given a $40.00 discount, which was hardly adequate, as we had to move my grandparents and kids around to avoid the ice box room. Now I understand that old hotels can have problems in severe whether, but the lack or concern from management is why I will not be returning. I should note that we enjoyed all of the staff at the Essex other than the two managers, the one who lied about giving our adjoining suite away and the one that gave us the $40.00 discount on our 229$ suite. It is amazing that such upbeat friendly staff (the bell hop/concierge, cleaning staff, other desk workers) could work for managers with such poor customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jaimed13
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed about this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here on December 29th, 2007 and it was discusting. The rooms were not as clean as what we would have liked. We were not told about any of the amenities. The desk clerks were very unhelpful and rude. The sounds from out side were like we were sleeping right on the street. I stress not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “"Atrocious"”
Reviews.Author: honestrn
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure who's writing the previous reviews, but even if youâ€™ve just experienced motels, I am sure you would find this "inn" horrible. Location I guess is everything and it the only thing going for this hotel. I paid an outrageous amount for what appears to be an old half-way hotel with a new coat of paint. The picture of the pool that is shown on the website must have been taken when they first open (in 1800's). My shower provided warmer water that the pool. The rooms were small and filthy. The carpet had so many stains it was had to differentiate what was carpet and which were stains. This hotel sinks!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: fallon1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at Chicago's Essex Inn Hotel, was a bit wary having read some reviews but I'm not sure who submitted these as I couldn't fault the hotel for anything. Rooms were exactly as described and as shown on their website. Beds were clean and extremely comfortable. Would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a value for money hotel that really fits the bill. Hotel restaurant was good value and good food. Rooms cleaned to a high standard each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingwrinkly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location ,right on Grant Park. The reception/foyer area is small but tidy. The staff helpful enough. The room was small but clean, in fact the designer of the room is to congratulated. How he got a shower with bath, toilet and sink in such a small are is amazing!!!!! The hotel does however need a complete refurb as it is very tired BUT it would not be as well priced then. The bar has a good atmosphere and the restaurant is OK but there are better and cheaper within a 20 minute walk. The waiting staff in the evening were fine but I think they scoured Chicago to find the Rudest, Most Miserable, Most unhelpful people in the city to set you up fo the day on the morning shift. Overall it is good value but if the hotel itself is important to you look elsewher. If you fly out of terminal 5 at O'Hare airport you need to be aware that there is NO food available once you have gone through security.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation problem”
Reviews.Author: ShellPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on July 7. When we arrived at 4:00 on November 6 we were told that the room wasn't ready. We returned an hour later and were told that there were no more non-smoking rooms available. I had to get nasty and insist on a room before they "found" one. Instead of the 2 double beds I had reserved we had a king and a pull-out couch--not what I had reserved! There was no information in the room about the restaurant, pool hours, area attractions, etc. On the positive side, we enjoyed the restaurant. The food was good and very reasonably priced. Good service, too. Nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bev26
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but an excellent base from which to do all the sights and shopping! Hotel provides free shuttle to main shopping areas and some of the sights. Stayed for 3 nights with a standard room for 4 people, 2 double beds, only good if you are small people which did us just fine. overall great hotel for a few nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dickepa
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a play and shopping. The Essex was clean and comfortable. They have a shuttle that ran on the hour to take you to the Magnificent Mile (it only holds 14 people, so make sure you are there a little ahead of it's departure time to make sure you get a seat). It is an easy walk (about 1 mile) to the theater district. Front desk staff was courteous and helpful. We booked a "shopping package" with the hotel that included all taxes AND valet parking - great deal. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but gettin' old!”
Reviews.Author: meagle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the begining of Nov for a long weekend. Lobby Ok but not a great design as check-in desk in 'back' corridor, thus 3 people created a big queue! Staff were friendly and helpful though. We had been upgraded to a king suite so room spacious with a good view of the park. The decor and the fixtures are all way past their best (was brown ever at its best?). Couple of bulbs were out in the lamps, one of the TV remotes was cracked and broken and the microwave in the kitchen area seemed to be an early 80's model. Also this room had the worlds smallest bathroom (see pictures) with hardly enough room to turn around in! Just thought the whole room looked and felt a bit shabby. Location was pretty good with a 10 min walk to shops etc and apparently has free shuttle bus downtown which we didn't use. We did use the free internet, always useful. Overall, think I would have been more annoyed if I had paid full fare for the suite, instead of just a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Favre440
Reviews.Content: Parking was expensive ($28/day). The lobby area appeared to be somewhat dated, but nevertheless it was clean. The room was clean, new bedding, nice towels. The breakfast in the Savoy Bar & Grill was around $10, but it was plenty of food. The pool area is huge, plus a staffed lifeguard. I've seen other reviews that it's not in a prime downtown location..People, it's still downtown, and a few blocks away..Walk it! A good way of soaking up the Chicago experience is by walking it! The Valets were very welcoming & hilarious. One of the men remembered me from last year, when they had to retrieve my coat from my parked car..(and a year later, he was still giving me grief about it, in a joking way).....Unbelievable that he remembered me from almost a year ago. I'd be willing to stay here again. Sure, it's not in the prime area, but it's clean, adequate & staffed well.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed for a one night stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: ScndTmeMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chicago Essex Inn on November 13 (one night only). I was panicking 'cause we only needed one night and couldn't find ANYTHING a couple of days prior to our trip. I found a room available through GTAhotels.com and fearing the worst but hoping for the best I booked the room through them. It turned out to be legit (though it took them a few minutes to find our reservation... they had to call England or something) but we got the room at a good price-- all together for $145 CDN. Most hotels asked for a 3 or 4 minimum stay. The location is excellent: right on Michigan Avenue, close to everything, in The Loop area, which is excellent for transportation (subways, buses, cabs, you name it), but you can also walk to all the main streets and do some shopping. The rooms are spacious and clean... like I said, very nice for the price. We went to the pool, which was huge, nice and warm. The sauna was okay too. On a Tuesday, there was nobody else there. There was also a fitness room. TV had plenty of channels. The pillows weren't the greatest, but that's mostly because we're so used to our very own, comfortable bed and pillows. The only complain I would have is that the tub did fill up when I showered, and the water stayed there. The bathroom looked old, and yes, the tub was chipped, but it was clean and that was good enough. Oh, and we were close to the elevator, so it was quite noisy throughout the night. Other than that, the people at the front were very nice, the hotel was nice and I don't have any complaints, except for the clogged up tub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: bruges00
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days in Essex Inn. Location is very good, 10 mins walk from the very center of Chicago. Rooms are fairly large and perfectoly clean. The hotel has a pool and a small fitness room. Free internet connection also. Had a great stay and, for the price paid, seems to me a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JustDiSwih
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex 10/27-28 for our 27th Wedding Anniversary for one of the Chicago Bears' game package. This was our 2nd year in a row doing this as our anniversay gift to each other. When we checked in we found they had given us a suite!! We were amazed by the fabulous room with views across the Lake and to the right we could see the museums & Soldier Field. Every person was warm & friendly to us during our stay. The room was spotless. We also take the free shuttle downtown - and the driver is so wonderful for advice on what to see & where to eat. He even dropped us off right outside of our dinner spot. This is a wonderful place to stay and we would highly recommend this to anyone!! We love the Essex Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre accommodations on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWannabe_7
Reviews.Content: My priorities for our stay in Chicago were for the hotel to be downtown, as inexpensive as possible while still being clean. The Essex pretty much matched these expectations. We booked our hotel through a travel agent who used a 3rd party hotel wholesale company. We got a great weekend rate of $150/night including tax, which is about $129/night before taxes. Parking would have been an additional $30/night, but we parked in a public lot around the corner from the hotel for $12/night. Also, parking at some meters on the street is free after 9pm on Saturdays and all day Sunday. Since we booked through the wholesale company, it was not possible to confirm a nonsmoking room (as a former travel agent, I know this is common practice). And since we checked in at 8pm on a Friday night, the hotel was fully booked and there were only smoking rooms left. The room was very smoky smelling, as was the entire floor as soon as the elevator doors opened. The desk staff was gracious in finding us a different (though still smoking) room for Friday night and then moving us to a non smoking room for Saturday night. We had a room with 2 queen beds, which are really 2 full-sized beds. My husband and I sleep in a queen bed at home, but slept in separate beds at the Essex because there's no way we would have been comfortable in one bed. But the sheets were clean and the beds were comfy. The bathroom was clean, but not exactly gleaming, due to its need for updating and refurbishing. We did not use the pool or sauna, but only because we were out and about much of the time. Overall, this is a decent, no-frills hotel if you don't want to break the bank to be in downtown Chicago. The desk staff was courteous and the bellman was very friendly and helpful in directing us to public transportation. We spent much of our time at the funky bars and restaurants in the Lincoln Park area, which is probably where I would stay on future trips. But it was nice to be close to the impressive Grant park and the excitement and bustle of Michigan Ave. Also a good location to explore the museums and Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: lecko60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night on our trip across the USA. The location is great with the sightseer bus stop right at the front door. The room was spotless and very spacious. The staff were more than helpful especially the porters who helped us to organise our sightseeing tour. This is one of the best value for money hotels we have stayed in on our travels across the USA.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “I don't recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizp007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Essex Inn at the end of our two week Route 66 trip. This was by far the worst hotel we have stayed in, in 5 visits to the US. The room was very small and noisey being next to the lift, drinks machine & air con units on the roof just below us. When asked to be moved they said the hotel was full. There was no hotel information or area information in the room as it was 'being re-written'. I found the staff off hand, someof them in the one restaraunt almost rude. The not very clean bathroom had a small shower and no bathtub. I do not consider this a three star hotel and would not recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Had second thoughts.....”
Reviews.Author: brightis
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I rated our overall experience Above Average because some of the past reviews had me thinking that I was walking into a unclean hotel. Normally we stay in the River North Area but unfortuantely most of the decent hotels in that area were booked. So, we decided to book at the Essex and were very hesitant about it at first because it was an unfamiliar place and the reviews were not favorable. I was pretty much expecting the worse. Here are the positives about our stay... 1)checked in at 11:30 a.m. with no problem 2)free shuttle to the Pier (every hour) 3) free shuttle pick - up from the Hancock 4) immediate action concerning the fresh stains on our room carpet (great job housekeeping and the manager on duty!!!) 6) location (across the street from Grant Park = Buckingham Fountain 7) Savoy Bar and Grill (wide variety of items) 8) valet parking 9) 4th floor heated swimming pool and deck area (pool had to be about 75 degrees) The negatives...... 1)Valet parking (I cringed at paying 29.00 a day, we normally stay at a hotel that offers free parking to its guests) 2) room seemed too small for 2 adults and 3 young kids (we had 2 double beds) 3)location (other than grant park there wasn't much else in the area that we really wanted to see) 4) Savoy Bar and Grill prices were too high 5) rate I paid of 270.14 total Overall, we were satisfied with our stay at the Essex. Even though we weren't in a familiar area the Essex made it easy for us to get to our main destination (which was the pier). We were able to take the shuttle to the pier, then walk to the Hancock and then be picked up and taken back to the hotel. The kids enjoyed the pool and sitting outside on the terrace. I guess I just kind of wonder what the other posters expected. I by no means expected to be pampered but we were pleased with the hotel and with the customer service given by all staff and the immediate attention they gave to our problem. Would I stay at the Essex Inn again? Yes Would I recommend it to others? Yes Would I pay the same rate? No What would I pay? between 100 - 135

Reviews.Title: “essex inn, chicago”
Reviews.Author: straightsmouth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Chicago which is a beautiful city and well worth a visit. Lovely people, lovely buildings and views, lots to do. However, we had booked to stay at the Essex Inn on South Michegan Avenue, Chicago. Their website showed lovely rooms, and stated that it had been recently renovated! Not so - it is terrible. Please do not believe the photos, they are not appropriate. The wash basin and shower tray were all broken and the enamel had worn away. The walls were all chipped and stained and marked. The curtains were filthy as was the carpet which was covered in stains. The furniture was old and very chipped and broken. The light switches were old and looked "unsafe" and again not clean. I asked to be upgraded but it was full ( a local football match and the Chicago trialethon was in town) so they could only show us another room in the same state as ours. Needless to say we checked out the very next morning and booked into a fabulous hotel and had a super few days. We were only in Chicago for 4 nights and it could have entirely ruined our stay. Please be very careful if you do book this hotel. The pictures do not show it as it is and the description of "recently refurbished" gives and entirely wrong impression.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MMABTennessee
Reviews.Content: We will never stay here again! The room was damp all 4 days, even with the air conditioner running, so the bedding and everything we brought was damp, too. The bathroom floor was filthy. Bedside lamps and tables were grimy. The first time we went to use a "clean" towel, we discovered it had makeup all over one side - it had been folded to hide the dirty side. The worst part: We'd paid up front for the whole stay through a website, but found after we checked out the Essex Inn had also charged us for the room directly. This nearly $350 mistake on their part could have caused us major problems if we had not caught it. They did credit us the amount, but it took almost a week to correct the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges ruined our stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellinGirl07
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location of Chicago but there were some problems we had which have turned us off ever staying there again. On the plus side, the staff are friendly and helpful; the rooms are comfortable and clean (even though the plumbing system in the bathroom really needs to be updated-showering in water up to my ankles is not fun); the food in the restaurant is terrific, and the fact that it actually had a bar was a real plus for us. The problems with check-in and check-out are ridiculous. The bottle neck created by the queue of people trying to move around make it very awkward to speak to the receptionists. We also needed to send a fax from the hotel (something I have had no trouble doing in other hotels) but we were charged $5 just to send it, I personally thought this was a little extreme. We asked if we could store our bags for an hour while we went to eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant and we were charged 50c per bag to store them. I have never had to pay for a luggage room before, and I heard others around us complaining about the same thing. The dinner we had in the hotel restaurant was delicious, but it was when we paid our bill that we got ticked off. Though the waitress and the service were excellent, she placed our bill on the table before we finished eating, leaving out much chance of having a drink or dessert after dinner. What really annoyed us was that she had already added a gratuity of 18% onto the bill before we got it. I can understand this being automatically added to a bill when its a large party, but I've never seen it done when it's a party of 2. The other thing that annoyed me was, as far as Im concerned, is tipping not something that's supposed to be at the discretion of the customer? Since when did the waiters and waitresses start deciding how good they are at their jobs? We had fully intended in leaving her an excellent tip that suitably reflected the service but what if our service had been terrible-were we just expected to tip her regardless? All in all the hidden charged we incurred during our stay really put us off staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Location, Price & very comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: simpletraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Essex in 7/24 to 726/07 with 2 adults & 2 kids. Our room was clean & comfortable, location is great & the price can't be beat (compared to it's next door neighbor the upscale massive Chicago Hilton.) Across the street is Grant Park, walk a few blocks north then it's the Burnham fountain (don't miss it at night); few blocks more you're in Millenium Park (outdoor concerts, sculptures, fountains); walk through Grant Park towards lake & you're in Field Museum/Shed Aquarium and the lake. Even Sears tower, Chicago Board of Trade and Magnificent mile is walking distance. If walking is not your thing, taxis waiting right outside hotel, bus stops a block away and El train a few blocks walk. The room is small but appear larger with one wall all glass with view of park/lakeshore/museums/soldiers field. Bed was neatly made in all white high grade sheets, very fluffy pillow and down like comforter (just like home). Room was clean but stuffy at first. But after turning on AC to high & spraying room with a small car deodorizer I always bring with me when I travel, it smelled great. Bathroom was clean except for the small shower, which needs to really be replaced. There's a good size exercise room, indoor pool, and a balcony overlooking the park. Overall, we will definitely stay at Essex Inn next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: kjindc
Reviews.Content: I was chaperoning my Debate Team to a national competition. Our needs are few: space, quiet and comfort. The rooms were tiny, hot and not terribly clean. Service was slow. Check in is a nightmare because the check-in desk is located on a narrow strip--really just a wide hallway--opposite the elevators and on the main passage to the garage. Trying to fight your way through the mob to retrieve your car takes time. Just checking in takes time. The adjacent lobby is very small and, if there is a conference going on in the downstairs conference rooms, unavailable for regular guests. The only good thing about the hotel is that it runs a free shuttle service up and down Michigan Avenue. It's needed since the number of affordable restaurants in the immediate vicinity are limited. Not a good experience and I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: FSN
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Essex Inn for a week in June. We loved the location and spent a considerable amount of time at the Museum Campus, which was right across the street in Grant Park. Very easy to cross Michigan Avenue a block down from the hotel. Hotel shuttle was very handy; shuttle driver was extremely helpful and friendly. One day, there were problems with the shuttle bus' defroster (we had a couple downpours) but the next day, the hotel had an even newer shuttle bus. Pool and fitness room were above adequate. A terrace outside the pool on the forth floor was handy. On Wednesday and Sunday nights between Memorial and Labor Day, they shoot off fireworks from Navy Pier and the terrace provides an excellent view. Very easy to catch a cab from the hotel and the concierge did it for us. They held our luggage after check-out for only 50 cents a bag. We ate at the hotel's restaurant several times and found it to be very affordable and good! The elevators were slow at times and the room could've been bigger, but we weren't in it much. Very clean and helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Elevators”
Reviews.Author: Bezi
Reviews.Content: The main thing this hotel has going for it is its position overlooking the park. Rooms are very basic and in need of a re-furbishment. The wardrobe in my room was just a pole between two walls to hang your clothes on, no door just a pole! The worst thing about the place is the elevators, they are soooo slow. Long lines form, waiting for the magical event when one turns up! All in all a basic hotel in a prime position.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiMan
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. Friendly staff. Free Internet opposite the check-in desk. Good location in front of Grant Park. Michigan Avenue is very long so though you can walk downtown it gets tiring after the second day. Solution: Buy a bus pass for the number of days you are staying.Travelling by bus is easy and quite fast. Bus stops for both ways are just outside the hotel. The swimming pool is wonderful for a morning swim before you set off or after you come back in the evening. Buddy Guy's Legends Blues Club is a two-minute walk. Hotel also offers a free shuttle bus into town every hour on the hour. Conclusion: A very good, moderately priced hotel. Not for those seeking a luxury hotel very good for the price. Restaurant on the premises. Good American food and beers. By the way, Chicago is a very pleasant and clean city. Always felt safe around hotel and downtown. Try the Chicago Greeter Program that offers completely free (no tipping) private, guided walking tours of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimpleMan23
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, we learned that the pool, which was one of the main reasons for booking this hotel, was closed. No one informed us of this at the time we booked. When we got to our room, we found it to be very small, dirty (ants in the bathroom), and loud due to construction in the hotel. Again, a point that they failed to mention when we booked this hotel. We called the front desk for an upgrade. They agreed and put us in a "suite". This room, even though it was bigger, was still dirty and grungy. The floor of the tub, for whatever reason, squished when it was stepped on. We thought we had solved the noise problem but found in short time we were wrong. The room was adjacent to the elevator which could be heard running up and down all night long. Check-in/check-out was a hassle and the valet service was mediocre at best. Needless to say, our experience with the Essex Inn was horrible. I would not recommend staying at this hotel. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “No control of air conditioning in room.”
Reviews.Author: amdphoto
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was a two inch dead cockroach on the floor in front of the sink. We just threw it away, no big deal. The temperature on March 26, 2007 was warm for Chicago. The room was really muggy when we walked in. I went over to turn on the air conditioning and the button is gone. We called the front desk and they indicated that they control the heating and cooling and said if we wanted ventilation we would have to open the window (which has no screen in it; maybe that's how the cockroach got in????). it was humid so it was an uncomfortable night of sleep as well as uncomfortable getting ready the next morning.
