The lobby was extremely warm. I was sweating standing for five minutes checking out. The restaurant had good food and was very cool and comfortable. The omelets and hashbrown is really good. We only stayed one night to go to the taping of the Oprah show the next day. Great price ($95.20 total on (----)) but I would have definitely paid extra somewhere else for air conditioner control had I known we couldn't receive that there.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location for the Budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: tenntravelguy
Reviews.Content: Great location. Right next to the Chicago Hilton which was hosting a Chicago Bears convention while I was there. Got a spacious room for about $98 per night. The room was very comfortable although the hot water did not work properly in the shower. Not fun taking a shower in cold water during the winter in Chicago! The pool area was nice and the staff was friendly. The lobby was spacious as well. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but...”
Reviews.Author: goindyice
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight while attending a convention downtown. The location is great for the convention center or the museums, but a little south of the main restaurants and shopping. The room was small and extremely dirty looking. I am glad I didn't have my children with me! It was uncommonly warm during my stay in November, and the temperature in the hotel was not regulated well at all. I had my fan on "cool / high" but it wasn't working too well at all...just making noise. When I checked to see if it was possible to crack the window open, I was quite surprised to find that they tilted in and could be removed BUT there was no screen over the hole. It was so hot I decided to risk it, but kept waiting for birds (or Spiderman) to come flying into my room overnight. Pictures of the pool look nice, but I didn't have time to check it out on my trip. The bar was decent, with four or five beer choices on tap. The lobby was clean, but not much atmosphere as it was mostly brightly lit and open to pedestrian traffic. Overall the hotel was cheap, especially considering downtown Chicago prices...but you do get what you pay for with the Essex.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good for the art lover”
Reviews.Author: AB-in-DBQ
Reviews.Content: I picked up an English friend at O'Hare and we spent a night at the Essex before driving west. Booked through Orbitz, paid $91 ($78 plus taxes) for the room, $21 for parking. Access to hotel was convenient, check-in staff very pleasant. The room was large, beds comfy. Bathroom was on the small side and water pressure in shower wasn't great, but it was fine for one night. There are coffee makers in the room, but otherwise no breakfast. We ate dinner in the restaurant -- good selection, reasonable prices, very friendly service. One delightful thing about the Essex is the artwork in the rooms and halls. Instead of the usual generic junk, there are museum posters of all kinds -- Renaissance, Chinese, Abstract, photography, American Colonial, you name it. Charming, just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: Craxiter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while my wife was at a major conference including a venue at the Hilton like the previous reviewer. Unlike the previous two reviewers I did not find myself desperately needing scissors so cannot comment on that. An initial room with king bed was rather small so changed to a double-bedded room a bit farther back. Rooms are fairly standard with older style glass walls that let in noise. However Michigan Ave. is a lot less busy than I expected so this is not a major problem. I visited the pool and garden area which were very nice but spent almost my whole visit in museums so never really had time to use the pool. For a museum freak the location is excellent. I seem to be a bargain hunter in hotel rooms and in this location during a major conference, the bang for the buck was not as good as I normally get. But, that is in this location during a major conference, so what does one expect?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: shellee-ny
Reviews.Content: Paid $450 for 3 nights, 2 double beds. The hotel was really great for what I needed at tthe time. I needed a hotel close to the Hilton (for a conference). It's right next door. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I tried to borrow scissors, but someone else had them, so instead they let me borrow their paper cutter! The rooms were clean and of average size. The bathroom was fine enough, not that small. The hotel is close to museums, and there is a shuttle up to the Magnificent Mile. I really enjoyed my stay there, and if I had to be in the same location again, I would stay at the Essex Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent location, everything covered.”
Reviews.Author: greendream
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel ideal for our 5 day stay. The rooms were large and the beds comfortable and always well made. The reception staff were very willing to help with questions I had and even let me borrow scissors. There was a free hotel bus that took you to the town centre at regular intervals but it wasn't too far to walk. The pool and sauna were excellent. The pool area was heated so even on a cold october day it was very pleasant. We would stay here again and recommend it to others. Not as fancy as the Hilton next door but we got plenty quality for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Basically good”
Reviews.Author: av01bps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex because of the location (near the Field Museum for King Tut and the Ford Oriental for "Wicked") and were pleased with the location and staff. The room on the 11th floor was SMALL and the 2 double beds took up the whole space. TV worked fine. Bathroom was puny and the tub did not drain well. The pool was empty, lovely and clean. We had it to ourselves in the evening. The restaraunt was fine for breakfast. We were hardly in the room, but it was not a great place to hang out- for $250/night!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel, friendly service and good location”
Reviews.Author: sonderborg
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room and paid around $ 130 per night. The bathroom was very, very simple and outdated and reminded us about something you would find in a military hut. The room itself was ok and the bed was good and lifted up the overall impression. The hotel is outdated concerning interior and could use a renovation, the 2 elevators could not carry guests up and down fast enough and lines were often building up. The rooftop garden was great; the pool fine as well was the gym. The location is very good and the service personal was very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: CheapTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex September 14 - 15, 2006. We had a standard room with two beds on the fifth floor which overlooked the hotel's pool. The room was large enough for my family of three. The price was great ($140 including taxes, booked with our travel agent), the valet price and service were great ($21 per night vs. the Intercontinental's $45), and the location was great (directly across from Grant Park). We took the complimentary shuttle, which stopped at the Art Institute, Navy Pier and John Hancock Building. The taxi from the Navy Pier was $9 plus tip. The hotel's size and quality reminded me of hotels I've stayed at in London and Paris. The rooms were decent size, although the beds were short. The bathroom was a little worn, but the linens and bedding were clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly, including the front desk, valet, and shuttle driver. We have stayed at chain hotels in the suburbs and at the House of Blues Hotel at Marina City. This hotel was a good compromise of the suburb's prices and the HOB's convenient location. One complaint - we had a package delivered to the hotel the morning of our arrival. I confirmed the delivery with USPS Priority Mail, but the front desk wasn't able to find my package after repeated requests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Essex Inn”
Reviews.Author: tippysu
Reviews.Content: We had the BEST view in a lovely corner room at the Essex Inn. The king sized bed seemed larger than normal kings. We could see the tall downtown buildings to our left, we overlooked Grant Park and the lake in the front and could see the aquarium and planetarium to our right. We could view Buckingham fountain erupt hourly from our room and see the fireworks at Navy Pier, all without leaving our room. The only minor inconvenience was the small bathroom - but no big deal. The management was MORE than friendly and the free shuttle was convenient. Often we were the only riders who were taken directly to our destination. There are two free computers to use on the first floor, a big bonus. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandym2907
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel. Just came back from a 2 night stay with my two teenage sons. We went to see King Tut and had a great time. The room had two double beds with new bedding, the room was clean, and the bathroom looked like it was recently renovated. We used the free shuttle to the John Hancock building, which was great and saved us a cab fare. We ate breakfast in the restaurant once and although a bit on the pricey side, the food was ample and good. Location is great next to Grant Park and the Museums. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to others and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: vmcla
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find nothing really out of place at this hotel. This is the first one star hotel I've stayed at ... plus some of the scathing reviews here had me a bit worried. But it was clean; everything worked; superb location; comfortable bed; friendly housekeepers. Yes the elevator was quirky (wouldn't always recognize when a button had been pushed); and the air conditioning could have been drier. But for the price, it might be one of the better deals in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: butchielove
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here in July 2006. Great location to get around the city. We had a CTA visitor pass that allowed us to travel unlimited on any trains and busses for a few dollars a day - bought it at the train station at Midway. Very easy to hop on any bus on Michigan Ave. outside the hotel and transfer as needed. Room was clean, cool (since temperature outside was 100 degrees), and beds/pillows were terrific. Pool was lovely, along with an outside patio by the pool. Not a fancy lobby or restaurant, but room was adequate size and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the Essex Hotel for my first trip to Chicago for its location, and the amenities it described on its website. The location could not have been better, but we were disappointed with our room, and felt a little let down based on what we thought we'd be getting. The room was spacious, but pretty outdated (especially the bathroom, that was in pretty rough shape, although in working order and clean). We had a fantastic view of Michigan Avenue, and were greeted by friendly and courteous staff, even when we checked in at 2am. Overall, it was ok - ok enough that when I return to Chicago in a few weeks, I will be staying there for a second time. Great location and friendly staff help you to overlook some of the "quirks". Side note though...the "American Gothic" print over the bed was a little creepy. :P

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel ever. The first room I was put in smelled like cheap hotel cleaning products AND the windows were bolted shut. The room was dirty and dingy and the light was broken. When I turned on the air conditioner unit it shook so much the bed vibrated!!!! The shower was dirty and the shower head shot the water out in a hard thin stream - I thought it would poke my eye out. The hotel staff put me in another room the next day. It was moderately cleaner but the bath would back-up so there was about 6 inches of water in the tub before you finished your shower. AND - as I was getting ready to leave I heard my door open. THE STAFF GAVE KEYS TO MY ROOM TO ANOTHER GUEST!!!!! I had to stay at the Essex because due to several conferences in Chicago it was quite literarlly the only hotel with rooms available. I'd never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was gross!”
Reviews.Author: agbwab
Reviews.Content: The two rooms we had were awful! They appeared dirty and dated. There were chocolate crumbs on the very dirty looking bathroom floor, grime on the front of the dresser and cigarette burns in the drapes. The room smelled like "dirty hair." We would not have felt comfortable staying there at all. This room was comped for us by another company, and we instead opted to go next door to the Hilton and PAY for a room! The rooms we were assigned certainly did not go through any kind of a renovation! We had a lovely stay NEXT DOOR!

Reviews.Title: “Mummy's the word”
Reviews.Author: BEREA BON VIVANT
Reviews.Content: With Tut at The Field Museum through Jan. 1, 2007, the Essex is among the hotels offering a package that includes two tickets to the exhibition. For $199 we got the room with king-sized bed, hotel parking ($21 value) and the untimed tickets. These are super since you're not locked into a set time and also give you immediate entry with no waiting in the lengthy lines. The hotel lobby has been decorated in an Ancient Egypt mode, and a courtesy shuttle at 9:30 a.m. or 10:30 a.m. will take you to the museum. Such a deal! As other reviewers have noted, the elevators are very slow, and the bathrooms could certainly be upgraded. Overall, however, we were satisfied with our choice because of the package and the hotel's location and affordability.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Lakeffect
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of the King Tut package that included one night stay, 2 tickets to King Tut exhibit, overnight valet parking and all taxes for $218. Room was very clean, bathroom needed updating but was clean and the shower water pressure was great (much better than the W Hotel). They offer a shuttle to the museums and Michigan Ave shopping. Our anytime ticket allowed us to bypass all the lines at the Tut exhibit which was great. Overall the staff was courteous and helpful. Not the fanciest place to stay but it was clean and convenient. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: History_Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was somewhat impressed. The rooms were cozy and the hotel lobby was beautiful. I encourage anyone who stays here to make good use of their free shuttle services, which can almost eliminate totally the need for taxis. One of the drivers of the free shuttle was so outgoing and gave fantastic advice. The restaurant inside the hotel, The Savoy Grill, was extremely good, cheap, and fast. However, we did have a few problems. Our shower took forever to drain, the staff working the front desk were, on the whole, unhelpful and uninformative about the hotel amenities. The room was lacking a guide to these complimentary offers and to the hotel in general. Charges for local calls were outlandish. Also, the housekeeping seemed to arrive extremely early in the morning - sometimes as early as 7:30, which is fine if you are visiting for business, but not so good if you are there on vacation. The biggest selling point is its location - just minutes from almost all of the important landmarks and activites including the Shedd, the Field Museum, John Hancock Observatory, and the Navy Pier, to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Essex was Good Clean Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In May 2004, we stayed at the Essex Inn. We were on a budget and we paid Â£55 a night for me, my wife and 2 girls aged 5 and 18 months for 7 nights. It was great value. View was not great and some of things did not work but the staff fixed them promptly when notified. It was in a good location and the staff were friendly. The TV was good, it had disney channels which kept the kids occupied when we were in the room. However, the swimming pool was not the cleanest with dead flies floating around. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a cheap deal with basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “I Had Better Rooms in Prison”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex when it was supposedly a three-star hotel, a week after our stay, the rankings went down to a 1 star hotel.... If this is a one star hotel then, motels are two stars. We thought we were getting such good value when we booked it, I would have paid ten times more to stay somewhere else!!! The rooms were dingy, the sheets looked dirty, we were afraid there were going to be cockroaches. The shower didn't drain, and over all, it was a nasty place to stay. Don't be fooled by the lobby!!! If you're thinking of coming to Chicago, stay somewhere in the Gold Coast or on the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Pool with a view”
Reviews.Author: rickophoto
Reviews.Content: The Essex Inn is in a good spot for access to the museum campus. It is only a short walk thru some pedestrian tunnels from Michigan Avenue. With its small but stylish lobby and front desk, the Essex is a no frills hotel in a fairly quiet spot. The room was somewhat small but clean. The maid was helpful when requests were offered. The bathroom is quite small especially when helping younger children get ready for the day or shower off after the pool. The pool is the best part of the Essex. It is on the fourth floor over looking Michigan Avenue. It sits in this huge atrium that also houses the finess center. The water was warm and the pool size was decent. It has a depth of eight feet and a dedicated lane for laps. The sauna and showers were working and accessible. Plenty of chairs boardered the pool deck. And don't forget they have a lifeguard on duty that inforces the rules. The Essex has slow and unreliable elevators. When I asked for a guide to the amenities and services of the hotel (there was not one in the room) the front desk could not produce one and seemed puzzled by the request. The Savoy Grill in the lobby of the Essex is servicable but not outstanding. The convience is good but the prices steep. The food is okay. It was a good choice with children due to the menu choices and quick service. The Essex has shuttles to Michigan Ave and the Museum Campus. It is a short walk to the Red Line. I would return to the Essex but only for a rate cheaper than we obtained on Travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful, unexpected surprise. Was in Chicago for a conference and just by luck, was booked into the Essex. It is the only place I'll stay when in Chicago again. The staff was as welcoming as a French auberge, the location is right in the middle of everywhere you need or want to go, the beds are to die for, and if you're in need of a swim, the pool is a dream. Don't miss this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Essex”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Essex with my daughters, a "girls" holiday filled with shopping and museums. What a fabulous bargin and location. The staff was friendly and helpful, and transportation to shoppping areas was hotel provided. Because of the hotels location we were able to walk to the great museums of Chicago. The kids loved the pool while I was so impressed with the comfortable and luxurious bedding. I highly reccomend the hotel for those looking to spend their money on entertainment and the great shopping and not all the unnecessary "extras" provided by higher priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Value Value Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Essex Inn on a trip to Chicago in mid January and thought it was one of the better value hotels I have experienced in a major metropolitan city. Plain and simple this hotel represents value, location and service. If you want a huge impersonal cookie cutter chain hotel, this is not for you. If you want the best bang for the buck, this hotel is for you. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We went for my birthday and couldn't even sleep in one bed. Not only was there hair on the blankets and pillows, there was also mold on the shower curtain, the celing in the bathroom and hallway, and around the floor in the bathroom. My friend had an allergic reaction to something in the room (she went to her doctor when we got home and found it was the mold) and swelled horribly. My other friends, who were in another room, didn't notice anything amiss. However, they are males, and were quite happy watching t.v. The hotel lobby is nice, and the desk receptionist was kind. However, we had numerous issues with the hotel itself, and we will NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: DiverDenver
Reviews.Content: For $79/night, it was a fine value. We were there just one night. The location is very convenient. I never utilized 'service', but questions were answered with knowledge. There is Buddy Guy's Blues Club across the street. Free internet service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Multituba
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Essex for a convention that was happening next door at the Hilton - if you want Hilton prices and service then stay at the Hilton, I found the Essex to be OK for the money I paid. Had ample space in the room, the maid service was very good, the room was somewhat noisy especially on the Saturday night with the football fans in on a cheap weekend away package. Food in the Restauraunt was OK if not spectacular, the service was very quick. Internet access was OK but with just 2 terminals on a busy day you might have to wait. The Essex is a first rate location for getting out and about round the Chicago sights. Would I stay there again, quite likely. But - keep an eye on the taxes on the bill at the end, they run to about 13% - not nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Families”
Reviews.Author: shaliach
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families. Free high speed internet + printer / Game room for kids / Great indoor pool/exercise room / Free frequent shuttle to museums & shopping / Public transportation-nearby-buses & trains / Great location (next block is the Hilton!)-close to downtown /Reasonable rates / Extras-like 3 pillows on each bed & warm comforter / Friendly, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but you need some give and take.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK, this is a hotel on Michigan Ave. but not the best. For the price you are going to get great service which includes the Bell persons, front desk and even parking personnal. We have stayed here twice now and come back for the conveience, location and service. The pool and work out area are very nice. The rooms need updating very badly. The bathr rooms are SMALL and may have the hair dryer pulled from the wall and no heat lamp bulb although there is a recepticle. My wife noticed one overhead light cover was covered in God knows what... If you get a room on the east side you will have a nice view of the lake but if you are on the west very end your room will be about 200 sq. ft. smaller. They have a nice but small free internet area...The bar/lounge/resturant looked nice...but the ealy afternoon we went to the bar for a drink before a Bears game we found the bar packed with one hungover bartender that was slow. I did see a guy behind the bar who was a employee but got offended when I tried to place an order. So if you are a family looking for a great location and nice pool (indoors) to keep the family occupied or a fan of a local team in Chicago (packages available)going to the game this place is for you! If you want your bed turned down at night with a piece of candy on it you have to go next door to the Hilton which is very nice....but bring your extra wallet....

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: vcapp
Reviews.Content: Dirty Dirty Dirty. You see the picture of the headboards? Well every 2" crevice has years of old dust. If you're allergic, beware. The bathroom needed major plaster repair and a good steam cleaning. Location. In the middle of nowhere. Had to walk blocks for a decent cup of coffee in the morning. There's no retail stores within 6 blocks. coffee is horrible. The only way to real milk/cream in your coffee is to buy a $2 glass of milk from the restaurant. Restaurant food is worse. McDonalds has less grease. It is next to the park, but why go to Chicago for a park? The "free shuttle" doesn't run very often; lunch and dinner breaks are endless. I am told there exists a newly renovated section; I didn't see it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: J0Murphy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week long stay at the Essex inn in Chicago. I was a bit apprehensive when i booked the hotel as some of the reviews were not very positive. While the lobby and hall decor is a bit dated, I was definitley very impressed with the hotel. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean, staff were extrememly friendly and helpful and fresh towels were provided daily. The location of the Essex Inn was ideal in that it was within walking distance of most of the city's tourist attractions and most importantly the magnificent mile shopping district. I would definitley recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Essex is surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: RichAromas
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from my room at the Essex Inn. I was VERY worried about what I'd find here, after reading some of the other reviews. Honestly, either I must have very low standards, or these other folks must be accustomed to places like the Fairmont, because this hotel is FINE. To be fair, there are a couple of minor issues. The good - Right on Michigan Avenue, directly across from Grant Park. Friendly staff (they happily loaned me an extension cord). Good rates for being in the city. Close to the museum complex, free shuttle there. WiFi for $3.95 per day. Clean, bright room (ok, so the decor is dated). Inexpensive guest laundry on site. Convenient restaurant with acceptable food. The bad - Beds are too short - not too small, too SHORT. I'm only 5'8", and my feet hang over the end of the bed. Sleeping on a diagonal solves this. BTW, I've already cut myself on one of the protruding pieces of the bed frame - be careful! No comfortable chair in the room. 2 desk chairs and the beds. Not much around here by way of other restaurants, though there is a good blues joint just a block away. The neutral - Yes, the bathroom is rather small, but I am a very large man and have had no difficulties with the shower, as someone else implied. Honestly, the place is clean, comfortable, inexpensive, and convenient. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this dump for the Chicago Marathon. The prices were inflated because of the marathon. The hotel room was dirty, the tub did not drain, they did not have fitted sheets, and the last day the toilet stopped working. When we asked to be given the marathon rate (a steal at 189.00)they finally agreed, however, our entire credit never posted and we had to argue with them a month later to get the credit they issued...I even had the receipt from them!!!! I would never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice. I am in no way a prude (Hey, I am a Chicago Bears fan- just a bear drinking, football loving gal). The only reason we returned a second time, is because they have Chicago Bears ticket packages and we wanted to get tickets. They have very few ammenities. The pool and workout room seem OK. There is a cheesy bar- attached to a restaurant (the restaurant serves Dennys style food). The bar attracts some seedier types, in the later evening hours. I wasn't comfortable there. The "outdoor garden" was a weed patch. That's ALL they have. The rooms were not easy to climate control. The walls are very thin and the plumbing very LOUD. I did not sleep well all night. Carpets are filty and bathrooms in need of renovation. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I am surprised that the Chicago Bears organization would even allow the organization to be linked to this level of trash, with the number of awesome hotels we have downtown. Heck, they even host the Bears convention in the Hilton across the street. Much nicer hotel. Stay there instead! If you do the Bears package through the Essex because you want tickets- go to the Hilton for your meals and beverages.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff-Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was the only thing acceptable at a recent stay at the Essex in Chicago. Carpets were dirty and stained, paint was peeling in the bathrooms, and the general condition was run-down. This might be ok if in Chicago for a football game or frat party but it isn't acceptable for most business travel. Take your shower shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best BUT Not the Worst Either”
Reviews.Author: lindalouhue
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Essex Inn at about 10:30 in the morning. We were not able to check in right away but they did hold our bags for us. We went to the Cards/Cubs game and returned to check in. Everything went smooth and fine. Yes, I will admit the decor is a bit outdated but we had a clean room and a pretty good view of the Lake and the area Museums. If you like to walk, it is in walking distance to the Museums and the parks are right across the street. Easy access to all bus stops and "L" trains. They even have a shuttle to the Navy Pier. The Bellman was of great help in recommending places to eat and how to get to alot of the attractions. If you like to live in Luxury then don't stay here. If you like a clean place to lay your head and is close to everything then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room had cobwebs in the corners, a leaking faucet, paint chips and bare wood showing on the bathroom door, a difficult to operate heating/cooling device, plus an inconsiderate desk clerk. (The bellman and parking attendants were extremely efficient and helpful.) When we checked in, the desk clerk said it would be OK to write a check for the stay instead of using the credit card with which we guaranteed the room. Since I found I had forgotten my checkbook, I had my assistant "Next Day Air" me the check to pay for the room, resulting in an additional $21+ to the cost of our trip. When we tried to check out with my BUSINESS check, it was refused by the "desk manager" and we had to use a credit card I did not want to use. The attitude of the "desk manager" was not conducive to good customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KCE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Essex Inn for five nights at the end of August. For this we payed Â£525.00 expecting a basic room. After a cordial welcome we were given a spacious room, nicely furnished with a king size bed and floor to ceiling windows overlooking Grant Park and the Lake. (Just in time for a firework display). The bathroom was small and the tub had seen better days but everything was kept perfectly clean. Linen was changed a number of times (by choice it could have been every day). There was plenty of staff (always a good sign) and they were friendly, helpful and efficient. Bar prices were reasonable as were restaurant meals. We have pleasant memories of our Chicago vacation - helped by our choice of hotel which is well located.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for! Close to Grant Park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, out-dated and dirty. Our room was clean, however the wall paper was peeling off of the ceiling! There was no light bulbs in the lamps, the carpets had lots of stains! The decor was outdated! The location of the hotel is great! It is close by the free Trolleys, and the staff was helpful! The food in the restaurant was over-priced and nasty! I will never eat there again! My husband, my daughter, and I enjoyed the fact of getting our room earlier than we expected, but maybe if we waited, we could've got a better room! I doubt it! If you want to stay close by the festivals this hotel (South Michigan) would be the place, and if you do not care about the atmosphere, then Essex Inn is the place for you! It is also central location for the Loop, and around lots of Mcdonalds, starbucks, garrett's popcorn, and subway restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Getto-fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned home from a 2 night stay at the Essex Inn and I should have listen to this reviews before booking our stay there! Although the hotel was great price-wise for poor college students I would never stay there again! When checking in we signed a sheet of paper locking us into our hotel rate and gave them our credit card information...we then found out the next day after taking money out of an ATM and getting our receipt that they took over $100 more out of our checking then they were suppose to! We went and spoke the them immediately and were then told that they take an extra $50 out each day incase there is something wrong with the room. We never were told this or agreed to let them take the money off our card. The whole thing seemed a little sketchy and although it has only been a day since we left that money has still not been placed back onto our account! Although I did take the low price into consideration the place is a rat hole and the only thing nice about it was the artwork in the hallways. I felt like I needed to keep my shoes on the entire time I was in my room and bathroom looked like some nasty Frat house bathroom....the floors were disturbing and the water would not turn off all of the way so it ran constantly. Also... The second day that we were there we placed the "do not disturb" sign on the door because we were taking a nap before our next outing...and about an hour later we were woken up by a loud pounding on our door and then moments later someone tried to open the door and would have been able to walk right in if it weren't that we had latched it...we then realized it was housekeeping and then got really pissed off!... So the moral of the story is, stay further up on Michigan, in the end the price isn't worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Essex Inn at Grant Park great hotel value”
Reviews.Author: TACO2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Essex Inn in Chicago a few months ago and were pleasantly surprised but both its value and amenities. The inn is neatly kept if not quite old, but the lobby has been renovated in quite a modern fashion. The restaurant in the lobby has hearty pub food as well as a fully stocked bar. The rooms have VERY small bathrooms, but nice and neat bedrooms, and upgrading to a suite is WELL worth it. For an extra $50 per night (on top of a VERY moderately priced typical room rate), we went from an average hotel room to a hotel room plus spacious living room on one of the top floors with floor to ceiling windows that made the view worth the price of the upgrade. Staff is friendly and the gym is worth checking out for its very large indoor swimming pool and outdoor rooftop sitting area. Overall, very pleased with this little known Grant Park accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you have small children!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets your average criteria for clean and decent. But that's it. The rooms are small and so are the bathrooms but not any smaller than a Comfort Inn or Best Western. TV's were fine. Towels were good. Miad service did their job. But remember this hotel is an older hotel and it's age is showing. The decor is late 70's green and yellow. Some things to consider though that may change your mind about this place if you can get past the above noted are: If you have children, especially small children, the rooms have an entire wall of glass - great for the view but not so great for kids. The bottom 1/3 of this glass wall is windows with no screens or grates or any protection. The windows can be opened!!!! We had 2 rooms. In one room the windows handles were removed and the windows were bolted. In the other room, the handles were on the windows and one of them was not bolted. Our 3 year old son was able to open the window. We were on one of the top floors. This is very scary! Our shower was virtually a trickle, while the other room's (adjoining) was full blast. We wouldn't have hot water and the next room would (late at night). Beds are for people no taller than 5'8" or so. Very short. Hubby is 6'3" and even sleeping diagonal it was too short. I'm 5'10" and my feet hung over. We drove to Chicago and were aware that there was a parking fee of $20 a night. However, if you drive a vehicle higher than 6' or longer than an average size car - your special fee is $30 a night. (We had a large SUV). And if you want to take it in/out - count on another $10. Pool is great. Kids loved it, except for the "lifeguard's" dinner break when they close the pool from 5-6:15. ????? Internet rate is the best for this average hotel. Don't pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy”
Reviews.Author: emmaattic
Reviews.Content: Someone reviewed and named the Essex a Rathole. Totally correct. Someone is either lying, or posting reviews from the management if they say this is a decent hotel for the money. STAY AWAY. You can find other hotels at same rate that at least are not scary. SCARY. SEEDY. TACKY. TACKY. TACKY. Has anyone told you the halls and part way up are covered in old, dirty, LEOPARD carpeting .... the elevators get stuck regularly, and no one cares. Onto "little" things -- did anyone tell you there is NO MAIN ENTRANCE by which you can pull up and have a bellman get your bags, or even take the bags in yourself? NO, you must drive around and back up a little side street (8th) and ENTER with car and bags underneath the hotel in a little parking garage and go in that way. YUCK. Doesn't it raise a red flag when one reviewer said the "Security Guard" made our restaurant reservations??????!!!!!!!!!! There you go. That's what you are in for. The rooms are small, but that's ok. I can live with that. But dirty. And another reviewer said, "it was fine because food was not ground into the carpet at least!" Wow. Now that's discerning. And actually, I did see unnamed spots in carpet that I wasn't about to get close to. Wore my shoes even in the middle of the night. Finally switched hotels. Not that it matters, what with everything else, but the shower is so tiny that I could not move without bumping my elbows; how do men do it? And a big man just could not. Basically, it is dirty, unsafe, and the worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Essex Inn on Hotwire at a very good rate not knowing which hotel I was getting. After reading the negative reviews on tripadvisor, I was very apprehensive about my stay as I had booked 5 nights. In our case, we had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is very clean, in a good location, and the service by the maids, bellman, front desk, and porters is excellent. The hotel pool and fitness room is top-notch, although the pool was a little cold for my daughter to enjoy herself. I would recommend this hotel as long as you can get a decent rate and aren't expecting the latest decor, fancy bathrooms, or spacious 4-star accomodations. Save yourself some money by getting a CTA visitor pass. The bus stop is right across the street and will take you to all of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Essex Inn excellent value for location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Essex Inn, it's located on Michigan avenue across the street from the Hilton, and Grant Park. The room was clean, sunny, and all the staff were friendly, the cost of the room was quite reasonable. The Inn provided shuttle service to all of the shops on Michigan Avenue. I'll be staying there again in June!

Reviews.Title: “Essex is fine”
Reviews.Author: VINEYBOY
Reviews.Content: For a cheap budget weekend. I think the Americans have a little different expectations on the size of the room - as by UK standards the room was fairly large. So for any UK people going to Chicago for a weekend - then I would say that the Essex is clean and comfortable, and occupies a great location between all the nightlife and shps of North Michigan Avenue and the Museum capmus at the southern end of Michigan Avenue. When we checked in there were a few complaints being made about room service - but we were missing a TV remote - but within 5 minutes of reporting this a replacement was brought to the room.

Reviews.Title: “cheap or luxury?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a night in March. When we first walked in we were impressed by the look of the lobby area. We were a little concerned when we were waiting to check in and a lady was complaining about the housekeeping service. The staff was friendly, but didn't put forth the effort to give any information about the hotel or the area, nor was there information in the room. The room was clean, but small and out dated. It was close to attractions and the shuttle service to N. Michigan was nice. The web site makes it look more appealing than what it really is. This is a good place if you are just looking for a cheap place to crash, but if you are looking for luxury look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Essex Inn...Never Again”
Reviews.Author: rollin59
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel once and never again. What a rathole. The room is small and dated, the overall feel of the hotel is 1970s (in a bad way), and my 9th floor room faced a line of noisy buses that sat idling all night, besides other traffic and El noise. Was so bad I checked out and moved to a different hotel the next day. Awful! Pay a few bucks more and stay at: Club Quarters, Hilton, Swissotel, Embassy Suites, Hyatt, Sheraton, Radisson, or one of 100 other nice Chicago hotels, but skip this one, unless it's practically free.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Essex needs a serious overhaul. From the drywall tape peeling from the hallway ceilings and wall paper peeling in the bathroom. Along with a bathroom floor that hasn't been scrubbed or even lightly mopped. Plus the bath tub was absolutely filthy and whatever was painted on it was peeling off of the bottom, too. I am not sure what was on the walls of the bathroom around the toilet but it was absolutely gross. The stain under the table by the beds was pretty disgusting too. It's too bad we didn't see these things until we came back to the room later in the evening. The staff was nice and so was the pool area. These are the only things decent about the Essex. If you can, avoid it all costs! It is not worth one penny.

Reviews.Title: “This was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are a LOT of bad reviews of this hotel, so I was a bit concerned, but it was the cheapest by far and not being picketed, as the Congress Plaza was. It was fine. There wasn't a view and the pool and workout area were closed, but the room was reasonably clean and the staff were helpful enough. Worth the price, but nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Erase the Essex”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home to Milwaukee Wi, from an overnight trip to the Windy City, our stay at the Essex was not what we expected from what we read in their website. The room was disgusting to say the least upon entering the room on the 12th floor we encountered in odd odor, the thermostat did not work we had to crack the window open in December just to get somewhat comfortable. The bathroom was dingy and the tub stained. and to top it off our room was near in area were you could here the "L" train all night. The only positive we found was the free shuttle to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave shopping. Be careful when choosing hotels their are other hotels slightly higher but they are worth it. Never Again from Milwaukee

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Minkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with a couple of friends back in October. It was sort of a late honeymoon and we were very excited to enjoy all the fun that Chicago has to offer. We booked and paid for the room online and presented the reciept at the front desk when we checked in. That night, however, when I checked my bank account to check on our spending money, the hotel had put a $300 authorization on my card, even though my room was already paid for! (Not to mention that a room doesn't even go for that much!) That left us with no money for our vacation, and would have overdrafted my account if the authorization had gone through. I went downstairs to get an explanation and was (not very politely) told that no one on duty at that time could help me, and I should come back at 8AM! So I dragged myself out of bed at 7:30 only to find that a bill for $150 for the room had been slipped under my door! Now I was very upset, and when I went downstairs I was made to wait 20 minutes for the hotel accountant. Whe he finally showed up, he was not very pleasant, and although he removed the authorization from our account and room charge from the bill, he offered no explanation and an apology of"sorry 'bout that". We then had to pay a $21 parking fee (not bad for Chicago, but you'd think they would waive it after what we'd been though!). Whatever you do don't stay here! The shabby rooms are NOT worth the price, and although the location is pretty good, the service is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “acceptable bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: dec 7,8 2004. samantha at reception was friendly and accomodating. not a lot of staff but all were helpful and friendly. old hotel but clean and functional. bathrooms are small but work as advertised. 3 blocks from harrison (red line), 5 from (roosevelt) orange line from midway. some panhandlers in neighborhood but no moreso than all along michigan ave. only 2 elevators so sometimes a delay. EXCELLENT pool and workout facility with professional equipment just begging for more use. found $61 rate on orbitz for weekdays. we will stay there again if rates remain this low.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. There were holes in the carpet and something that looked like food ground into it. The bathroom and shower were very small and dated. The green tile in the bathroom was missing in some spots. On the elevator, you have to go through the storage room to get to the lobby. Stay at the Swissotel on Wacker! It's much better. Check Travelzoo for great specials!
